Now imagine these same gladiators having to play second fiddle to poor-little-rich-boy Pavo.Fireworks have seen less gunpowder.What I like about Simon and his writing is that his stories are very entertaining and you can trust that each book, or installment in this case, will be the same way. It is violent in a way that isn't gratuitous but still in your face. He has drama that is almost concrete because of the way it makes you feel, but not that cheesy two-minute drama that we ALL hate.The only thing missing is the women... with as much crap as these two have to put up with I wish there was a way I could give them coin. You know... a donation to the Macro and Pavo Foundation for the Needy. Ah hell, get this volume and then impatiently wait for the final two installments.  If you've been following this series you'll notice that the release dates have been changed. 'Arena:Revenge' is now May 23rd and 'Arena: Champion' is now July 18th.One last thing: do NOT read the synopsis they have posted for the not yet released eBooks in this series.  If you're a follower they will contain spoilers.

The pros:- Fits well in your hand and the rubber gripping is very nice.- Attractive and minimalist in design.- Very responsive to the screen.  I used this on my iPad 2, iPhone 4s, and iPad 4.- Very accurate.The cons:- The little plastic dampening clip can come off.- To protect the dampening clip from coming off this stylus must have a cover.- This cover get annoying because you have to take it on and off all too often.- You can't keep the top off because you run the chance of that dampening clip popping off and getting lost.So I do like this stylus, but because of the detachable-prone dampening clip I only find myself using this stylus only when I'm going to be at my iPad for a while and not for short clips.

This is a very nice Santa figurine that is perfect for Christmas around your home.  It is extremely nice!  The figurine is large enough to place on a mantel or a table and while people will notice it, it is not too large that it dominates your decorations.  It is well made (glass) and comes with a light inside.  The light flickers like a candle which is very nice.The only drawback for mine is that the on-off switch is hard to move.  It hurts my fingers!  I suppose this could just be mine.Overall, I am very satisfied with this figurine.  It is very nice and will be a welcomed edition to our Christmas decorations.

This is a very nice, bright looking computer backpack.  It features two zipped areas both full of pockets for pens, pencils, etc.  It also includes a pocket for your headphones.  It has two straps for either arms to use to carry the backpack.  It is comfortable while wearing (depends on the weight of your computer to how heavy the backpack feels but mine is light and so the pack was light).  The material seems durable.If you are looking for a backpack that is bright in color, well made, and offers lots of space for carrying things, this pack is for you.  I don't carry my laptop to work yet I still use this pack.  It is that nice!

This is a nice sync dock.  It is durable, not too colorful (I like that), and best of all it works.  I simply plug my iPhone 5S into this dock and it sits by my bed all night.  I often use my phone during the night for the time so this sits upright on my night stand.  The charge seems to be regular speed which is fine while I sleep.  My iPhone is fully charged each and every morning!The cord is not very long which is a drawback and the iPhone is hard to pull out if you get a call but on the other hand, you don't want the phone falling off the charger each time you want to check your phone for the time or messages.Overall this is a well made dock.  I highly recommend it.

Molina is a misunderstood theologian.  Calvinists object to him because they see him as nothing more than an Arminian.  Arminians see Molina as one of their forefathers.  In reality, Molina and his theology is his own.  Molinism is now often known as "middle knowledge."  In this book, Dr. Kirk MacGregor seeks to help Christians understand the man Molina as well as the theology that follows from him in Molinism.  Prominent Molinists today would be Dr. William Lane Craig.This book is a welcomed edition to students of theology.  I have Molina's works but I admit that his writings are difficult to understand.  Molina truly was a great thinker.  I often have seen Molina as more of theological philosopher than a biblical exegete who wrestled with Scripture.  While I have tipped my hat to middle knowledge regarding God's sovereignty and man's freedom, I admit that Molina always seemed distant from me.  As an Arminian, I knew that Arminius borrowed from Molina and many have suggested that it was reading Molina that greatly influenced Arminius' view of God's sovereignty and His foreknowledge of all things.  While this may be true, I was unaware of the differences between Arminius and Molina's theology.  I knew Molina rejected Calvinism but how his theology differed from Arminianism, I could not tell.In this book, Dr. MacGregor not only covers the theology of Molina but also how his theology interacts with modern Reformed theology as well as Arminianism.  MacGregor shows that Molina is not pure Catholic theology nor but is very much his own.  MacGregor also shows how Molina dealt with the Scriptures.  This was my favorite part of the book!  In chapter 5, MacGregor shows Molina's doctrine of predestination.  Here Molina interacts with the biblical texts.  Again, I thought Molina was more philosophical but in reality, Molina wrested with the texts.Overall, this book should be read by all serious disciples of Jesus.  As an Arminian, I differed here and there with Molina's views.  For example, Molina rejects the concept of corporate election of which I hold.  While I respect Molina's middle knowledge view in regards to election, I feel that he favors Calvinism too much in this place.I highly recommend this great book.  Easy to read.  Easy to grasp.  Not over the top in the language.  Well done Dr. MacGregor!

Great sturdy scooter. Very similar to the razor brand in my opinion. It came basically ready to ride. We just had to insert the handle bars which is super easy and then flip it up from the folded position, which is equally as simple.  It's on the small size but it fits our 9 year old perfectly. Our 11 year old who is taller than average can definitely ride it but you can tell he's not quite as comfortable on it as his brother (and that's at the highest of the adjustable heights).  There is a convenient rear brake but the boys say it's easier to just put their foot on the ground to stop. The wheels seem well made. The part they put their feet on is rough like sandpaper kind of so they don't slip around on it.  We like it and are pleased with it.

This game is so fun! Our family loves this game and we have played and played it since receiving it! Not like regular tic tac toe at all, except for getting 3 of your pieces in a row. Each play gets 6 game pieces, 2 of each sizes.  You assemble the playing board with the 4 interlocking pieces. The rules are so different, you can gobble up your opponents men if you have a gobbler bigger than their piece.  You can even move one of your men that you've already played on the board. Lots of strategy and memorizing where hidden gobblers are. This is a hard concept for my 5 year old but my 11 year old loves it as much as I do. You can always play regular tic tac toe with this game to make it easier for younger children wanting to play.  We definitely recommend this game for families looking for a quick but fun game to play together! I'm so glad we have it! The pieces are all very sturdy and easily cleanable if theres a spill or something.  Great great game!!!

This white microfiber mens towel wrap is very handy. It's nice to have for getting out of the shower and not getting dressed immediately. It's got a nice sized deep pocket however the wrap is fairly thin and lightweight so anything heavier than a toothbrush pulls the wrap down some. Also, if you wear it the way it's supposed to be worn you'll want some underwear on under it if you are going to be around people because it doesn't wrap very far around, and for me that defeats the purpose. I have turned it so it doesn't open in the front but then it looks stupid because it's on sideways or backwards! (I'm a waist size of 34/35 for prospective).  It's nice enough for the money! I just personally think the only drawback is that it needs to wrap around further or stay closed better when I walk. I will use it though and just be careful if anyone is around.

Beautiful pendant! The blue sapphire is bright and crisp. And the white sapphires are equally as stunning and beautiful to look at. It comes in a plain black box which accents the colors of the necklace nicely. The silver is sterling so it should last for years and be able to be cleaned so it can look its best. The actual chain is very tiny. I'm worried I may break it accidentally but even if you do you can easily get another sterling silver chain (although that's a hassle).  Overall I am pleased with it. I think the size is great. Its not tiny but not huge either. It really is just perfect to be seen and it lays nicely around my neck and on my chest. Very pretty piece!

These are very nice silicone tipped tongs.  I enjoy cooking on a hot grill and these thongs work great.  They are comfortable to hold with silicone padding on the end of the tongs and the tips are silicone as well.  The silicone can endure heat with ease.  They are easy to clean and the tips come off (though not easily but you want that while cooking with them).  The tongs also lock with ease (as typical of quality tongs).Overall I am very satisfied with these tongs.  Well made and easy to use and clean.

These pants are very nice.  They fit perfectly and are not snug at the waist at all.  The length was excellent as some pants tend to be too long.  These pants are nice enough to wear out on the town or just for casual use around the house.  These are machine washable and did not shrink after wearing them.I highly recommend these pants.

This is a very well done verse by verse commentary on the book of Acts from a classical Pentecostal perspective.  The author does a good job of balancing the text as he does not make the entire book of Acts merely about the Holy Spirit.  The author explores the text and he does deal with his text.  I also appreciated that the author did not ignore difficult texts such as Acts 2:38 or 13:48.Overall disciples of Jesus will learn from the author as you read this commentary.  While some will differ with the author over his Pentecostal interpretation of Acts 2, 8, 9, 10, and 19, this should not hinder you from reading this.  One could easily read this commentary and appreciated 90% of what the author writes.

This comes with a large, very nice tin full of assorted soft caramels.  The caramels are delicious and are nicely wrapped.  The tin is very usable following finishing off the caramels.  The only problem I am having is hiding them from my little boys who want them more than I do!  I do recommend these caramels and the tin makes it fit to place anywhere in the home.  Guests will enjoy the caramels as well as the nice looking tin they come in.

Let's face it, we all stink.  My mama use to say that so and so's poop smells too.  It doesn't matter if you are a Hollywood elite to a bubba in the swamp, your poop smells.  This poo-pourri is designed to cut down the smell.  In a small bathroom, this is very effective.  These sprays are strong in their scent and they have to be to cover up the poop smell.Pros:- Smells are not bad.  A bit overwhelming at times but not bad.- Small bottle can easily go with you into a bathroom and no one has to know.- Needed to cover up bad poop smells.Cons:- Bottle has to be sprayed upright and not down.  In other words, you have to get even with the john to make it effective.- Some have said their bottles leaked but mine has not.- The smell (while fine) now reminds me of poop.  Every time I smell the poo-pourri, I now think of poop.  Not good.Conclusion:If you have the money, get the poo-pourri.  It is effective.  That said, I would not buy it myself.  I am doing this review for Amazon.com and am not required to give any other views but my own.  I don't care that my poop smells to be honest and I just turn on the fan to get rid of the fumes.  Poop is poop to me and it just stinks.

Pros:- Comes ready to play right out of the box.- Very easy even little children to do (my youngest is 5 years old and he enjoys it).- Can really fly and shoots pretty well.- Pretty durable.  The nose is made out of a suction cup and sticks to some things (flat surfaces but not our wall).Cons:- We have yet to get it to fly where we aim.  You just pull back and it just flies wherever.- Flies sort of like a paper airplane but faster and much more durable.- The targets it comes with are cheap and nothing more than cardboard.  Not useful at all.- Not waterproof so avoid water!  We played with ours in a pool and that was a fail.Conclusion:Our family enjoyed this especially my wife.  I would definitely recommend this toy and would buy them for others including myself.  They are fun.  I do wish they were waterproof because they are a blast in a pool.  I do recommend these flyers.

This is a very nice tape dispenser.  It has good weight to it so that the dispenser does not move around much while you are tearing off the tape.  The dispenser comes with a nice grip on the bottom of it so that it holds well to a table.  The color is nice.Overall this is a very nice tape dispenser.  It will do the job you need for it to do and is well made.  I do recommend it.

Pros:- The magnet that holds the cups and spoons together is amazing.  Most come with a ring but these hold by magnets and is an awesome concept.- The whisk is a good size whisk and works well.- All three spatulas work well and have variations in their sizes.- The largest spatula works like a spoon and a spatula.- Very sturdy and good quality.Cons:- You obviously know that you're getting colorful sets but none of them seem to match kitchens.  That is okay by me but some might not appreciate the colors.OverallI do recommend these and would buy them for myself or a friend.  Very well made and the magnet concept is totally awesome.

This is a nice grooming kit.  It comes in a very nice leather pouch.  The nose clippers were excellent.  I am use to using an electric nose clipper but this one works just fine and is manual.  The fingernail clippers are excellent and once you figure out how to use them, they are excellent.  I don't know any men who use fingernail filer but this one is nice.  While I don't plan on using it, it seems well made.Overall this is a nice set.  The price however is steep.  It is useful for travel, nice looking, excellent grooming tools.  If money is not an issue, I do recommend it.  I just don't have this kind of money to pay for grooming kits but am thankful for the chance to review this product for Amazon.

Pros:- The bat and ball are very nice.- Great idea.- Easy to fold up and carry.- Lightweight with handle.Cons:- Too short.- The tee leans too much for the average height of a 5 year old.  If you screw the tee in more, its too short.- On grass, the tee leans and is not sturdy.  The ball rolls off the tee over and over and over again.OverallI would not buy this.  While the concept is nice, this tee is not sturdy enough.  I want a tee that is sturdy, well made, compact, but works.  This one does not.

This does just what it says.  It is easy to use.  You get it wet with just a little soap (if you need it) and you scrub your sink or pots and pans and it does just what it says and cleans them nicely.  You can then take the opposite side and shine your sink, pots and pans.  When we used this, it works wonderfully and cleans very well and deep.  Our sink felt nice to the touch after using this pad.This is well done and I highly recommend it.

Pros:- Very modern, classy looking.- Fits any style kitchen.- 100% cotton.  Machine washable.- Holds a decent amount of pastries.- Sits up fine.Cons:- Stiff fabric makes the folding and unfolding tough.- Wish it had handles on it but that is my preference.- No structure to the sides so basket is easy to cave in.

This is a very well done commentary on the book of Matthew.  The author does a good job of going verse by verse through the book and he examines many aspects of Matthew.  The author quotes from other commentaries (which I always enjoy when authors do this in Bible commentaries) and explores the book of Matthew from a deeper level than just reading it.  The author also points to other passages of Scripture throughout the Word of God that are relevant to the text.I say well done on this commentary and do recommend it for disciples of Jesus (John 8:31-32).

Pros: light weight, but very sturdy when assembled, Wide base makes it untippable, easy for more than 1 kid to share, good for multiple ages (crawlers to walkers), has volume control and on/off switch.Cons: assembly took 20 minutes with a drill (would be longer with screw driver). Contains about 10 plastic pieces and about 15 screws), 1 year old can pull off the ball ramp--easy to snap back on though. Wish it had a place to store the 3 balls that keep rolling awayOverall: While the price is a bit high for this toy, it is enjoyable for young children.  It is well built and sturdy which is a plus when dealing with children just learning to walk.  I do recommend it for parents who are looking for a toy for young children.

Pros:- Very easy to read watch face.  Numbers are clear.  Date is easy to read.- Very quite.  You cannot hear any ticking.- Light weight on my arm.- Attractive look for a lower priced watch.  The watch head itself does not look cheap.- Water resistant.- Numbers glow in the dark!Cons:- As others have said before me, the band is cheap.  You will want another band.  Band feels like cheap "leather" and does not bend well.Overall:I for one think this is an impressive watch for a lower price.  While the band can be replaced (and mine will), the watch itself is nice.  I appreciate not having to squint my eyes to look at the face.  The fact that it is water resistant is excellent.

Pros:- Well made.  The robot is durable.- Very easy to play with.  You simply point your remote at your robot trying to knock down another robot with the last one standing the winner.- Each robot comes with their weapons.- Comes with a 2X2 mat and you simply put the robots on the mat and go crazy.Cons:- This is not a quite toy.  The sound is not unbearable but it does make noise.- Hard to knock the robots down and hard to control your robot.  The robots were all over the mat but rarely at each other.- Takes 10 AAA batteries!- The only point to the game is just to knock down your opponent.OverallBoys will love this game.  We had two boys (9 and 6) battling and they loved it.  They are two little boys who enjoy battling.  The robots do what they do: fight.

Pros:- This is well made.- Great idea.  Can keep the right kind of child busy for hours.- Easy to set up.  Comes ready to play.- Only takes three AAA batteries that go in the bomb.- The string (laser) is easy to pull out and put back in.  Lots of string to work with.-  Our 11 year old boy took this out of the box and set it up himself.  It's that easy.-  We had five boys playing with the game and they all enjoyed playing.- The game changes each time depending on how the child sets up the hooks.- Very imaginative game.Cons:- Can be frustrating since you have to hook up lots of strings and they have to be set up just right.- Not for smaller children.  They will grow frustrated trying to set this game up.Overall:I do believe this is a creative concept.  While not all children will find it appealing, imaginative children will find this game enjoyable.  This is a tricky game to put together and some children will grow frustrated quickly.  If your child enjoys building, tearing up, and then rebuilding (Legos come to mind), they will enjoy this game.  This game requires work.  It is not hard work but it is tedious.

This review is of the Epson Expression ET-2550 Wireless Printer.Pros:- Size is very good for a home or small office.- Very easy to set up and use.  The display is easy to use as well.  Nothing too complicated.- Average speed on printing.- Quality of print is amazing.  Very clear and crisp.- Doesn't seem to use a lot of ink so we are hoping that the ink is long lasting.- Holds 100 papers at a time.- Easy to link up to all our wireless devices under our home network.- We printed a large picture of Super Mario and the second it came out, it was dry!- Features calendar and stationary papers.- Lightweight.Cons:- Ink is not easy to change.  You have to use a bottle and pour ink into a canister.  If you want an ink cartridge, you'll want another printer.- You must use gloves to change the ink.  While easy to do, its time consuming.Conclusion:This is a very nice printer.  I would recommend it to my friends, to small businesses.  This printer does just what we want it to do.  We homeschool our children and this printer is used daily.  It has yet to fail us!

This is a very nice toy for a child probably between 2-5 years of age.  It is well made, does not have small parts or blocks, and has nothing that could hurt your child.The pros of this toy are:- Durable plastic that can take a beating from a child.- Decent amount of blocks for the child to stack on (these are Mega Blocks so they are large version of Legos in essence).- The wagon moves easily across the floor and is very lightweight for a child to pull.- The wagon is suppose to swoop up the blocks as it goes alone but only picks up about half but still a cool concept.Cons:- You will likely need more Mega Blocks for older children.  Again, some come with it but not a lot.- Swoop concept only picks up about half the blocks.Overall:This is well designed, well built, and durable.  The wagon is easy to pull, requires no assembly.  I do recommend this toy for parents (and that coming from a parent of three boys).  This is a good toy for toddlers.

This is a good engineer kit for children.  I will give the pros can cons below.Pros:- Creative play.  You are building cars and it comes with many pieces to build.- Booklet comes with many different cars to design.- Well made plastic.- Wheels rolled well on the floor.- Creative children will also enjoy just making things similar to Legos.- Very nice case.Cons:- Poor instructions.  If you have ever spent a Christmas Eve night cursing the companies that sent instructions that make no sense, these are such instructions.- Small pieces.Conclusion:For creative play, this is fun.  The directions need to be better.  The pieces are great quality with neat pieces such as gears, eyeballs, wheels, blocks, etc.

These are excellent headphones.  Let me state the pros and cons.Pros:- This are excellent for people who seem to have trouble keeping buds in your ear.  These work!- Sound is amazing.- Blocks out sound so that people can't hear what you hear so play it as loud as you want!- If you have a Samsung the controls are easy to use.- The buds come with a case that is compact and easily holds your buds.- They come with a size small bud and a larger pair so that you get the right size for your ear.Cons:- If you have these on, people will not be able to talk to you.  That is frustrating as a parent trying to talk to kids.

I would gladly put more than five stars for this LeapFrog.  It is simply an amazing machine.  The screen is comparable to an iPad Mini but not quite as large.  It is a beauty to look at though and the screen is clear and bright.  The screen is touch screen and comes with a stylus that is connected to the LeapFrog.  The pad also is excellent with the touching many you don't have to keep retouching letters to get them.This LeapFrog also has many cool features such as apps you can download from the LeapFrog site.  This LeapFrog also has wi-fi on the device (which is very convenient).  You have to have an account with LeapFrog to order apps but they save your credit card information for next time and the site is password protected to prevent your child from buying up apps.  My three children literally fight to play on this unit.  It's that good.The sound quality is excellent.  The battery is rechargeable and long lasting.  You can also play on the device while you charge it.  You set up the device using the device so no connecting to a computer.The camera on the LeapFrog is okay but not great.  It does what it needs to do.You can only have three profiles on the device which was perfect for us but if you have more children, that stinks.  This device also has many parental controls such as setting the time limits for your children and LeapFrog does a great job at protecting children.

I just got this unit, and it works. It looks nice, but is very light, and possibly cheaply made. While plugging in the controllers, I already noticed the lights flickering. That could be because it wasn't plugged in all the way, or the connections are already loose.  Only time will tell how well this unit works.  I will update my review in a few months.  I like the charging lights. I like how the unit looks, and the ways in which it can be plugged up--Directly into the PS4 or you can use the wall adapter.  I have skins on my controllers, and one of the skins was not compatible with this unit. I have the Foamy Lizard skins that do work quite well, but some, a different brand, does not. The skin is wrapped all the way around the controller, up close to the plug, which adds just enough material in the way to impede plugging in the controller.  So that's something to look at, if you use skins on your controller. I do not like having to plug the controllers in all the time. I'm used to the cradle chargers that allow the controllers just to rest on a charging port--without plugging it in. I really liked that, but that particular charger broke in about 5 months. Which is a real shame.  I also hate having to use cables. Bummer.  All in all though, so far it's a decent little deal, and hopefully it'll hold up for longer than a couple of months.

This screen protector looks good, but I definitely have noticed a drop in the touch screen sensitivity. So that is a little annoying. Another thing that bothers me are the sparkles. I'm not sure what they are, but there is a grid pattern of small circles on the screen protector. I don't know what they are, and I've never seen them on other glass protectors. They are not terribly noticeable, but in spots my screen looks like it sparkles. Gotta admit I'm a little disappointed.

So far I am very pleased with this chair! I'm pretty short, and it's hard finding really comfortable chairs.  This one was spot on! It was really light too! The cooler is a great idea. Love the pockets, and the fact that the pillow height is adjustable is perfect! The only problem I had was they sent me the wrong chair color. I got the red white and blue when I ordered the green and blue. Amazon Customer service was awesome as usual, and gave me a discount for my inconvenience.

I really liked the print quality on this case. I was happy with how clean and bright it looked.  Was not happy with the colors. Wish they had different colors with the same print.  The case on the other hand, barely had any edge to speak of, which means little to no real screen protection. I decided to return it for that reason.

Took me a minute to figure out how to put this thing together, but I eventually managed.  Theven reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was because the print on the crib looks cheap and pixilated. As an artist and past printer, that really bugs me. May not bother others though. Otherwise, great for the price.

I like this gate. It does its job for babies, but my little 3 year old can manhandle it open, and then can't close it again.  So that poses a problem, because of the not being able to close thing--she leaves it open for my 1 year old to get to places he shouldn't get to.  She's pretty obedient though. So she won't open the gate if I tell her not to.  So it's really not a problem for us.

I really like this case. It is slim and stylish. I've already dropped my phone a couple of times, and you can head it landing only on the case. The lips are high enough around it that it's doing a good job of protecting the screen.  I will be purchasing a glass screen protector for further protection, but for a simple bump case, I'm really happy with my purchase.

I like this product, but it has some problems. It smells ok. Originally it smelled good to me, but then my husband kept saying he was smelling stomach acid...you know, that kind of sour spit up smell, on the kids. It was the soap on their skin. I can see what he's talking about, but I do know that soap smells differently on different skin types. That could be part of it. The soap itself has a mild pleasant smell--smells like coconut and Shea butter. Coconut has a pleasant smell, but Shea Butter isn't the best.  The other issue I noticed was my daughter's hair afterwards. It looks greasy after she uses it. My son's does too, but it goes away the next day. My daughter's hair continues to look greasy though. My son is more on the dryer side, so that might be why. Some one with more oily skin and hair might have a problem with this soap.  I'm going to try using less in her hair to see if that helps.  The soap, however, as a body was is wonderful! Their skin is silky smooth!  My daughter has always had beautiful skin, and I still notice a difference in softness. My son has had dryer skin, and this soap definitely suits him well.  I also love that this soap is organic and I love the ingredients. Definitely give it a shot! You could be pleasantly surprised.

I liked this skin. Feels nice. Fits the controller well. The studs get some taking used to, but in the end I prefer them there to the traditional controller feel.  It is also nice because the back is cut out so it doesn't interfere with anything getting in the way of the mini USB port.  The buttons are flush with the skin, which was annoying at first, but you get used to it.  These are more expensive than other skins out there, which is a strike for me, but you get what you pay for.

I liked these skins. They fit quite nicely and are comfortable in the hand.  I have the foamy lizard studded grips for a different skin, and think I may prefer how these feel better, especially for the price.  I got 4 skins for less than the price of the studded skin. The fact that they glow is a fun added bonus.  Though only the white one glows pretty well.  The rest glow, but are muted.  The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 was because I have a docking station for my controllers that requires a piece to be plugged into the mini USB port at all times. This skin infringes on the ability to use the docking station.  It was easily remedied by cutting out around the plug, but I didn't have to do that with my foamy lizard skin.  The skin is a little thinner than the foamy lizard one as well. So there is a little less protection, but the buttons protrude better.  With the foamy lizard skin the buttons are pretty much flush with the skin. That was annoying at first, but you get used to it.  That won't be able problem with these skins.

Kidd love this thing. I gave it for a birthday present, and all the kids sat around and happily painted. It was the hit of the party.  The only thing that is bad is the paint brush is large and uses the paint quickly. The amount that comes with the set will go quickly.

I was really hoping to like this product, but I just can't.Pros: cleaned face well. Loved the gritty feel Not too abrasive, but definitely felt like it was doing its job.I have normal skin, but have some small pimples on my forehead. They are not really noticeable, but some have redness. This product seemed to lessen the redness.Cons: Skin felt very tight after using. It didn't make it oily, or have dry patches, just tight. The next day I noticed bigger pimples pop up in my temple area. It's been nearly 3 days now since I've used the product, and my face burns and itches. It doesn't look dry--no rash, or anything like that, but it doesn't feel good at all. I didn't have the guts to continue after 1 use. Won't use again.
Eh...so so book. Didn't keep my daughter's attention. Didn't keep mine either.
Really cute story. My daughter Lila loves it. As an artist, illustrations are a big thing for me in kid's books. I liked these.
Hasn't broken, but not for use in a shallow kiddie pool.
Kids liked them, don't point true north.
Ok product. The corners are curved so it traps food in them. Does not clean completely in dish washer. You have to use a bottle brush to clean those corners. Not happy about that.
Great balloon! Filled it with helium about 3 weeks ago and it's still going strong, with no sign of falling.

Really like this pool. Kids love it! Came with a hole in it, but spoke with amazon and I got an awesome discount. I didn't want to take the time to box it up and send it back after my daughter had already seen it. I was happy with the discount, and just got a patch for it. Couldn't be happier with my purchase

Very cool little deal, especially for the price! I bought this as a secondary way to light camp fires. As soon as I got it, I took it outside and started putting burn marks on my deck, lol. It was an instantaneous burning point. Started smoking right away. I didn't try to start an actual fire, but I feel I wouldn't have any problems. It's small, sturdy, all metal and glass. Does not feel cheap. It's pretty awesome.

These diapers are ok. Fit is ok, but urine leaks through the actual face of the diaper during the long night time stretches. My son woke up soaked every morning. I switched to pampers naturals and this problem doesn't happen. They only leak if he sleeps any time after the 12 hour mark.  I've always wanted to like huggies. I like their design better, but they never worked for my daughter either. Had to do pampers for both
Perfect little cable! Not big and bulky. Works well. Great price! Fits perfectly in my laptop bag. Bought it for transferring movies on my laptop to tvs.
Loved that I was able to buy just the strap. However, the shoulder pad was wrinkled and it doesn't seem to be going away. Comfortable strap, and great for accessorizing!

Great little device!  Works as expected. I use it to put my DVDs on to my computer. No complaints. I can put whole movies on my device in 15 to 25 mins, tops. Perfect. Love the build quality and color.
No story line, flaps are boring,  but my 2 year old seems to like it.
Does not keep sheets dry at all. However, it does a good job of not feeling super wet to the touch of the surface after baby spits up.

This is a great robe! I bought this because I sleep in my birthday suit, but am also the mother of 2 small children (5 months, and 2 years) I'm up and down a few times a night between feedings, and wanted something I could throw on quick, and doesn't get in the way of everything like the giant robe my husband bought me years ago. I bought a medium, and it fits just right, though slightly snug around my tummy, but that's because I still have a little bit of my baby belly. When I say slightly, I mean probably only noticeable to me. I bought a medium, and I'm 5'2.5" at 139 lbs - muscular build - broad shoulders. It fits nicely. The 3 quarter length sleeves are perfect because they don't get in the way of anything. The material is comfy and warm enough for me during those feedings. Feedings are easy also. There is a tie closure inside the robe to keep it closed, and a sown in tie for around closure. That was a must have for me. I hate losing or wrestling with the closures of robes. THERE ARE 2 POCKETS! Not sure why this is not advertised. I bought this robe for all its other great qualities, but thought I wasn't gonna get pockets--which almost made it a deal breaker, but never fear for those of you like me who don't wanna get dressed around the house, but still wanna have your cell on you. Great robe! Wish it were in more colors than black and taupe. I really wanted a grey robe, because it wouldn't show spit up as readily, but that's truly my only complaint. Great product!  We'll thought out!

This fits my Asus 15.6 screen computer just right (all ports can be seen and are usable without further modification).  I have the newer thinner computer--that doesn't have a disc drive.  It's also a 2 in 1, and the case does not inhibit the use in tablet mode, which is nice.  I bought the case for a little added protection and to keep the aluminum finish from getting scratched. I believe this will be a lot more added protection than those static cling covers.  The reason I gave the cover 4 stars instead of 5 was due to the color variation.  The actual color of the orange cover is a mild neon orange.  Not as bright as an orange high lighter, but headed in that direction.  Either way, it looks nothing like the photo.  In other websites it showed the orange as yellow.  I'm not partial to neon colors, but the case will work for its intended use, so I'm happy with it.1.12.15 UpdateI have since dropped my computer from roughly 3 feet, and not a scratch, dent, or any other issues were found after the fall.  VERY HAPPY with this product!
My 2 year old loves her "Hello Kitty" bed.  She loves staying in it.
It Works!  My Boston Terrier was constantly getting ticks (we live near woods), and so I tried this.  Haven't sen a tick since.  Def. does its job.

The Oxford NY Men's Pique Polo Shirt (XXL) is a very good looking and comfortable polo.  I got the "Forest" color and the muted green color is very appealing.  Although I typically wear a XL, the XXL is not so big that I am swimming in it and even if I have a little more material in the midriff area than I'm used to, it doesn't look like I'm wearing some over-sized bag.  The length is very good in both the waste and arms which is important as I am 6'6" and it has plenty of shirt tail to either tuck in or leave loose, but not so much that it looks like a dress. The cotton/poly blend is soft and is similar to other shirts that I already own.  I'm not sure what the moniker is on the left breast though... Wildebeest?  Bull?  Texas Long Horn?Overall I am very happy with the shirt.  It is very well made and the $14.99 price is very reasonable.

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest review. ***The Brainwavz Kidwavz KV-100 Wireless Rechargeable Headphones are a nice pair of over-ear headphones.  The padded ear cups and head band are very comfortable and have small holes in them so that they breathe.  Although they are adjustable, they are "kid sized" so it probably will not fit most adults.  My seven year old uses them and she has the about 50% out (although we are all very tall so she's not a "typical" seven year old).  I was able to just barely get them on, but I didn't try them for very long as I didn't want to bend the head band.  We got the blue set and it is very bright and colorful!The KV-100 is very easy to charge as it simply uses a micro-USB connection (cord included).  Pairing is also easy as you simply hold the power button down and the device will show up on your music player.  My daughter doesn't have a Bluetooth music player so I simply plugged in the audio AUX cord and went from there.  Obviously the volume up/down and FFWD/REV buttons don't work if its not Bluetooth paired, but they worked well when I had it paired to my iPod.  The 85 db volume limiter is nice idea to ensure that your child doesn't fry their ears.The only issue I had was that they KV-100 is kind of pricey at $39.50 for something that your child will probably abuse.  There are many other Bluetooth headphones that are half this price - although not without all the features that the KV-100 offers.  Brainwavz is a pretty good company and the KV-100 is a nice product, but I'm not sure I'd spend almost $40 on something that stand a 50/50 chance of being broken in three months.  So maybe my complaint is I'm cheap - who knows...Overall, I (and my daughter) really liked this set of headphones and she's used them every day since I gave them to her!

Positives:The colors are very bright, but I haven't seen any evidence of the colors bleeding.  The size of each towel (16X19") is perfect for cleaning.Negatives:Although the page says the towels "become more absorbent the more they are washed", out of the box they are NOT soft and NOT absorbent at all.  After wiping a water spill, you'll end up with a slightly damp towel and the spill spread over a larger area on your counter.  I read some of the reviews where people were using the towels over paper towels and I don't get it.  These towels wouldn't soak up a water spill even if you put the towel on the spill and an walked away for an hour.  I'd use these to clean your hands after cooking or washing dishes, but if it doesn't dry your hands or soak up liquids, its not good for that either.Overall, I was very unimpressed.  I'll probably just end up using them as brightly colored rags.  At least the colors don't bleed...

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest product review. ***Out of the box, the VicTsing Outdoor Stainless Steel Solar Step Lights come with everything you need to install them.  Packed in a plastic bag, each light includes two small screws as well as two inserts for installing screws in thin wood or drywall.  The lights are made of stainless steel and look very professional and are very light and thin.  The screws mount app. 3" apart into blind keyhole slots.Mounting the lights are the chief negative issue I had with the product.  Even after measuring the slots and marking them, they were still hard to install let alone trying to ensure that the holes are level.  Considering VicTsing shipped a somewhat large instruction sheet, they probably should have printed a mounting template on the instructions so that you could simply put that up against whatever you are mounting the light on and drill through the paper.  It wouldn't have been that hard.  However this is a minor point and I only had to drill a couple extra holes (which were easily filled with wood putty and are covered by the light).Once you have the screws properly installed, you simply depress the button on the back of the light and it will automatically come on at dusk.  The light is somewhat dim, but it more than enough to illuminate a stair raiser in pitch black darkness.  I liked that the light is a "cool" white light instead of the harsher "bright white that looks kind of like the light cast by old incandescent bulbs.My deck isn't really oriented to get full sunlight for the lights, but they still absorbed enough to come on at night and stay on for a few hours.  Typical with most solar-powered lights, it takes awhile for the solar panel to really work as well as it should.  The last one I installed was supplying me with nearly 8 hours of light about a week after I installed the light.  I installed this pair facing roughly NW and at the top of the railing pole so the corner of the railing is overhanging the collector and still just two days later, the lights were on for at least four hours after dark.Overall I really liked the VicTsing Outdoor Stainless Steel LED Solar Step Lights even if they were hard to properly mount.  The collectors are able to absorb ambient light even if it is not shining directly on the collectors and the light that they cast is nice and plenty bright to see when outside.

Very easy to use and not high priced.  Screwed it into place quick and it was a perfect adapter for a Dell monitor that only had a VGA port and my Dell computer than only had a DVI port.  Couldn't be happier!

I own a Dell Computer that is only 4 years old.  Therefore I thought it was appropriate to try out this new Del 23" Screen.Out of the Box it is surprisingly light.  My 22" flat screen monitor that I bought about seven years ago weighs at least twice what the new Dell weighs.  Assembly is very easy and very intuitive.  The three-piece stand just snaps into place (and disassembles just as easy) with the last piece being a rear cover that you really don't even need.  The plug and play functions of the monitor work so well I didn't have to adjust anything when I plugged it into my computer - the resolution snapped into place and I was ready to go.  Dell supplies an instruction book and a CD with device drivers, but I just threw them away.However plugging the monitor in was an issue.  My Dell and many many new computers no longer have VGA ports on the graphics cards as the new, higher resolution technology utilizes the square DVI port and the white data cords.  The problem?  This Dell Monitor has no DVI port on it and is - honestly - the first monitor I've seen in probably 10-12 years that has only a VGA port (and I've setup 100's of computer workstations at my office).  Why Dell would manufacture a monitor that requires maybe 30% of its prospective clients to buy an adapter is beyond me.  Granted the adapter only cost me $5, but why should I have to buy one in the first place.  I would say that this monitor is being sold as a cheaper alternative, but $179 is about what you'd expect to pay for a 23" flat screen monitor nowadays - in fact if you do a quick search on Amazon, the sales price of this unit is actually higher than average.  Just plain dumb - Dell should know better...Overall, the monitor provides beautiful graphics and the ease of install is probably the highest that I've ever dealt with.  Having to buy a $5 adapter is simply annoying and considering how great the monitor is, I'm really just going to ignore it and move on.  However, the somewhat higher than average price AND having to buy an adapter forced me to rate this product at 4 stars.

** NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***I've tried several different phone mounts.  They are either too low on the car so I have to look away from the road or they affix to the window and obscure my view.  I really liked the Aikema Air Vent Phone Car Mount as it was easy to use, the rubber-padded phone caddy is expandable for several sizes of phones (it's maximum size at least 5" and is even larger than my iPhone 6), and the rubber-padded clamp stays in place without cracking your air vent vane.  Since the mount holds onto a vane of your air vent, it can be positioned either horizontally or vertically to aid in making it as functional as possible.The mount also includes a 360 deg ball joint so that you can position the phone the way you want it and the screw to tighten or loosen the clamp is very easy to access and turn.  Although handy, the ball joint is very stiff so I would suggest removing the mount while you are positioning the joint so that you don't break off one of your air vent vanes.Overall I really liked the mount and plan on using it regularly.

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest review. ***The Furios Guitar Capo is really a neat little product.  I've been playing guitar for years and have tried many different capos and there is a fine line between having one that stays place on your guitar neck and properly mutes the strings and one that is almost impossible to open with your non-dominant hand.  I've owned and used many guitar capos that were like vice clamps or that you really had to adjust them in order to ensure that they had a nice fit.Instead the Furios Guitar Capo actually LOOKS like it was made for a guitar.  The underside is rounded and included padded rubber so that it looks like it is almost molded to your guitar neck or actually even a part of your guitar when you put it on.  The quasi-polished exterior is also nice looking and although I'm not a fan of the color light green, it is actually starting to grow on me.  Finally the capo was very easy for me to open as well as to adjust on the fly up and down the guitar neck.  There is similar rubber padding on the string-side of the capo that does a good job of muting the strings no matter where on or in between the frets the capo is placed.Overall, I couldn't be happier with the Furios Guitar Capo and I've already donated my old capo to someone else.

The Old Wisconsin "Fast Fuel High Protein" Snack is a tasty meat stick, I received both a beef stick and a Old Wisconsin Fast Fuel High Protein Honey Brown Sugar Turkey Snack Stick, but were nothing special over other competitors such as Slim Jim, Jack Links, or any of a dozen other similar competitors.  I've probably eaten a couple thousand of these meat sticks and there have been very few that I didn't like.  These were no different.  The Honey Brown Sugar Turkey flavor was tasty and interesting considering this is not a flavor I would have tried on my own.Although I greatly liked the product, I had to laugh at the marketing ploy to call these "Fast Fuel, High Protein".  In some ways its like slapping a sticker on a bottle of water and calling it "Hydrating".  Beyond that, I'm not sure that consumers go into a gas station and buy a meat stick simply because they were looking for "Fast Fuel".  I'm just looking for something salty and good tasting.  Thus the marketing language is it wrong - its just silly...Overall I really liked these.  I'm not too wrapped up in eating healthy or ensuring that I only ingest "all natural" products so my review is probably higher than others.  One of these every week or so isn't going to kill you.

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest product review. ***Out of the box, the VicTsing Outdoor Stainless Steel Solar Step Lights come with everything you need to install them.  Packed in a plastic bag, each light includes two small screws as well as two inserts for installing screws in thin wood or drywall.  The lights are made of stainless steel and look very professional and are very light and thin.  The screws mount app. 3" apart into blind keyhole slots.Mounting the lights are the chief negative issue I had with the product. I installed this pair facing roughly NW and at the top of the railing pole so the corner of the railing is overhanging the collector and still just two days later, the lights were on for at least four hours after dark.Overall I really liked the VicTsing Outdoor Stainless Steel LED Solar Step Lights even if they were hard to properly mount.  The collectors are able to absorb ambient light even if it is not shining directly on the collectors and the light that they cast is nice and plenty bright to see when outside.

*** NOTE: I received a free copy of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***I've been using laundry bags for awhile.  There is nothing worse than having your bra clasp break in the wash (or hook onto and rip something else) or your nylons stretch out to 10 feet in length or your sweater turn into a mess of pill balls after taking them out of the wash so I'd kind of question the sanity of any woman who is NOT using them.I'd always used a zippered mesh bag that was basically 16" square so I'd always had a tough time stuffing larger items into it and smaller items end up moving around inside the bag during washing.  However this set features three different flat zippered bags - 19.7 x 23.6 inch, 15.7 x 19.7 inch, and 11.8 x 15.7 inch - plus a 7 inch cylinder bag which can be used for very small items or as a little carrying/storage case for your bags.  The flat bags seem like they wouldn't allow much water in, but after laundering my clothes they came out smelling just as fresh and clean as the items that were not inside the mesh bags.  Drying is just as easy as you simply leave the item in the bag and toss it into the drying.  Note if your items are jammed pretty tightly into the bag, they might not dry very thoroughly so use your common sense when using these for drying.Overall I really liked the Besteek Laundry Bag Set.  They wore well in the washer and dryer and the set is very useful either in the laundry room or as storage cases in your home or while traveling.  The $10 price is pretty reasonable as well, as it is somewhat on the lower end of a sampling of similar products.

*** NOTE: I received a free copy of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***My son plays percussion and frequently uses ear plugs while practicing or playing in order to not damage his hearing.  He's tried several different brands of earplugs and he's never been super happy with any of them.  The EAR Defense Ear Plugs are a little different from some of the other reusable ear plugs.  For one the feature a small lanyard that keeps your ear plugs handy when you are not wearing them (my son usually stuffed them in his pocket.  Another nice feature is the water-proof, screw open carrying case that has a key chain ring on it.  Now not only won't he have the ear plugs in his pocket, he will now have a safe place to store them.At first $18 seems like alot for ear plugs, but with two sets of ear plugs, the lanyard, and the storage case, this seems around the correct price as there are several other brands that cost at least $20.  Overall, there is alot to like here!

*** NOTE: I received a free copy of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***The Yacoto 3-in-1 Retractable Charging Cable works really well.  The cable extends to a maximum length of 31 inches and features a three-way head with a micro-USB, lightning, and 30 pin connectors.  With cables that are supposed to charge Apple products, the first thing I test is to ensure that the cable synchs with my devices and it did right away with the lightning cable having no problems on both my iPhone 6 and iPad Mini and the 30 pin cable with my older iPad.  As someone who travels quite a bit, I appreciate having a retractable cable that's not tied up in a ball or wrapped around something else when I go to use it.  Nothing to not like here!

There is nothing worse than packing your freezer full of goodies only to find out 2 months later that you didn't seal your freezer bag correctly and half of the food is either spoiled or has freezer burn.  This is why I always use slider bags when I'm storing away products in the freezer - especially liquids (you REALLY don't want to open your freezer and find a huge chicken broth icicle in your freezer.The Hefty Gallon-Sized Slider Freezer Bags definitely fit the order for heavy duty storage and at the Amazon Prime Pantry price of $2.52 for a box of 10, you can't beat the price either!

I always by Scotts products for lawn care because I firmly believe in buying quality products where it counts.  Anything that lasts a long time, like carpet, paint, appliances, and landscaping, I always make sure to buy the product that performs the best even if its not the cheapest version.I've bought Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed for years to seed into bare spots and it always does a good job.  The grass comes up within a couple weeks and grows quickly and is strong.  I've never had any complaints.

*** NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***The TLTrading Floating Pen/Pencil Holder Desk Organizer is a very functional pen/pencil holder while also being a very convincing conversation piece.  Made of a two pieces of molded plastic, the bucket (with metal wire handle) is attached to a piece of clear plastic through a "hole" in the side of the bucket.  With the air bubbles within the water spout and the puddling on the base, it really gives the illusion of water rushing out of the bucket.Overall I liked the pen/pencil holder.  I was able to get about 20 normal pens/pencils or 10 heavier pens in the bucket without thinking that the plastic water spout would snap.  However therein lies the only drawback that I saw.  There are two key weak points in the design (where the water spout connects to the bucket and where it connects to the horizontal base) and they are both thin plastic (3/16" and 1/4" thick respectively) and are thus susceptible to breaking.  So as a functional novelty, the TLTrading Floating Pen/Pencil Holder Desk Organizer is very cool.  However, don't expect it to do any heavy lifting.

The Real FX Racing Starter Kit is a quantum leap over the slot cars of your youth.  Included in the box are 20 track pieces, two cars, and two controllers.  Once you put in the batteries into the cars and controllers (three AAA batteries each - 12 batteries total), they are ready to roll.Although there are six track layouts shown in the instruction manual, track creation is basically up to you and can be anything you dream up as long as you create a closed circuit.  There are 20 track pieces (six straight, ten 45 deg corners, two reverse corners, and two pits lanes) and with the straight sections about 36" long, when you put a track together using all 20 pieces, the track can be as long or as wide as six feet.  Also included in those tracks are two "pit stop" pieces which are necessary for the advanced racing options.  The tracks are made of plastic and are very thin and flexible (similar to construction paper).  The track pieces are held together by small tabs on the front edge that slide into slots on the other piece and are assembled and taken apart in seconds - clean up literally takes about 30 seconds.  After placing the "starting grid" piece, you simply follow the arrows on this piece and connect the track from there overlapping each piece as shown in the instructions.The cars turn off and on with a switch on the bottom of the car and controllers at the touch of the main power button.  Racing noises, such as engine revving, spin outs, and blown motors are all heard through the speaker on the controller.  Optionally you can plug headphones into the audio jack on the side of the controller.  Pairing the controller to each of the cars is also a snap and takes very little setup.  Once you have the tracks constructed, several of the driving modes allow for AI assist - the cars follow the tracks on their own and you can do as little as just control their speed.  If you go too fast, they will still fly off the track on corners, but it’s a good way to get a feel for driving without having to drive the whole track on your own.  Once you speed up to the point where the car could go off the track, you simply use the "steering wheel" on the side of the controller to manually control the car to keep it on the track.  Actually competitive racing can be done either against an AI "pace car" or a human opponent with the pace car having two different difficulty modes.  Other options allow for different racing parameters such as road/car hazards (oil slicks, incorrectly shifting gears, and tire wear) and the amount of laps you want to race against either an AI or human opponent.  Finally, you can set the cars on full RC mode to run around the track (or your house) without any AI assistance.Overall, I found the Real FX Racing Starter Kit to be a whole lot of fun.  All my kids (ages 7, 11, and 14) and myself and enjoyed setting up different track layouts and racing against each other.  The learning curve was not too steep due to the AI assistance modes available - in fact my 7 year old only used that mode and simply sped up or slowed down the car while racing against the other vehicle set in pace car mode.  One drawback I saw was that the wheels come off a little too easy.  Two or three times a race when one of our cars would fly off the track, one of our wheels would fall off.  I understand the need to take the wheels off, in order to keep the axle free of hair and debris, and it is very easy to put the wheel back on, but it was still annoying to have to bend down and put the car back together while you are being lapped on the track.  I'd also like to see the company come out with an expansion product with additional tracks as it would be fun to make even larger circuits.  Other than that, I had zero issues with the set.  The tracks are very easy to clean off and the batteries seem to last for quite awhile as we have yet to have to replace any.  Good stuff!!!

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest review. ***The Island Fresh Coconut Oil really checks all the boxes that you granolas look for - virgin, certified organic, non-GMO, and contained in a BPA-free container.  The oil comes in a VERY generous-sized container at 54 oz which should last us quite awhile.  My wife plans on using it both for cooking, but also in her soap making where she frequently uses coconut oil as an ingredient.The oil itself has a wonderful coconut scent while not having an over-powering coconut taste.  The texture of the oil is very smooth and great tasting.  The $24.95 price is right inline with other virgin coconut oils in 54 ounce containers as Amazon has many suppliers priced between $22 and $28.  I recently tried out another coconut oil brand that is slightly cheaper than the Island Fresh product, but it is inferior in quality and taste.Overall, I couldn't be happier with the Island Fresh Coconut Oil and Island Fresh as a supplier.

The Walnut Hollow Garden Stakes are nice, high quality stakes.  The previous stakes I had purchased, from a local big box, had issues with splintering or even splitting when driven into the ground.  Not so with this product.  The 36" length is a little more than I needed, but I don't mind sawing off the top - its better to be too long than too short.Overall I was very happy to get these as the previous stakes have started to rot through and I needed to rebuild my raised bed garden anyway.

*** NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***The Wisdompro 3-in-1 iPhone 6 Cell Phone Case is very heavy duty.  I really like the multi-functional nature of the case as the belt clip turns into a desktop "kickstand" with the use of the metal loop internal to the belt clip.  This stand has several different positions and is very easy to deploy and put back.  In addition there is a smaller kickstand on the cell phone case itself that clicks into place after pulling it loose from the rear of the case.  The belt case unit has a soft interior surface to cushion and protect your phone screen which is nice - I'm not sure I've seen that before.Inside the package along with the three-part case you also get one removable screen protector, a dust rag, and a 4.5" stylus.  I swear by the screen protectors as I have them on all my iDevices and my work Blackberry.  They take a while to get used to how to put them on, but no device should be without them.The only real drawback with this case is that everything fits VERY tightly.  It took me 10 minutes to properly "push" the rubber interior case into the hard case properly.  Since the rubber sleeve is malleable, it kept wanting to protrude out into various places it shouldn't.  Once you have the two-piece phone case together, the fit into the belt case is also VERY tight - basically requiring me to look down and ensure I was positioning it correctly every time I put my phone away.  The good thing in all that is that the phone is very secure and you really have to try and break it.Overall, despite the work I had to put in to get the case together, I really liked the case as it very securely takes care of my phone.

The Lucien Piccard Taverna Men's is a very classically fashionable men's watch.  The bronze hour/minute hands and hour marks beautifully contrast with the silver watch face.  The date is shown set within a really nice sundial/starburst pattern with 12 hour marks.  Time and date are set via the dial on the right side of the watch.  I love the look of the silver/bronze watch with the black watch band - very professional looking.HOWEVER, the watch band itself is awful.  It is a deployant clasp system like you'd see on metal watch bands.  Its bad enough that I had to Google the clasp and watch a Youtube video JUST TO FIGURE OUT HOW TO OPEN IT, but then when I actually tried to put it on, I figured out that if you have large hands you will have a tough time wearing it.  At least with metal watch bands, you can have the clasp adjusted so that it expands larger or smaller depending on your hand and/or wrist size.  Not so with the Lucien Piccard clasp.  Once you set the point on the band where you want it to close to, it only opens so large and for someone with smaller wrists and large hands (I'm 6'6"), it is not possible to slip the watch band over your hand.  So I was forced to open up the watch band and try to set and deploy the clasp one-handed.  It can be done, but it is a colossal pain in the rear end and honestly isn't worth my time.  Instead I went to the neighborhood convenience store, bought a $12 leather watch band and chucked the original watchband.  It's a shame too because I'm sure this watchband isn't cheap.Overall, my hate of the deployant clasp system on a leather watch band greatly overcame my love of the watch.  I've bought several mid-high end watches - all with leather bands - and this is the first one I've ever received that has a deployant clasp.  In my opinion, if you are going to deliver a watch where this is the primary band, you should include in the package a normal backup leather watchband.  Considering this watch originally sold for $362, you'd think that would be the least they could do...

NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***The UNU Aero Wireless iPhone 6 Battery Case is actually pretty darn cool.  Out of the box, you get the case, the charging base, a USB/micro USB cable and an audio cable with female end on one side and a male end on the other.  The case has a charging connector inside it and you just plug your iPhone in as you slide it into the case.  After connecting the charging pad to the micro USB connector and the connecting the USB side of that cord to a plug (not provided), the pad is ready to go.  Whenever your phone needs to be charge, you just set it down on the pad and a second later it starts charging.The case contains a 3000 mAh internal battery which is supposed to give you up to 14 hours of useful life.  I can attest that the battery lasts for quite sometime as I only had to charge my phone once in a week.  I'm not a power user like some teenagers I've seen, but that's still a long.  Although the charging pad and the case are somewhat integral to each other, you can charge the battery case without it as there is a micro USB connector on the case.The only drawback I see is that the case has no belt clip.  I know a lot of people like to put their phones in their pockets, purses, or backpacks, but that's not me.  Because of where the battery is, I don't think you can install a belt loop so I understand the problem.  A minor issue is due to the thickness of the case, you cannot access the audio port on your phone.  This is where the short audio cable comes in.  Just plug the cable into the audio port of your phone and then plug the female end of the cable into your headset.  Its kind of important to hang onto the cable though.Overall I really liked this case eventhough I had to stuff it into my pocket.  The battery extends the life of your phone several fold and it is very clean and sophisticated looking!

*** NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***The IBRA 6 Feet High Speed HDMI Cable is clearly a high quality product.  I liked the black woven cloth sheathing and that it was thick enough to resist being kinked or bent (unlike - apparently - the cord I just took off my Blueray player which looks like it is almost broken).  The ends are 24K gold plated to improve the connectivity between the cord and the unit and ensure you have no transmission loss (most stock cables are aluminum).  The cord supports up 2160p.  The 13 foot length is super long - maybe a little too long to connect up anything you need at your entertainment center.  However, it can be very useful if you have to set your XBOX 360 or PS4 away from the rest of your electronics if you have no space in my entertainment center like me.  Since I got two cables, I put one on my cable box and the other on my Blueray player so I shouldn't see any resolution issues for now on.Overall I really liked this cord.  In the case of wiring for your entertainment pleasure, bigger is always better.  However, the cable thickness on this monster actually slightly impeded its usefulness as it is tough to maneuver it around bends and in tight spaces.  Because of this, I disconnected a number of other cords, ran this one first in as straight a line as I could and then reconnected the rest of the cords.  However, this is a minor hurdle to jump in order to use this high end cord.

*** NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***The IBRA 6 Feet High Speed HDMI Cable is clearly a high quality product.  I liked the blue striped cloth sheathing and that it was thick enough to resist being kinked or bent (unlike - apparently - the cord I just took off my Blueray player which looks like it is almost broken).  The ends are 24K gold plated to improve the connectivity between the cord and the unit and ensure you have no transmission loss (most stock cables are aluminum).  The cord supports up 2160p.  The six foot length is plenty long to connect up anything you need at your entertainment center.  Since I got two cables, I put one on my cable box and the other on my Blueray player so I shouldn't see any resolution issues for now on.Overall I really liked this cord.  In the case of wiring for your entertainment pleasure, bigger is always better!

***NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***The VicTsing Solar Powered Landscape Light is really a fine product. The four-LED spotlight is connected to the collector via a short arm. The light has two settings - basically high and low - and I like the low setting as it kind of has a soft-white look and is not one of those blindingly bright lights. I have it pointed up the side of my house near my front door as a pretty accent feature. The light is staked into the ground and can be adjusted up and down 90 degrees. The solar collector is also adjustable and it can swing almost 180 deg from straight down to nearly vertical.  Both the light and the collector are locked in position via a thumbscrew.The collector itself is very good looking and doesn't look "cheap". The instructions state that the collector should point south with full sun to work.  However, the corner of my house is positioned NW and thus the collector is point SE - and behind a tree.  Even though I have the collector facing away from direct south and intermittently shaded by a tree, the lights are still on bright and clear for hours. In fact, I was really impressed at just how bright the lights were - very attractive!  The spotlight turns off and on at the touch of a button on the rear of the collector and the brightness can be adjusted between the two levels by hitting the same button again. It senses the light levels so it will on come on and night and shut off at daybreak on its own.Overall, I was greatly impressed and satisfied with the VicTsing Solar Powered Landscape Light. This product is not yet priced, but similar lights from other vendors are $18-$20.  Since, the light in general and the solar cell in particular are clearly high quality and this is one of the few products that I've reviewed that I would actually be willing to pay more for than the average price. Two thumbs way up on this one!

***NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***The VicTsing Solar Powered Landscape Light is really a fine product. The four-LED spotlight is connected to the collector via a short arm. The light has two settings - basically high and low - and I like the low setting as it kind of has a soft-white look and is not one of those blindingly bright lights. Priced at $27.99 it is priced in the higher range of this type of fixed-panel, landscape light.  However, the light in general and the solar cell in particular are clearly high quality and this is one of the few products that I've reviewed that I would actually be willing to pay more for than the list price. Two thumbs way up on this one!

*** NOTE: I received a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review. ***I have several products from Colore and I've been very happy with their quality.  The Colore 26 Piece Sketch & Drawing Pencil Set is another great example of this.  Included in the set is 12 graphite pencils (one each of 5H, 4H, 3H, 2H, HB, B, 2B, 3B, 4B, 5B, 6B, 8B), three charcoal pencils in soft, medium and hard grades, one soft graphite sketching pencil, three graphite and three charcoal sticks in soft, medium and hard grades, one sharpener and one plastic eraser for graphite sticks, and one sharpener and one kneaded eraser for charcoal sticks.My daughter is not an "artiste" by any stretch of the imagination, but she really enjoys art and drawing on her sketch pads and as such, this was a great set for her to branch out a little more and explore more complex art forms such as shading with the graphite sticks and using the various hardness of the pencils to enhance her black and white drawings.  She also liked the case as we opened it carefully so that she could continue to use it to store her supplies.Although I had given her my engineering drafting pack from college which still had several different pencils in it, this set really expanded what I had already given her and will great aid her in developing her burgeoning artistic talent.  A very great set all around!

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest review. ***The Superman and Wonder Woman aprons are really a fabulous looking set.  I was a big comic book fan as a kid and I love the classic graphics of their torsos on the black background.  The aprons are made of satin and seem kind of thin, but the material is strong and well made with well-sewn seams.  I'm 6'6" and the aprons went about halfway down my thighs.  A drawback for me was that the drawstrings are kind of short so I wasn't able to loop them around and tie them off on my chest like I usually do.  Overall I thought that the aprons were fun and very attractive!

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest review. ***The LaoHe Tempered Glass Screen Protector for the iPhone 6s is extremely easy to install - much easier than alot of the thin films that I've installed on my phones, iPods, and iPads.  The three step process includes wiping the screen with a small wet cleaning rag, then wiping it with a dry rag (both included), and then applying the screen protector.  The screen protector is easily laid over the screen after removing a light film and I only had to reposition it once.  Thankfully because the screen protector is a little thicker than the typical screen protector, I was able to grab the edge of the glass and slowly lift it up and off the phone.  Once applied, I had no issues using the phone.  The $7.99 purchase price is in the higher range of the middle of the pack for tempered glass screen protectors on Amazon.com.  Overall its a really great product from LaoHe!

*** NOTE: I was given a free product sample in exchange for an honest product review. ***The IBRA Stereo Audio Cable is a high quality product and works very well between my iDevices and my headphones and the auxiliary input on my Bluetooth speakers.  The silver woven nylon cable is very strong, essentially kink-proof, and attractive.  The five foot length of the cable is sufficient for basically anything I'd need to use a speaker cord for.  Overall I am very satisfied with the quality and clear sound transmission of the IBRA cable.

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest review. ***Wolverine's brown Men's Basic Milled Leather Strap Belt is a very heavy duty belt and reminds me of belts that ranchers would wear.  The belt itself is made of very thick (3/16" thick and 1 11/16" wide) and very rugged leather and is much wider and thicker than any belt I've ever purchased (I own three other belts and the BIGGEST one is 1/16" thick and 1 1/4" wide).  In fact it was a little bit of a struggle to even get it through the belt loops and a bigger struggle to get it through the front loop after buckling it and it is too wide for my iPhone clip.The construction of the belt appears to be very high grade.  The brown dye is very strong in color, the 2 1/4" long brass-colored belt buckle appears to be very strong, and the belt is tightly stitched together on the edges.  The underside of the belt is soft and smooth leather.  Highlighting the quality construction, the seven belt notches are reinforced by a strip of leather on the underside of the belt.I ordered a 40" belt because I have a 35/36" waist and wanted to make sure I had some overlap.  I'm not sure how Wolverine sizes their belts, but the belt arrived and it is 47 1/4" long.  That seems huge, but honestly it seems like the belt is the perfect size.  I'm using the third of seven belt notches and after buckling the belt, I have 6 1/2" of belt left from the where the buckle attaches to the belt to the end of the belt and 4" from the belt loop on my pants to the end of the belt which is basically perfect.  Because I'm not on the first or last belt notch, I have room to gain or lose weight without having to buy another belt.Overall, I really liked the belt.  I would have liked it a little more if it wasn't so wide (1 1/2" would have been a little more preferable) as the width of the belt is basically the same width as the belt loops on my jeans and its wider than my iPhone case clip.  However, you really can't fault the construction of the belt and by the looks of it, the belt is going to last for years!

*** NOTE: I received a free product sample in exchange for an honest review. ***The BakeitFun Silicone Baking Mat With Measurements is a really nice alternative to using wax paper or other liners for your baking.  We received the 16.5" X 11" half-sheet mat which was a perfect fit for our baking pans.  We used it several times for cookies and the pre-drawn circles were very convenient to ensure we had proper spacing when rolling out our dough.  The measurements on the side were perfect for measuring our dough when making bread and pretzels.  However the aspect that I think I liked the best was that the Silicone mat was essentially stick-free which made cleanup a snap - because there was practically no cleanup needed.  After using it for baking, we simply hand-washed the mat (it is also dishwasher safe), sat it out to dry, and then rolled it up to store away in a drawer.Overall, I couldn't be happier with the BakeitFun Silicone Baking Mat.  Both my daughter and wife commented on how easy it was to use and how easy it made cleanup!

The Wisk Deep Clean PowerBlasts Laundry Detergent is a quick and handy way to do your laundry - assuming you always do full/large loads of laundry (which I typically do).  If you do small loads, the amount of detergent is overkill since its one-size-fits-all.  As far as cleanliness of your clothes after using Wisk PowerBlasts, it was equally as clean as my typically laundry detergent (which is a homemade blend).
