With haunting prose, harsh details of history come to life, and the women of immigration find their voice and strength. Appropriately, this happens in a land where, as the final tale (by guest writer Shelly Davies) shows, “even thought it was the men who were out ithe front in the war parties, politicking and making speeches, women were a powerful influence. A force to be reckoned with.”Author Rebecca Burns may also be a force to be reckoned with, and this short novel deserves to be a classic.Disclosure: I was given a free ecopy and I offer my honest review.

Bleakly cynical, brutally honest, and surreally irreverent, The Tragedy of Fidel Castro offers a sometimes uncomfortable juxtaposition of tragedy and comedy, raising Fidel Castro, FDR, and others to the status of myth as the gods look down or maybe intervene. “In their own muddled way, they’re both trying to imitate you,” says G to first-born son J, while Fatima listens and disparate threads come together.Long passages of introspection characterize this tale, combined with complex and conflicting motivations, mystical rumination, and the greater tragedy of human history, rendered magically surreal. Biblical parables and parallels abound. The madness of Nebachudnezzar repeats itself in a different frame. And diplomacy might be heaven’s only hope a well as mankind’s.The Tragedy of Fidel Castro is a long, slow, complex read, weightily self-conscious, with darkly tragi-comic humor, fierce determination, and a powerfully unsettling sense of unhinging divinities behind the scenes.Disclosure: I was given a free ecopy and I offer my honest review.

Lori Benton brings the world of North America’s clashing cultures to life in this first novel of the Pathfinders series. The story is set in a time when America is moving toward independence, with great facts of history woven gently into the lives and concerns of everyday people. War’s accidental cruelties, loyalties unintentionally broken, and lives torn apart by actions that can’t be undone, all play their part. Meanwhile different faiths come into conflict, as Oneida tribesmen and women ponder the implications of the Christian Father Creator.The author weaves her Christianity seamlessly into this story. For some characters, it’s a vital part of their lives. For others it’s neglected or cruel. And for still others, faith is that thing which renders them unforgivably, permanently guilty and deserving of pain. But a father’s dream of vengeance is set against a parent’s unfailing love. A poor man’s need to hunt for food meets the rich man’s need for land. And the lives of tribe and settler begin to intertwine.I love how the author renders her characters’ worlds, thoughts and beliefs so vividly real. I love the innate generosity of their interactions. And I love the promise of hope, as life changes people and the world faces anger and pain. Well-timed, well-placed hints of scripture sing like the songs of Wales, while lovingly-told traditions of the older world offer a wonderful counterpoint. A girl who knows more medicine than men will allow, meets a man who needs more medicine than human care can give. Nature and nurture will come face to face with the contentment of acceptance. And nightmare’s dreams might come true.The story builds on human error, trusts in divine purpose, and stands its ground on the back stage of history. It builds to a perfect conclusion, not quite complete, but finished enough to leave the reader satisfied and eager for more. This will surely be a great series.Disclsoure: Blogging for Books provided this book to me for free in exchange for an honest review.

In 1866, the Civil War was over and the gold rush was in full swing. Prospectors headed West and demanded protection from their government on the trail. But the trail to Montana’s gold rush territory went straight through lands belonging to the Oglala Lakota. And Red Cloud had no desire to see his people further hounded from the lands first given to them. The nation sought peace, but not peace at any price. Paul Goble’s simply told story offers insight into the price that would be paid.Told through the eyes of the fictional nineteen-year-old Brave Eagle, Red Cloud’s War invites young readers and listeners into the heart of a camp filled with talking and arguing, into the lives of chiefs and warriors who might desire peace and the white man’s gifts, but will not sell their heritage, and into the darkness of mistrust and war on ancient hunting grounds. Complex ideas are simply told and brought to life. Nicely drawn maps reveal what’s promised and denied. And the fighting that ensues is vividly described, frightening, cruel and implacable as white man’s boast meets a warrior’s determination.There’s no reveling in death and destruction in this tale, and no heavily weighted scorn for past mistakes. Rather it’s a nicely nuanced, well-told account, offered with convincing voice, and beautifully illustrated with images to capture the smallest and largest child’s attention. The author’s attention to detail is just as pure and convincing in his invitation to the Sun Dance as in the uniting of tribes for battle. Likewise, sorrow for the past is pleasingly balanced with genuine humanity and hope.A lovely book to read and share with children, this is a treasure for adults as well, revealing a past too often obscured or turned to myth and TV excitement. I really enjoyed reading it.Disclosure: I was given a free copy by the publisher and read it straight away with eager delight.

Lovely titles, beautifully organized, invite the reader into the pages of A F Stewart’s Colours of Poetry. The pages are filled with poems of many different forms, but the author creates a very natural feel in each form, and even, wisely, includes an explanation of poetic forms at the end.The organization of the poems follows the rules of poetry as surely as do the poems, with each new concept flowing naturally from the last. The Devil’s Deal – “A sky tongue / silver some may say ... and moonlight at the crossroads...” – might be my favorite. Or lyrical beauty might draw me in, as in, “Shall we dance with angels / far above the velvet clouds, / where the stars whisper light / and cast it to the eyes below?” But perhaps instead I’ll “spend our transitory sanity /chasing gilded gleams of hope,” Under the Midnight Sun.Tyrian Purple offers the cruelties of lost and broken loves, of wounded earth, and of histories colored with beauty, together with poetic hints of hope.But another favorite is Ashen, or maybe Horizon. Hope flows down through darkness as pages turn, and Ann’s Stardust Farewell offers shape and meaning as well as dedication for this collection. Colors of Poetry is a beautiful book, to dip into or to read page after page, haunting, absorbing, and beautifully drawn.Disclosure: I won a free ecopy and I offer my honest review.

Heart of a Lion is probably my favorite Stephen Zimmer book to date, and not just because of the strong female lead protagonist. The novel offers a cool blend of real-world and fantasy, like Game of Thrones without the weighty politics. Convincingly different characters people lands that might almost belong to our own history. And blond Nordic Raven picks her fights and her loyalties, moving swiftly and surely through civilizations that feel hauntingly real.Starting nicely in the middle of her adventures, author Stephen Zimmer allows the reader to follow Raven’s journey back home from unknown action in southern lands. Neat details offer the chance to speculate about where she’s been and why, making this the sort of novel that sticks with you long after the reading’s done. Loyalties are tested, tied and broken, or tidily left behind, avoiding that agony of continued protection or unchallenged inconvenience, and making Raven achingly human and real. But she’s more than that. She’s a hero with heart, a fighter with soul, and a clever tactician with a willingness to listen and a mind to question the unknown.Slowly, more bits of that complex unknown reveal themselves, as darkness gathers and the tale continues. Pleasingly lyrical passages of description are nicely juxtaposed with fast, well-choreographed action scenes, and convincing introspection. Fight and flight are equally convincing and human, while satisfying strengths and wise changes of heart raise the novel far above the norm. Read on to a perfect ending, relax and sigh, then prepare for more because that darkness is still gathering, and war will come.I’m eager to read the next in the series. This is seriously cool fantasy with a wonderful lion-hearted hero.Disclosure: I was given a free ecopy and I offer my honest review.

If you liked Jean Auel’s Earth’s Children series, or Kathleen Flannigan’s Misfits and Heroes, and you like fast reads, you will probably enjoy Harper Swan’s Raven’s Choice. First in the Replacement Chronicles, it blends past and present, combining stories of cause with effect as a young man at a present day conference learns the mysteries hidden in DNA.Back in the past, a young woman who feels as surely out of place as her present-day counterpart, faces the struggle to fit into a changing society without the protection of a husband. The story is starkly true to life, well-researched, and pleasingly convincing. Raven has a choice to make, and someone always has to be first; someone must surely be the ancestor, and the ancestor’s decision might ring its results over farflung times.By the end of this novella, Raven’s unclear future has a definite direction. Readers will be satisfied to have seen and guessed her choice, but will still want more. Hopefully that is what the author will offer. But this bite-sized piece stands alone as an intriguing, fast-told novella of small decisions and major implications, in a convincingly drawn, hard and beautiful, distant world.Disclosure: I was given a free ecopy and I offer my honest review.

Amanda Marie’s Torii takes readers from mythic beginnings in a land of tragedy, sorrow and sword, to a world of rich teenagers in modern-day Miami. These times and places are linked, but the modern teen has a certain unwillingness to accept things beyond their ken, and a race to save the world is on, dependent on the love of cars and dogs and the friendship of strangers. Of course, some of these strangers will be considerably stranger than others as the novel progresses.Torii is beautifully presented on the page with nicely scripted chapter headings and well-measured space. The characters are youthful and fun, and the writing is fast, racing with equal swiftness through confusion, identities, excitement and flying simulations. Soon Mayuri and Killian pilot their vehicles with strangely mythical friends, carefully remembering “No red button,” and “flying for a hundred miles, avoiding normal things like birds, mountains, and other planes.” Their view of the world is somewhat changed.Think Ender’s Game, crossed with Twilight, a touch of Harry Potter, a pinch of Tokein’s worlds, and maybe even some time travel, all youthfully, breathlessly told. Betrayal, evil foes, wrong-headed friends, plus the chance to be “no longer part of the human world.” It’s a heady mix. No wonder “Mayuri’s heart erupted in her ears” while “Ty gripped her staff tighter, baring her teeth much like a dog would.”By turns scary, thrilling, imaginative, and sometimes even magical, Torii is a tale filled with a wealth of strange places and characters all pleasingly delineated to minimize confusion in a fascinating tortuous plot. Plus there’s that curious anchor to earth. And romance. And the promise of further tales to come.Disclosure: I won a free ecopy and I offer my honest review

Fans of Teric Darken’s horror novels will know what to expect from this dark Christian tale of horror by K. R. Morrison. Aspects of faith are clearly and convincingly told, offering the truth that God doesn’t protect us from every danger, but does indeed, if unexpectedly, answer prayer.The story builds on a blend of Twilight with the everyday and middle age. Lydia is a convincing everywoman – no great heroine of life or of faith. But she faces challenges that blend darkness and light, leading to oceans of guilt and skies of forgiveness. When “[s]he crept down the hallway, noticing that her eyesight was immeasurably better in the dark than it used to be,” readers will know which way the darkness is flowing, but not how dark it will surely get. Still, Lydia will never be quite alone, and a Voice will comfort and guide her to exactly where she needs to be.K. R. Morrison’s novel explores questions of salvation and freewill, destiny, angels and more, while wearing the weighty cloak of traditional horror. The story builds to a truly terrifying climax, while creating an image of real and natural family life, dialog filled with the everyday, and calls to Mass and worship combined with divine calls to wait and obey.“Peace I leave with you. Do not fear.” Wise bishops, dark powers, dangerous forces, and powerful good stand arrayed at the end. Be Not Afraid is a slowly told tale, heavy on detail both natural and supernatural, accurate with very humanly distracted dialog, strong in faith, and haunting in terror. It’s a slow read, but offers plenty to enjoy and to think about.Disclosure: I won a free copy and I offer my honest review.

The manufacturer sent me one of these to check out and test. I am usually pretty hesitant to review camera accessories because as you know there are a million companies out there. And they are all out there making their own version of the same thing.Selfie sticks range in cost from $10 to about $50 and I would venture to say that the majority of the people who use them automatically go for the cheapest one out there. Sandmarc has a reputation of being high quality and this does not disappoint. The first thing that I look at is the build quality you start at the handle and work your way up from there.The componentsThe Handle.5” long has a bicycle style (rubber) handgrip on It. What I like is that there is a positive stop at both the top and the bottom so that your hand won't slip off even if it's wet, It's about 1 1/4” wide which is extremely comfortable to hold. The handle also has an integrated strap which ensures that even if the stick gets knocked out of your hand you won't drop your expensive camera.The Extensions.The stick has two sections that extend out of the main section. The first section adds about 7.5” the second adds about 8.5” giving you a total length of 25” to where the camera mounts. What I really like is the round locks that keep the sections in place. They only require ¼ turn to lock or unlock and are made from a high quality aluminum which keeps the weight down but is still very strong.The MountThis is a standard mount for a GoPro camera has a nice adjustment screw to keep your camera secured. My one complaint with Sandmarc is that they do not make a universal adapter so that you can use this stick with other cameras as well as with your GoPro.OverallI just keep thinking that this is a beautifully made product it is simple, elegant,  durable and built with very high quality components. If you are serious about your videos you really need to be picky about your accessories and this is definitely one to check out.

There are a ton of USB chargers out there. Trying to decipher which is best is pretty darn close to impossible. This manufacturer sent me a sample to play with and see what I thought of it.Unit wise it's a standard brick style with a detachable 110v power cord. I tend to prefer these over the ones where the whole unit hangs on the wall for a few reasons but the main one is because I can plug it in remotely and sit it on my nightstand, desk or anywhere I may need it.  I use this type of charger in two places 1st is at home on my kitchen counter. This is where the kids plug in their Samsung 10" tablets and an older Kindle fire. The second unit is in our master bedroom. It gets a Samsung 12' Tablet, two Samsung S4's and occasionally a set of Bluetooth headphones.I tested this charger in both spots and ran into no problems charging any devices. I saw that someone commented that they noticed a slightly longer charge time when all six ports are being used, I personally did not but I can see where if your devices are all trying to pull the maximum power from each port that it would in fact slow down the charge.One of the things that annoyed me in my last charger of this type is that on occasion it would not charge the Samsung 10" galaxy Note tablets to 100%. It would take them to about 70% and then stop charging. This was very annoying and has not happened so far regardless fo which port is used on the device. If it pops up or any other problems arise I will update the review. Overall I'm happy with this item, It has performed as expected. In all honesty it's difficult to get excited about this type of product. In my experience with around 30 of this type of unit they either A. work well B, work decently or C. die when you plug them in. In my experience this type of purchase is usually a pretty good one as out of 30  I have only had one that stunk and one that died.Generally my rating system has always been 3 stars = meets expectations 4 or 5 = exceeds expectations and 1or 2 stars = it stinks.Unfortunately people don't seem to like that so It works well, It didn't start a fire I'll give it 4 stars.My only complaint with this unit is that just like most USB chargers on the market today. The current trend is towards larger screens, More powerful CPU's and definitely bigger battery capacities to keep up with all of that. So, My question is why would you short change your product by underpowering it? If some devices you know people will be using it require just shy of 2.5amps, why not spend the extra buck or two and make a 15amp charger that will charge any device at the fastest rate regardless of which port you use? That's my one gripeHope you found this helpful, If you have comments or questions please feel free to post them I usually answer them within 24 hours.

Not sure what happened. I bought four of these used Syrup as directed and I got a total of six flies on one and NOTHING on the others!Maybe I used teh wrong type of syrup? Don't know but not buying them again.

I was given a sample of this a few months ago and because of work haven't been able to sit down and review it till now.This is a very neat little product, small at 2" square has a full range speaker and a passive radiator that helps widen the sound spectrum and add a small amount of bass into the mix. Quality of this cube is on par with other Mango products that I have tested in the last year and they all have been rock solid with zero failures out of 6-8 products.This item is splash proof and has a spot where you can attach a keychain to it. Battery life is hard to tell but I got at least 4-5 hours before it stopped working and charging is simple with the included USB cable.Testing the product inside it created very good sound and quite loud levels of music, Outside it fell a bit short on volume but in all honesty I didi not expect the volume that it produces from such a tiny package.This works best for music but I did try it streaming a couple of shows from Hulu and it was very acceptable with adequate volume outside as long as the cube was within a few feet of where you were. While there was a very slight delay caused by the bluetooth signal it was minimal and did not bother me at all.Overall, If you want a tiny speaker that will most definitely outperform even the speakers on a large tablet (I tested this with a Samsung Note 12" tablet).

I was given the opportunity to test a sample of this product and after a few weeks of using the batteries in my LED flashlight I am pretty happy with them. Neither the batteries nor the charger have given me any problems.Construction of the charger seems on par with other good quality chargers that I have used in the past. I wish there was more to say but besides they work well it's hard to get excited about a couple batts and a charger!

This is a pretty simple product it is two straps that criss cross each other allowing you to ensure that your bag doesn't open up while being thrown around by careless baggage handlers.But that's not why I wanted one. For me the more important thing is being able to quickly identify my bag as it comes around the carousel. On my old luggage I took a can of yellow spray paint and sprayed the bottom of the bag. I did not want to do that with my new hardside luggage so this was a great alternative. Since my bags are blue in color the orange straps very nicely highlight the luggage making it super easy to tell which one is mine.They are not super cheap but they are well made. I will mention that they stink really bad when you first get them, It's hard to describe but kinda an oily smell that wore off within 24 hours.Overall it does what it advertises plus it makes your luggage more visible so it's a win win  I was able to use this even on my largest 28" hardside spinner so should fit most bags.The vendor gave me a coupon for this purchase for reviewing purposes.

I got one of these as a reviewing sample and while I have reviewed a ton of bluetooth headphones I have only had teh opportunity to test one other Bluetooth mini boombox such as this.I was quite shocked at how loud this thing is I tested it with one of our Samsung Galaxy Noe Tablets and it performed very well. When testing Bluetooth devices I like perform 3 tests. First is the easy one which is music. Music has nothing to look at which means there is no delay which affects video playback when using radio communications.So Music. The device played back music effortlessly. It achieved surprising volume and had very good bass response from such a small device. When you look at the unit you can see that there are two speakers pointing forward and two passive radiators shooting directly downward. What I found interesting is that the manufacturer fails to take full advantage of the units capabilities by only placing rubber pads on the bottom of the unit. You can improve the sound quality by placing something in the middle of the unit to lift it up off the surface so that the radiators can emit more sound.Video playback.I tested the unit while streaming a movie from Netflix. I found that there was a slight delay but it was very tolerable. You can clearly see that the lips and sound are out of alignment but it did not bother me.Game playback. This is where the delay between what you see on the screen and what you hear bothered me the most. While playing a game you can clearly see your character do something but the related sound definitely has a very perceivable delay.Bonus test. Computer or laptop speaker. This unit has a standard stereo input connection. I was able to simply connect my laptop to it and get much improved sound quality while watching Netflix.What's included:1x USB cable1x mini stereo connectorStar ratingEven though I found the delay annoying during game playback I really liked how the unit performed. I found that it was definitely loud enough to use outside which the previous and much smaller unit I tested was not. I also liked the fact that there was the ability to connect your device directly completely bypassing the problems that Bluetooth brings to the table.

I was in the process of writing a review for this product. I stopped to take a few pictures of the bulb and as I wiped it with a dry rag it fell apart. You can read the review that was in process when this happened  but I can not recommend this product.Look at the LE 5 watt 10 pack  Amazon ID B00IXG3S0CI have been testing LED lights now for almost ten years. The opportunity to check out a new release in a category already crowded with competitors from both name brands such as Philips, CREE  and the  numerous Import brands from overseas was really something I was excited about.My first LED Candelabra base bulb was only rated for two watts and produced an ugly blueish white color. Since then the power output of each new generation has increased bringing this type of bulb into the mainstream and makes switching from the old fashioned Incandescent bulbs of yesterday to today's high tech, low power LED's of tomorrow an easy and economically sound decision.This bulb worried me when I opened the package. In my experience with this type of bulb, The ones that use multiple tiny LED chips mounted on the surface generally have quality and longevity issues. On the 50 or so bulbs that I have tested I have found a much higher failure rate when many chips are used when compared to bulbs that use 1 large LED chip.The reason for this is usually that something goes wrong, either within the wiring connecting all the chips or with the chips themselves. You can see this by simply reviewing other peoples experience with this product as at least one reports some of the chips failing.Now to be clear NONE of the chips have failed on the sample I was provided, However I will also note that in the week that I have had the bulb in use it has only seen about 36 hours of use.My last LED bulb purchase (Jan 21st 2015) of this type of bulb was for the LE brand 10 pack which retails here on Amazon for $52.99. Comparing the two bulbs shows some stark differences between the two technologies.So the Lohas bulb (This one) does appear significantly brighter when you look at it in the fixture. However when comparing the actual amount of light emitted by the bulb by holding a sheet of bright white paper next to it shows a few things.1. The bulb outputs more light out to the sides. This is very evident as there is at least a 15% when compared to the 5 watt competitor from LE.2. The bulb produces almost no light through the tip of the bulb_________________This is when the bulb broke, end of review.I was given a free sample for review purposes

I was given a set of these to check out and review. I have tested now about 8-9 sets of Bluetooth headsets and these rival them all in tems of sound and weight however they do have some caveats.Sound qualityIn order to test any wireless headphone or speaker I put them through 3 tests.1. Music. Playback of Sirius radio or Pandora  was excellent. The headphones reproduce a wide spectrum of sound and unlike many wireless headphones these have excellent bass response.2. Video Game. I played several games and noticed a very slight delay. The updated signal capability of Bluetooth 4.1 pretty much means that the delay is negligible. There was only one instance where the delay was noticeable and annoying and that was when in a game I held my finger on the"buy" icon and the constant sound of change clicking was very annoying. Other than that the delay was very tolerable and did not really present a problem. Sound quality while playing a game was also excellent. I like to play racing games and most of teh headphones I have tested in the past had zero bass when the engines roared with these there was a good amount.3. Movies both on device and streamed. A slight delay is noticeable and seemed more prevalent when the movie was streamed rather than loaded on the device. This is most likely the dual effect of streaming and having to send and decode the bluetooth signal. It wasn't bad and as I said earlier overall it was the least annoying of all the wireless headsets I have tested. If I were to describe it I would say there is a millisecond between when let's say an explosion happens on the screen and the sound comes out of the headset. It's there if you look for it but otherwise it's not bad.Other observations.The last set of Bluetooth headsets I tested had a rigid (and short) wire between the two headpieces. These have a rather long and very soft wire going between them. The ones with the rigid wire loop over your ears to keep the headset in place these do not they merely pressure fit in place.  Personally for workout purposes I prefer the ones with the over the ear rigid wire. These I had to keep putting them back in and then sometimes if you push them too far the rubber shroud over the speaker blocks the sound and you have to pull them out just a hair.Comfort and in ear feel.Each headset has a little rubber band that kinda holds onto the inner ear lobe to hold the pieces in your ear. The box contains several extras, I am not sure if they are different sizes and some have mentioned, they look to be the same size. I found the inner round part that goes in your ear to be uncomfortable. It seemed to be slightly too large for me but I should also state that I generally find in ear headsets to be uncomfortable.Overall.I really liked the sound, not so big on the thin long wire between them. I also found the USB cover on the headset to be hard to remove I had to pick at it for a few seconds before I just decided to use a knife to pry the cover off (That's really just nit picking though).  Here is my star breakdownSound = 5 starsquality = 4 starscomfort = 3 starsOverall 4 stars (avg)

The best product available for tough lawn issues.Every once and awhile you get a client who has let their lawn go just a bit too long and has gotten themselves overwhelmed with weeds or Crabgrass.This is a great product. However, I would not recommend it to the average homeowner (this is a group 4 Herbicide it's serious stuff) until they have exhausted all other options (see note below). However if you have tried the regular stuff from Bayer, Scotts and Spectracide and none have worked for you then this is your next step.Take into consideration that this product can not just be sprayed down. This needs to be applied in conjunction with a  methylated seed oil. I would recommend using  DyneAmic Surfactant with it. I liek that this product is pet safe (follow the included directions) and that it is fast acting and you will see results within 5-7 days. However beware that it can not be applied to all lawns the manufacturer clearly states" DO NOT apply to Bahiagrass, carpetgrass, St. Augustinegrass, centipedegrass, dichondra, or lawns or turf where desirable clovers are present". My personal recommendation before you head down this route is to try a product called QuinKill Max Crabgrass and Weed Killer. It is available here on Amazon  B00NPBJKJS.What it comes down to is crabgrass is an annual plant that can easily be controlled if you follow some basic steps.https://www.amazon.com/review/R35UYTNX8KUQ4V/ref=cm_cr_rdp_permHope you find this helpful, please feel free to ask questions I try to answer them within 24 hours.

I live in Chicago and even though there are a ton of bike lanes and bike trails scattered throughout the city and surreounding suburbs you still end up in the street quite a bit.These are small 1" round battery powered LED's that are mounted to your bike with a rubber mounting band. The band is adjustable to go around anything from your seat post to the main frame. The lights themselves merely fit snugly into the mounting band and then you simply latch the band to itself and you are ready to ride.The lights have three modes. Constant on, Fast flash and slow flash. I tend to prefer the slow flash but that is personal preference.There are both things I really like about these and one thing that concerns me about them.Likes1. Increases your safety by 1000% They are very visible even in daylight2. Easily mounts to any bike.3. easily removes so that you can use them on multiple bikes. (has a caveat)4. Very easy to replace batteries, mine even came with extra batteries (haven't needed them yet!)5. no wiring! I love that fact! (you can buy a 20 pack of energizer flat batteries for these for $12 on that popular auction site) I estimate that the provided batteries should last you a whole season.DislikesSo living in Chicago means you have to deal with people. Old people, Young people, Kids and Teenagers. Basicly a boat-load of people. Some of those folks not very nice. I use a Kryptonite chain which I kid you not is heavier than my bike. So my complaint here? Just as easy as it is to mount these to your bike in .25 seconds it's also just as easy for that teenager to steal them off your bike just for the fun of it.  Personally I would have preferred something with a hard plastic mount that required at minimum a screwdriver to put on and take off.Now I did not use that negative against my rating because I know that if the bike is out of my sight I just snap them off. Overall I really like these lights they are a simple way to increase your safety. I even use them when I am towing a child buggy around I just mount them to the back of the buggy and off we go!I received a free sample of this product.

I received an email from this vendor asking if I wanted to try one of these out. I try to be picky at what I review. Basicly if teh product is not something I would use i tend to stay away from them.I have been wanting to buy one if these for quite a while, just never really went out and did it. After receiving the unit we went out to Costco and bought a 2 pack of hand soap.  I opened the package and unboxed the unit. My first impressions of the unit were that it felt cheap and very lightweight. It comes in two pieces the main housing and the little feet that hold it upright. The feet are removable so that you can insert the 4 sized AA batteries.Powering up the unit is easy it has a power button on the top of it. You push the power button and mine immediately started to run the motor. The unit took a few waves of the hand before soap actually came out of it as the pump needed to prime itself.So before we got this we had been buying the $1 plastic soap pumps that you get at Walmart or Target. My complaint about those it that the kids seemed to always go through a ton of soap. It just seemed like we ended up replacing those bottles after two to three weeks. Wahat I like about this unit is that it pumps out a consistent amount of soap. For me personally I think it's slightly less soap than I would like but as far as the kids are concerned I am very happy with how much it spits out (I sometimes find myself double dipping).So here is what I like about the unit.1. Hold a good amount of soap.2. Doesn't seem to get played with by the kids compared to the small plastic bottles that they make a mess with.3. Dispenses just the right amount of soap for the kids.4 looks ok.5. so far it has worked flawlessly.Some negatives1. not adjustable (amount of soap it dispenses)2. Casing feels cheap3. not a fan of chromeOverall. I am giving the product 4 stars. Mainly because it has worked so well in the last week. (I will update if that changes). I really love the concept and am torn between buying 3 more of these or choosing another brand. I think I am going to continue using this for a whole month and then make my decision

I received one of these from the manufacturer for reviewing purposes.My entertainment system is located in the kitchen, But the TV and speakers are in the family room. I did this because we had a cabinet that was not being used in the kitchen and did not want components visible in the family room. I have used many HDMI cables, My personal preference has been towards Blue Rigger Brand for years. I've also never purchased one that is flat before and that drew me to taking a closer look at this one.I'm going to break this down to 3 categories 1. Build quality 2. signal transfer and 3. Overall usefulness.So1. Build qualityThe cable is 35 feet long it has industry standard gold plated connectors on each end. The cable itself measures only 1/8" thick by 1/2" wide. so compared to the standard cable that is 3/8" round it is very easy to conceal. Just as you would expect from any good quality cable the ends are properly attached and they feature strain relief fittings to prevent damage when the cable is flexed.2. Signal transferThis one is hard to test without proper equipment as you would expect it easily transferred a 1080P signal from my Denon AVR4520ci with no issues. However, I did test the cable for signal interference and results were mixed results. I laid the cable out (on the floor) from the kitchen to the family room connected it to the receiver and my Sharp Aquos television. I ran a Bluray through it to an as expected excellent picture. However when I played with a 110v extension cord or the DC adapter to my children's Xbox 360 charger the cable picked up some interference which showed up as distortion on the TV. Now in all fairness when I ran 4 HDMI cables from my media cabinet to the family room I did not test them in the same way. Secondly I don't have an unused one to test either so it may be something that happens with all HDMI cables.3. Overall UsefulnessSo as far as cables go it is a well built unit. What was a major turn off for me is two fold. First is labeling. Here is what I mean by that. I pick up a competitors cable and on the cord it says the following " High Speed HDMI tm Cable with Ethernet E329703 (UL)TYPE CL3 75*C  26 CSA250674 CMG 26AWG FT4"So what does this cable say? "High Speed Cable"So which one would you pick? Well here are two things that the labeling tells me. 1. UL Underwriters Laboratory, now do ALL electrical devices need to be UL listed? No. But, it tells me they took that extra step. 2. CL3, What does that mean? well it means that the cable is suitable for running through a wall. Remember I said that my media cabinet was in the Kitchen? Well I used 50' CL3 cables to run down into the basement ran them to the family room and then back up to provide a clean installation. This particular cable is not suitable for that purpose.ConclusionIf you just need to run between point A and point B and NOT go into a wall this is a great cable. Personally I don't see a huge demand for such a long cable that is not CL rated but I may be wrong. Quality construction is there the lack of labeling is a huge turn off for me.

I wanted a small flashlight that was powerful. I already had some 18650 batteries so this was a perfect fit. I knew it was not going to be 2000 lumen as advertised but expected it to be at least half that.So right out of the box it feels very lightweight. I have several other flashlights from Duracell, Securitying etc.. So when compared to the Duracell for instance which is rated at 1000 lumen it's pretty pathetic. This produces nowhere near the brightens of the Duracell. Regardless of the zoom level it just doesn't come close to being as bright as the 1000 lumen Duracell.But there is more the LED on this emits a very blue light. I am used to flashlights that produce a high Kelvin color of 5000k but this is beyond that and is into the blue spectrum.Overall the build quality is not bad but as I mentioned when compared to other flashlights it just seems very lightweight.I'm going to try to return mine but since it's a non-Prime purchase I don't see that happening without having to pay shipping.

I bought these to illuminate a small loft area in our master bedroom Right now I have fluorescent tubes up there and they make a lot of noise for a bedroom (very loud hum).I ordered two of these in warm white and am pleasantly surprised by how bright they are. I am powering them with a JACKY LED 120 watt Power supply  B00IF4WYOS and it powers the two strips very well. (they are no-where near as bright as the 4x 8 foot florescent tubes but they are warm white not that terrible bright white and as I said they do not produce any sound.I have used other bulbs that incorporate the 5730 LEDs and they seem to be much brighter than any other LED currently available. I have tested the smaller 3528 and 5050's and these are the best so far.I have only been using this setup for a short while. So I can't really comment on longevity. However I agree with what others have said regarding the tape on these. The tape is absolutely terrible! First off my two reels where super sticky as the glue from the tape had gotten on the lights and was quite messy. then as I unrolled the lights it became apparent that the tape was not applied properly and had gaps in coverage seen as areas where the tape was completely pulled away from the rolled light strip. As I tried to lay the lights flat onto the ledge the tape completely separated from the lights and even after I managed to put it back the tape failed to hold onto a flat horizontal surface. You would have thought since the tape was merely holding the strip in place and not supporting any of its weight it would have been ok, but nope!I'd recommend getting some of that white foam 3m tape from an auto parts store if you need to hold this on a vertical surface. You may also need to use some mineral spirits to clean off the gummy residue that the cheap tape leaves.Overall I am somewhat happy the power supply and these two lights were $60 and I do not have that annoying hum of fluorescent bulbs. However, the tape issue is just a total mess with these and it took far longer to complete the project because I had to deal with it and teh residue it left all over the lights.Light output =5 starsmounting tape 1 star

I have been using Insteon Keypadlinc and switches for the last 10+ years. Basicly when they came out I started switching from the old X-10 switches to those from Smarthome.Right now I have 3 keypadlincs in my kitchen with another in the family room and another 6 scattered throughout the house. In teh last 10 or so years I have lost two keypads. Not sure what causes them to die but it happens. I have already swapped out my Keypadlincs once already. The first series did not have built in radio communication as the new ones do they were powerline transmission only. My home is 3000 SF and was built 12 years ago and for the most part I have never had any problems even when I was using the old switches and keypads.The new switches are much improved they are a bit heavier duty with much improved reception thanks to receiving signals both wirelessly and through the power lines.If I were to have a complaint I guess it would be that the old ones had clear plastic buttons so that you could print your own labels. In fact I took clipart of each light that we installed from google pics, made it tiny to fit the ( i think it was like 50x50 pixels) so each button had custom pictures of what they were controlling.I'm not super big into the home automation thing I just liek to be able to turn lights on from the next room, it's very convenient.I have considered switching from Insteon to Z-wave but it all comes down to 2 things. Ist I like the way the keypadlincs look. And 2, They are simple and do what I need them to do without a hub or jumping through any major hoops to get them to work.Overall I am quite happy, I have been starting to look around to see what is out there but as far as keypads with a built in switch nothing catches my eye.

I am usually not the one who needs this as I am pretty big on regular maintenance and following one of the 4 step systems out there.This year however I've had some health issues which have prevented me from doing much of the spring cleanup that I normally do. And as a result of not being out there I suddenly found myself being overrun by crabgrass and other nuisance weeds.So the first thing you notice is that this comes with hands down the best sprayer I have ever used. Unlike the ones on Scotts brand products that seem weak this one can shoot a nice powerful spray as fa as 8-9 feet. I also really liked that the product is dyed red so that is is easier to tell where it is being applied, I just think the combination of the two really makes a world of difference.So as far as weed killers go it seems to work pretty darn well. I will point out that it does take a while so if you think that you are going to spray it and come back the next day to a brown weed that is bent over you're setting yourself up for a huge disappointment. Realisticly it will take a week for it to die off completely and I would recommend not pulling it until it is dead as you want to make sure you kill the roots which are what propagate and cause more to shoot up.Overall I am very happy with this product, the only thing that works better is round up but that can't be used on or near lawn and other plants as it kills everything near it. I actually learned that the hard way as I used to spray roundup on Canada Thistle that gre in my flower bed and even though I was very careful I must have gotten some on my two bushes as they both died within weeks.

I purchased a VacuMaid GV50BLKPRO. This was one of the tools that came with it. Unfortunately two things work against this brush the first is that unlike most dust brushes that are available which are circular in shape (hole is round with brushes around it) this one is oval and has a maximum width (front to back) of about 5/8" across.So what end up happening when you use the tool is the bristles get sucked together and cause it to pretty much block itself..I ended up ordering Amazon  B00RY4F89S, They are 2 for $10 and even though they are cheaper made (thinner plastic) than the Cen Tec ones they work much better.So while it's well made, it's very poorly designed you can't have an oval shape with such a small opening and not expect the bristles to get sucked into the device itself.

We bought our unit almost 10 years ago. This is easily the best kitchen purchase we have ever made. We make everything from pizzas to fish sticks on this thing!Want to make a perfect pizza? super easy, set on "bottom" and cook for about 20 minutes then set to top & bottom and cook for another twenty minutes and tada (use a knife to lift edge of pizza when it's done to your liking it's ready), Makes absolutely perfect pizzas! You may have to play with the time a bit based on how thick your pizzas are (unaltered pizzas take less, if you dish on extra topping it will take longer).We get basic pizzas at Costco or Sam's Club and we dress them up with mushrooms, cut up breakfast sausage, pineapple, barbecue sauce  etc.. depending on what the kids are in the mood for.Looking for fries or onion rings? easy to do on this as well just use the "both" setting for even cooking.My Favorite pizza1. cheap cheese or cheese and pepperoni from Costco.2. spread out a very thin layer of Sweet Baby Ray's BBQ sauce (available anywhere, Walmart, costco, Menards).3. Open a can of sliced chunk pineapple, slice the chunks in half and spread evenly.4. add meat of your choice, cooked bacon or breakfast sausage works great but we have even used cut up chicken nuggets or small cut up pieces of deli honey sweet ham.5. add mushrooms or greens if desired6. top it all off with a thin layer of shredded mozzarella cheese!7. cook about 20min bottom 20min on both and enjoy!Like I said fish sticks work great on this I use a thin layer of cooking spray on the platter to ensure nothing stocks. Same with french fries or onion rings.So what makes this thing work? It's pretty much an industrial hair dryer with a turntable. As the platter spins the hot air is blown onto the pizza. You can select three modes top, both or bottom. Depending on which you pick determines is which element(s) turn on.If I were to have one complaint? I wish the unit was just a few inches larger, while I've never found a frozen pizza that did not fit It does not fit the ready made pizzas at Sam's Club or Costco.Overall we love our unit it has worked flawlessly for over 10 years and if it ever died we would replace it within one heartbeat.5.

I received a free sample for reviewing purposes.So I have to say I do not dive. So I honestly can not speak to how this is for that purpose. I did however test this in a pool for 30 minutes and then disassembled it to see how it faired and it does seem to be waterproof.Construction of the flashlight is first class, solid aluminum body with 3 protective O-rings.  The light features a glass (not plastic) lens and a single LED. I was actually very impressed with this light. My wife bought me a Duracell LED flashlight for Christmas that also claims to be 1000 lumens. When you shine the two side by side however it's night and day. The Securtying flashlight vastly outshines the Duracell. While the Duracell has multiple modes ie: high, med and flash, this unit main feature is a simple ridiculously bright beam. While I really like the Duracell that my wife bought me I do have a huge gripe about it. When you use it the unit kicks out of high mode and into medium from time to time. It then switches back and fourth during prolonged use. The Securitying flashlight luckily does not do that, you simply twist it on and it works.Dimensions9" long1 7/8" wide12" long strap with 7" padded collarFeatures1. single powerful LED that does not overheat2. solid aluminum construction with real glass lens3. 3 O Ring seal4. handy adjustable strap5. operates on 3 C sized batteriesNegativesDoesn't float? I don't really know if that is a negativeIncluded In-Package1. Very nice heavy gift box2. flashlight3. extra set of O-RingsOverall. If you are looking for a ridiculously great all purpose flashlight, this is it! Very well made comfortable to hold and even comes with extra O-rings. Outperformed my Duracell flashlight that is identically rated and uses the same size and number of batteries.

This is a well priced, good quality item.I received a free sample of this to try out. While the tree motif is not my personal style the item is very well made.Measurements 70" wide by 72" tall.FeaturesThe curtain features a double folded top area that holds 12 steel grommets that are large enough to accept any sized hangers. The unit does come supplied with plastic round shower hooks, although I would recommend picking up a set that has the metal bearingas as they are much easier to move back and fourth.MaterialIt almost feels like a man-made silk very smooth which allows water to run off it easily. All edges on the curtain are folded over material that is stitched on for a very nice overall appearance.ColorThe fabric is pure white with the tree printed on in a solid black (no grey-scale)Accessoriesas stated earlier it comes with plastic hooksOverallBuild quality seems very good, price is excellent, if you have decor that would be complimented by the tree motif then this would make an excellent addition to your home.

I originally had a Cab Cool dual 80mm fan setup in my media cabinet. But I upgraded to a Denon Avr4520ci receiver a few years ago and to my shock and disappointment Denon stopped putting AC outlets on the back of their receivers! Back when I had my Denon Avr 4310ci it came with a switched outlet which was nice because I just plugged the fans power supply in and every time the amp turned on the fans turned on.The fans on this AC Infinity unit are much larger at 120mm vs 80mm however being low powered USB fans they don't spin anywhere near as fast and therefore do not move anywhere near as much air as the Cab Cool products did. Unfortunately I never bothered to keep the Cab Cool's thermal sensor (did not think I needed it) whcih is why this upgrade was unfortunately necessary.Product wise the components are pretty simple and straight forward (pretty much off the shelf). The fan unit has a brushed black aluminum plate, 2 USB fans and 2 metal perforated grills. I personally think the appearance would be much nicer if they used grills with tiny holes versus the larger holes that allow you to see the fans but that is just my personal preference.I like the fact that these come with two plastic templates so that you know what size hole to cut out. I do wish the templates were not clear plastic as I made the mistake of putting the small one on the floor and it took me several minutes to find it as it basically is pretty much invisible when placed on flooring material.InstallationOverall installation was quick and easy. My only complaint would be that they fail to provide black wood screws for the installation. My set did not come with any screws to install the controller and the fan unit came with only black screws that were not wood screws but had an accompanying nut that needed to be attached from the back (kinda a pain in the butt). Simple 1/2" black wood screws would have made it much easier to put in.PerformanceI did not notice any vibrations or loud noise from the kit. The fans run smooth and in fact my disappointment is that even when in high it is not really a high but more of a low as far as compared to typical computer fans. I really wish the high setting would have moved much more air and that they reserved the lower two settings for those who did not want to hear any noise. Since my media cabinet is in another room I don't care if the fans are loud as long as they are keeping the equipment cool.SettingsI placed my thermal sensor directly on top of my receiver. I set it to turn on high at 85 degrees. What this means is that pretty much 4-5 minutes after the receiver powers up the fans kick on, it also means the fans run about 10-15 minutes after the unit is turned off which seems to work out pretty well for me.Upgrade.I just placed an order for the AC Infinity AI-CFD120BA which is the two 120mm fan add on kit. I plan to take it apart and reverse the two fans so that instead of blowing air out they suck air into the cabinet. I hope this will aid in the cooling of my cabinet. I do have more equipment than most people because the cabinet holds the Denon receiver which is setup for 4 different zones which are powered by 2 Sonance multi channel amps and two Sonance sub-amps which power in-wall subwoofers.I will update the review with how that works out. OverallI am happy with this purchase, It was inexpensive (relatively) and works pretty decently. My complaints overall would be the lack of power. I am hoping that by adding the intake fans onto the cabinet it will solve some of the heat issue. I really do like the convenience of the control panel however, finding a spot to mount it may be difficult for some. It's deep, measuring in at almost an inch and a half thick and that is not even taking into consideration the USB plugs that need to be connected into the back of it.I am giving it 3 stars, basically 1 star off for low speed fans (being under-powered) and 1 star off for not providing screws for the controller. If I were to rate it on just performance alone I would have to say it does it's job but doesn't exceed at it, so 3 stars there as well (The cab cool product also cost $60 and even with smaller fans moved 2-3 times more air).I hope you found this review helpful. If you have a question regarding this product please feel free to post it in the comments section and I will respond within 24 hours.

I love super cool toys. This definitely qualifies as a super cool toy! I received a free sample so that I could play with it and review it.Lets start with the basics.The main device. Acts as a cell phone charger, can charge multiple devices at the same time. Can jump start your car, lawn mower, ATV etc...It has a built in LED flashlight and both 12v and USB connections. Its dimensions are 6 1/4" wide 3" tall and 1 1/8" deep. It's fully rechargeable and even includes its own charger.The accessories1. set of jumper cables1. USB pigtail that features USB plugs for today's most popular devices (4) For Samsung, Apple and mini& Micro USB connectors.1. charger1. car cigarette lighter charger1. 9" long make to male pigtail1. set of 12v power plugs (8 total)1. large vinyl pouch that holds everythingSo what's so cool?  The battery pack can charge any USB powered device, phone, tablet, GPS, pretty much anything. But let's say your device doesn't have a USB connection? No problem! Plug in the 9" pigtail find the connector that fits your device and tada! your in business! I also think it's cool that those connectors will work on the included cigarette lighter, the options to power your stuff are almost limitless!I tested this product by charging a Samsung 10.1" pro tablet, no problem took it from 0 to 100% in about 4 hours and still had 2/3rds power left. I then hooked it up to a snowblower (only thing I have that is battery started) and even with the blowers 12v battery completely dead it  turned it over and started it.I hate giving products 5 stars. But this is a really neat device 12k mah chargers run about $30-$40. so paying a bit more for one that can do so much doesn't seem like a bad investment. There a few "unknowns" for instance, How long will the battery last if left in a glove-box?  Will it start a car in the dead of winter? A combination of those two questions. These can only be answered after long term use and testing. I did think it was impressive that it jump started the snow blower which has had a dead battery for over a year (I used the pull starter this last winter, was too cheap to buy a new $60 battery for it).Very cool device and I will put it through more paces this summer as we begin our trips around the country.  If you have a question regarding this unit please post it and I generally respond within 24 hours.

I received a free sample of this product. I don't understand why folks are complaining about it. It is big. Measuring (closed) at 4 7/8 inches wide by 4 inches tall and about 1/2" thick. Now compared to my Carhartt wallet that measures 4" wide and 3 1/2" tall it's definitely big but if you carry a lot of junk than you need something that is going to hold it all!So what's cool about it?1. 2 Clear pockets to hold ID's. That's just sweet I work for the government so the ability to keep my work identification and my DL readily available is priceless. I actually keep the work ID in the top pocket upside down that way I can keep that flap flipped up showing the ID without showing everything else in the wallet.2. 6 yes SIX pockets to hold credit cards etc.3. 2 huge areas to keep money.The not so cool.1. It's stamped genuine leather. I think the only thing that is real leather is the piece that is stamped that. But in all fairness it's hard to tell, it smells like leather but honestly who the heck knows? My guess, for under $10 it's "imported leather".2. So my biggest pet peeve about this product is that it does not lay flat on a table. The way the leather/ plastic/ vinyl, (whatever it is) is cut it ends up with this huge 1/2" lump that does not allow it to lay flat.3. has some funky slots cut into the interior with the initials P, D & B, what's with that? at forst I thought they were to hold emergency keys but that's not it.So what's the deal?I've been using a wallet now for almost 30 years. I tend to be hard on them and usually get a new one every year or so. The last wallet I bought was a Carhartt two tone which at the time cost me $35. Here we are a year later and it looks pretty beat up. This thing costs less than $10!It's well made, yes it's fake leather. If you really have your heart set on real leather, stop looking at $10 wallets! For the money it's hard to beat this.

I love black mulch, I think it makes the landscape pop as the color from your plants just gets framed beautifully, you just end up with such wonderful contrast when you start with black and add shades of green and bright hues from flowers to it.The downside is it has taken me years and i mean years to find a good quality black mulch (local landscape company makes it near me). They use a ton of dye in it and it holds it's color for a good time. Unfortunately as you know nothing stays beautiful forever. Sooner or later that gorgeous black turns grey and eventually the brown wood underneath start to poke though.I have actually used this colorant before. Several years ago I bought some brown and it worked really well. So knowing that the brown was a great product I went ahead and ordered black to cover up my graying mulch.Overall works fantastic, it takes a few minutes to do but the results? just like fresh mulch. I do recommend fluffing the mulch as it tends to get a hard layer on the top that way when you spray it looks nice and loose and fresh. I use a cheap sprayer that I bought here on amazon for under $15. I will point out that you should NEVER put your sprayer away without cleaning it out first. otherwise your going to be throwing your sprayer out.Cleanup is easy just warm water.As I get older I find myself not wanting to shovel mulch every year. So with this I can do it every other year and enjoy my spring just a bit more.

You know how it is the older you get the easier crap gets lost. My wife kept buying m,e nail clippers and I have no idea what the heck happens to them. I recently received a free sample of this so that I could test it.This is a two piece rechargeable light system. The light itself is very robustly made aluminum light that features 7 high power LED's. The light measures 2 5/8" round and is about 2 1/4" deep (front to back). The light has a 30" power cord that goes to the accompanying battery pack.The battery pack is a 6 cell battery that comes with a very nice nylon case. The case has a Velcro strap that allows you to secure it to a bicycle or other device. ( I actually strapped it to my belt  and used the light as a flashlight. Battery pack dimensions are 3" x 3" x 1 1/2". The battery also has a pigtail on it that is 24" long so overall when you connect the battery and the light the wire between the two is  54" so finding a spot to mount it on your bike should be quite easy.So the light on this is RIDICULOUS! I have a Duracell Ultra LED flashlight. I thought that was super bright but it is nowhere near as bright as this light is. When I shine the two side by side this one is at minimum 3x brighter plus I really like the color of light that this produces a pure very high (probably 5000K) light temperature which pierces through blackness and illuminates anything in your path.So there are a lot of positives and unfortunately some negatives.The big wins.1. super bright, to the point where it is blinding.2. adjustable. Has 3 settings high, medium and emergency flasher3. fully rechargeable (even comes with the charger!)4. I was very impressed by the construction, It feels like a nice high end Maglight or similar high end flashlight.5. Power button has an LED indicator green for charged. very nice.Unfortunately the negatives1. I received a sealed box but there was no manual2. I did not get any mounting rings to attach to a bike.I emailed the company to see about the mounting hardware will upgrade the review when I hear back from them.When I get the mounting rings I will try it out on a couple of bikes and update the review.The last thing I want to point out is that my Duracell flashlight kicks in and out of high mode when the led gets warm. This did not do that I set it to bright and it stayed bright as long as I had the unit on.Thank for reading if you have a question or comment please post it in my comments and I usually respond within 24 hours.

This product is made from 100% real Bamboo. Even though I read through the negative reviews from people who have no idea what they are talking about I decided to buy one.Bamboo grows as a hollow round tube. It is sliced into slats that are approximately 1/8" wide and can be as long as the Bamboo stalk is (generally about 12").Once you have a stack of these slats they are then glued together to make boards, planks or in this case a block. Bamboo can be glued together either vertically or horizontally each of these two techniques will give the end product a completely different look. (Vertical grained glue ups have very little grain and present a very linear appearance, meanwhile Horizontal glue ups show much more grain and that little Bamboo detail (little ziggly lines) that we all recognize as bamboo).This particular product is made by gluing the Bamboo vertically. You can clearly see this in the product as it appears to be made up of tiny strips. Some people are mistakenly stating that the product is made from veneer. This is false as veneer is paper thin sheets of wood. Hardwood trees can be cut into boards or planks as they are solid inside. The cutting mill simply decides what cuts are the most efficient (get the most linear feet out of that particular tree) and then a trunk is milled or re-sawed to make the boards. This of course can n ot be done with Bamboo as it is once again hollow in the middle.So let's look at the actual product.Size9" at the tallest point10" long (across the bottom)4 7/8" wideSlots3.5" at the top of unit2x 2" wide on left2x 1 1/2" on the right1 1/2" on left1 1/4" on the right2x 1" towards the bottom1 1/4" by  1/2" slot for scissors8x steak knife slots are approx. 7/8" wideAll slots go all the way through the block and are open at the bottom.WorkmanshipVery good overall, I did notice that a few slots have some rough spots where the slot was machined but they did not take the time to sand it down properly. Not a big deal does not effect its ability to hold knives.OverallI am giving the product 5 stars. The main reason is value. A solid wood block that is well built and costs under $20!Yes better blocks are available but cost much more. As a side note to those people who complain that their knives don't fit, that's not the blocks fault, it's theirs for not measuring before buying. This for me was a very good purchase at a ridiculously great deal. (Under $20 with Prime shipping).

**I received a free sample in exchange for an honest reviewI have now tested something like 5-6 different blutooth enabled headsets.This is the second pair of in ear headsets (see my other reviews) and there are a few differences between the two.Pros1. easy setup, same as others, hold the power button down until it says "pairing".2. Much more comfortable, I can actually wear these without my ears hurting3. Much better sound quality including slightly better bass response. *1Cons1. Slightly smaller wire connecting the two headsets may not fit people with large heads.2. poor button placement3. buttons are ridiculously smallLet's look at the basicsSound QualitySound was very good when compared to other headsets in the category. The sound was clear and crisp with some bass. Basss response was much better on a set of blutooth headphones that are "over ear" but that is to be expected as the larger the driver the more air you move and hence more depth can be reproduced.RangePoor, as a test I was doing some landscaping while listening to music. I placed my Samsung phone on a shelf and started working. At no time did I ever move more than twenty feet from my phone and the connection was intermittent. The headset worked perfectly fine when the phone was physically on me or directly next to me but take a few steps back to where you are six feet away and the connection was intermittent.ComfortVery good, I have never been a fan of in ear headsets. For me they always seem to end up hurting after a few minutes. Not sure what is different on this particular set but they did not produce the discomfort that I normally experience. I will note that the wire holding the two ear pieces together seemed a bit shorter than others I have tested. This may mean that if you have a huge melon that you may find them too small to put on (I was just at the point where they barely fit).ControlsI found them to be too small and not easy to manipulate. They should have been spaced further apart and perhaps seperated so that they were on opposite sides.OverallI'm kinda torn on these. On one hand the sound was very good but the range just flat out stunk. The main reason I am going to give these 4 stars is because they did not hurt as most in ear's do and they do what they are supposed to. If you are working out or jogging and have your phone on your body they have no connection issues and produce a very good quality sound.If you have a question regarding this item, post a comment I usually respond within 24 hours.

+++++++++++++++++++++++++  I received a free sample of this in exchange for an honest review +++++++++++++++Over the years I have tried a ton of different dashboard and windshield mounts for everything from radar detectors, GPS devices, PDA's and of course for phones. This has a neat twist in that it comes with two metal plates (One round one rectangular) that help affix your item onto the magnetic stand.The stand is essentially the same as others currently on the market. A simple goose-neck mount with a suction cup at the bottom. It does differentiate in that their suction cup comes equipped with an adhesive and the other end has a round rubber coated circle that has a magnet inside to hold your device.As I said earlier the company provides you with two plates. The rectangular one goes inside your battery compartment or under your protective case if you have one. The smaller round disc has an adhesive tape mounted to it which you can secure directly to your item.I have two complaints about this item. And they are more nit-picks than anything else.#1 Why doesn't the rectangular plate come with the double sided adhesive as well?#2 Why only 1 round disc? What if I have more than one device or more than one driver in the household, Or what if you get a new phone? This is one of those cases where it would make sense to charge a dollar or two more for the unit but include 3 of the mounting discs.But as I said that's just me nit-picking. Otherwise this is a very cool device, I am using mine to hold my Passport radar detector.

***************I received a 2pk in exchange for an honest review***********************I really love the look of these mugs they have that antique look to them which is timeless. The mugs are actually made from stainless steel and coated with a copper coating. Quality wise they are a 5 star product but I have to say that they did miss the whole concept behind a "copper" mug.The reason to use copper is that it conducts both heat and cold extremely well. In fact if you look around for cookware the best cookware is multi-layered and the very best cookware has solid copper cladding on the bottom. The reason for that is because some materials are terrible at thermal conductivity. What materials suck at conducting heat? well, stainless steel for one. Which once again is why when you see a stainless steel cookware set it is always "Multi-clad".So what we have here is a super great looking set that is very durable and sells at a great price BUT has none of the benefits of a true copper mug.Want to read more about copper mugs? I found this site when researching for this review. http://gomoscowmule.com/solid-copper-mugs/Overall I really like the set I am giving it 4 stars because they do look great and they hold up well even when run through the dishwasher. However if you are looking to make an authentic Moscow Mule then these are not for you.

Comes with a heavy duty pair of black gloves, a 2 ounce injector and a pair of meat claws.Here is a quick look at each item.The gloves.
