I already had a nice set of rubber gloves but these are nice because they are much more flexible than the ones I already owned. Heat dispersion wise they are very effective and I was able to pick up items both from our grill as well as from a toaster oven with no problem what soever.The injector, after I amused myself by torturing all three children by telling them it was time for their annual shots I played with it for awhile. It is surprisingly well made with a shiny chrome finish. It comes complete with two needles one that releases the juice from the sides and one that shoots it out the front.The claws. I'm on the shelf on this. I used them to hold some chicken while I cut it into strips on the grill and they work quite well. However they are molded plastic and I am not sure how well they would handle prolonged exposure to heat. Overall they are pretty cool and for plastic surprisingly sharp.Overall a really nice set all packed in a gift style box.

I spent a lot of money on a VacuMaid GV50BPRO Professional Wall Mounted Utility and Garage Vacuum with 50 ft Hose and Tools and even though it said it came with "premium" tools I was not happy with the dust brush. It was oval shaped and would collapse under the vacs suction.This is nice and has a large round hole for dust to easily flow through to your vac hose.It fit my shop vac with no problem. Because everyone in the house has allergies lately I have been using the garage vac to get dust and pet hair in the house. With its 50 foot hose I can get everywhere except in the master bedroom and since it's out in the garage there is no worry about getting dust recirculated in the air.I bought the two pack of these and they fit the shop vac as well as our Electrolux canister vac and a Panasonic vac we use in the basement.Overall 2 for under $10 was a good price and I am very happy with the purchase.

********************I received a free sample for reviewing purposes*******************I gave this to my wife for her Samsung 12" tablet. It's perfect for protecting the tablet when she travels, she throws it into her bag or laptop backpack and does not worry about any damage.It's made from a soft material is slightly padded and has a zipper for easy use.Overall a very nice product, personally I don't care for the pattern printed on it but she likes it so no complaints here.

******************I received a free sample of this in exchange for an honest review*********************************My wife likes this bag very much. It features two outer pockets for cell phones, keys etc.. and a large roomy space inside suitable for a tablet. We have Samsung 10.1" tablets and they will fit inside this as long as they do not have a protective case on them.The flap has two snaps to keep it from flapping around and there is even a zipper on the inside to keep stuff from falling out.Overall quality is high, made from a very realistic fake leather the stitching is extremely well done and quality wise neither of us could find any negatives.I guess if we were to have one complaint it would be size, wish it were just slightly larger (longer) to fit the ever popular 10" tablets from many of the top electronics companies. (A 10" tablet will fit as long as it is not in a case or sleeve)If you have a question about this product post a comment and I generally respond within 24 hours.

******************************I received a free sample in exchange for an honest review*******************This is a very nice 4pc set. Consists of two wisks a brush and a spatula. All have a stainless steel handle with an integrated hook for hanging.The great advantage to these is of course that they will not scratch your cookware, they handle heat very well and they do not transfer that heat to the handle.This set includes my favorite brush so far, the bristles are nice soft and very pliable easily spreading sauce evenly. The spatula is rigid enough to move food around in the pan yet will not scratch coated cooking surfaces. And the two wisks are sturdy and also have coated non scratch material covering the wire.The set comes in a mesh gift bag and overall is high quality. in fact the only gripe I can come up with is that I wish the tools were just a bit longer. Besides that it is a very nice set.I am giving this set 4 stars. Quality wise it is a 5 star product my only issue is I do wish the tools were a couple inches longer.

We have a small bath that the kids use. They seem to always take too long a shower and even with an exhaust fan they seem to always leave the room steamy.This is a very small inexpensive dehumidifier and if you are in the same situation it works well. I do have to reinforce that it is very small unit which is barely larger than an electric can opener so don't think you are going to put this in a basement and have it dehumidify a 1000 square foot space.I set mine up with a Belkin conserve timer set to 1 hour. The kids just push a button when they take a bath and it turns off on its own. I really like that the unit features a removable washable filter and the fact that it is either on or off means it works great with a timer.I am giving it 4 stars the main detraction is its size it is designed to be small.As long as you use it properly it works well but I can see from other reviewers that their expectations are a bit unrealistic.===========================I received this as a free sample from the manufacturer=====================================

This is a 4pc set consisting of a pair of gloves and two pot holders. The material is a very flexible rubber which does a great job at isolating heat and protecting you while in the kitchen.The gloves are large and will fit most people. They feature a heavy criss-cross raised pattern which is great for holding onto cookie sheets or cake pans.The two pot holders are a great size and fall just a bit shy of 7 inches square (about as long as an average persons hand from the wrist to the ti of your finger) They are nice and thin, flexible and have a cool raised dot pattern that looks nice  and also allows you to use these to rest pots on since the pot of pan floats above the surface of your counter.Overall I found this to be a very nice set. Definitely something I would buy or give as a gift.+++++++++++++++++++I received a free sample of this product in exchange for a fair review ++++++++++++++++++++++If you have a question regarding this item post it in my comments and I generally will responde within 24 hours.

We are a large family of six. Wife and I both work and we usually only go to get groceries every 3-4 weeks.We needed a way to keep meats fresh a bit longer and also make them easily accessible so that the kids can help themselves without making a mess. Because we usually buy 2-3 lbs of Ham, roast beef or Turkey (we get them in 1 lb packages) and then freeze everything except 1 lb at a time. The problem is when you thaw you get some runoff juice from the meats and since the plastic deli bags that you buy the meat in leak you end up with a sticky mess in the refrigerator.We bought 4 (2 2-packs) 3 for meats and 1 for cheese. They fit very nicely inside our fridge's drawer and keep the meat fresh. I really like that there is a plastic riser tray included so when there is some liquid that drips it can easily be drained in the sink.Overall I'm very happy with this purchase. It cures my obsession for kitchen organization and keeps the meat fresh for when I get a sandwich craving!

+++++++++++++++ I received a free sample of these for reviewing purposes++++++++++++++++++I have now had an opportunity to test several blutooth enabled headsets. My previous set was from Memorex and while they had some great features they had extensive charging problems.I have now been using this pair for over a month and I am very pleased with the performance of them. For years I have had issues with the normal "in ear" headphones that come with MP3 media players. They just never seem to fit right and frankly they just seem to always hurt after an extended period of use. The alternative was never that great a huge pair of on ear headsets with a long bulky wire. These fit that niche in between they are on ear headphones that do not completely cover your ear and therefore are not as large and cumbersome as larger sets tend to be. The great thing about larger headphones is of course a larger driver and its niceties include a much better and lower bass response. These headphones clearly did not disappoint when playing back music. The sound was very good with great bass and good highs.I was a bit disappointed with the delay effect produced by the Blutooth signal when playing back movies or watching video. You can see the actors lips move or something like an explosion happen and then hear the resulting sound a second later. Some people might find this distracting it did not bother me too much.Where the delay did bother me was during video game play. I love to play racing games and crashing into something and not hearing the sound for a second was a bit off putting.I am taking one star off for the delay issue even though I do not believe that it is the headsets fault ( I think it's just a side effect of blutooth).Overall I really liked this product of the now 3-4 headsets I have tested this is the best sounding and has the best battery life so far.

************************I received a free sample in exchange for an unbiased review***********************I have had this going for 4- going on 5 days. Unfortunately it's impossible to tell if it is working or not.A few other reviewers have stated that they are annoyed by the clicking sound and that's kinda ridiculous as it is no more annoying than having a wall clock in the same room. The unit clicks once about every six seconds and the only reason I can hear it is because I am within 4 feet of where it's plugged in.Does it bother the dog? I have a Great Pyrenees and she does not seem to mind it, if she attacks me in the next few days I'll unplug it and update my comments here.So what's the deal? I honestly don't know on this one.. I am trying to be fair by giving it 3 stars for "Meets Expectations" but in all honesty I can't say if it's doing anything or not.Well, That's not totally true is it? We know it's wasting electricity, whether or not it's doing anything else remains to be seen.I will update this review periodically.April 23.2015moved product down to 2 stars. #1 I found out it messes with my remote control lighting in my office. Seems to mess with both Insteon and the older x10 signal from remotes. I even tried plugging in a wireless receiver in the same room to boast the signal but no go.Secondly does nothing for ants.. Which is really the only bug issue I get this time of the year.

This is the third set of blutooth wireless headphones that I have had the opportunity to test. The other two were much larger versions the last pair was a quite large set of "over the ear" type.********************I received a free sample of this in exchange for an unbiased review************************The headphones consist of two triangular shaped plastic pods connected with a thick 1/8" rubber coated wire. Each pod has buttons so that you can control power, volume etc.. These are considered in ear models and personally I have never found in ear headphones to be wearable for long periods of time (they hurt after a while).I connected these to a Samsung Note Pro 10" tablet for my review and tested them with 3 seperate sources.First with a game, I played Beach Buggy Blitz which is one of my favorites although I can't seem to get past 48% on it. Sound quality was ok I immediately noted there was a slight delay between what I saw happening on the screen and what I was hearing. As an example I would crash into an object and the sound from the impact took a second to be heard. I will say that this is much less a problem with these headphones than with the previous two I tested. The delay here was under a second and was nowhere near as bad as with the last set.One of the disappointments that I saw with the video game was the bass quality. When the engine revved it sounded tinny and had no bass what so ever. I found that as with many in ear headphones bass response dramatically depended on the placement of each pod inside the ear. In other words if I pushed the rubber earpiece inward it increased the bass but also the discomfort.Secondly I tested several music files. Sound quality was acceptable but nowhere near the performance of the on ear large blutooth models. It really comes down to you will sacrifice some sound quality for the ability to jog, walk etc. and not have to deal with wires or large bulky headsets.Movies. I watched about 15 minutes of a movie on Netflix. While there was a perceivable delay between the actors lip movement on screen and the sound you heard it was very acceptable. Like I said of models I tested these has the least delay issues.Once again with the movie sound was acceptable but not phenomenal. I should point out however that I worked my way through college selling high end audio video and the need for ridiculous sound quality has stuck with me. My wife allows me to have a media room with 13 speakers but she is not a huge fan of watching movies with me and the kids.So how would I break these down?1. Sound quality 3 stars = tolerable if you need a pair of sturdy in ear headphones for sports activity.2. design 3 stars = small, lightweight but I do find them uncomfortable.3. extras 4 stars = they come in a very nice gift box, include extra rubber in ear pieces and a pair of rubber protective sleeves. (I did not understand the purpose of the sleeves, They cover up the outer edges of the headphones also covering the buttons and they fall off REALLY easily so just something stupid that is going to get lost in 3 days.As I said earlier it all comes down to if you have had good experiences with in ear type headphones before and if you have a need for a sporty headset that will stay in place as you are moving about.What is included1. Gift Box2. Headset3. USB cable4. extra rubber things for in ear part5. silly rubber triangle protectors that won't stay on and cover up the buttons6. Manual with ridiculously small printed text.Pairing the headsetVery easy to do. On the right module there are 3 buttons a plus, a minus and a TINY multi-1function button located above the USB connector.Press and hold that button (while the unit is turned off) for 5 seconds you will hear the headphones say "power om" keep holding that button until they say "pairing".If you have a question regarding this product please post it in m,y comments and I will try to answer within 24 hours.

My Review started as a 2 stars. But I got a chance to speak with Mike from Lindsay and he walked me through what was most likely going on. He also took care of the two parts that were defective. I immediately noticed a difference when I removed the old hose and plugged in the new one. I knew I was losing suction where the hose was damaged but Mike also pointed out where to check for stuck items.I found my first stuck item where the hose plugs into the unit. The intake there is about 4" long and has a curve to it. Looks like I sucked up a long piece of wood and it was jammed there. I also seem to have something stuck in the old hose, that one will take me a bit to look at as he recommended using a garden hose to clear it out. For now I just cut the bad section of hose off so I have an extra 35' hoseI really appreciated Lindsay Manufacturing working to straighten things out. it really does make a world of difference. Dealing with an American company versus having to track down someone overseas is priceless to say the least.Original review*******************************************************************************************I bought my unit as I needed something to help keep the garage clean and at the same time do car duty and hit the mudroom which in our house always seems to be full of dirt the kids drag in.The unit arrived and I guess I was a bit let down by the way it was designed. While the unit itself works well it is not built like a normal vacuum cleaner. For example the unit is really not much more than a large metal drum with an inlet and some small holes above where the motor is to let the exhaust air exit the main drum. The bag which is quite large and made from a several ply cloth material is very large (and expensive at over $8 EACH!).So things I did not like about it.1. The lid just sits on the drum, gravity and suction hold it in place.2. The bag doesn't exactly lock in place or anything. There is a small groove cut into the cheap plastic inlet tube that is about 1/16" deep that the bag "rests" in.3. Cost of bags just seems ridiculous at OVER $8 each. They are supposedly 7 gallons but the leads me to the next issue4. The instructions state to ensure that you place the bag in the vac and then expand it to fill the area. However the bag seems to be longer than the space in the barrel so it's conceivable that you may not be able to fill the bag 100% or that the bag could pop off the mounting tube (that has no lock to hold the bag on in any way).5. The hose does not lock in place it's simply a pressure fit into the vac body.6. When you are dealing with 50 feet of hose. It is not convenient to run back and fourth to turn the unit on and off. I let it run continuously as I cleaned our SUV and the motor housing got pretty darn hot.So, I also experienced some quality control issues.1. My hose has a crack in it. I have not called them yet, I'm still debating on whether to keep or return it.2. The small brush attachment is mis-formed. It will go onto the tube but takes some manipulating.I don't know I guess I will give them a call in a few days to see what they want to do about the hose, if they say ship it back I'm just going to return it. For now I have duct tape wrapped around the damaged part and it's alright.Lastly I guess I am also disappointed in the suction power of the unit. I honestly do not believe that it is any better than the suction power on my Fein shop vac that was also $300 (15 years ago) or our Electrolux canister vac which did cost a bit more.The unit does have two huge wins.1. It's very quiet.2. It does not vibrate on the wall at all.Is it worth $320?HECK NO!Personally I would recommend a Fein but I see that the model that replaced mine now uses bags versus mine has a cloth filter and a hepa drum filter. In order to skip the bags it looks like you have to spend $500 with them now.Will update if I return or keep and what their customer service says.UPDATE June 2015Moved from 1 star to 3I contacted Mike from Lindsy Manufacturing. They are replacing the hose and the damaged tool. They were pretty quick to responde which I appreciate, when so many companies do not stand behind their product it's nice to find one that does. Will update again in a few weeks when the parts come in. I am hoping that a hose without a break will fix the low suction power

I received a free sample of this product in exchange for a fair product review.We have a Great Pyrenees, she is a wonderful dog, great with the kids, super friendly and for the most part low maintenance. Well, except for the hair. The hair, well it ends up everywhere! On the furniture, on the floor, under appliances and furniture just everywhere!Brushing is a way of life for us and I have tried many different brushes. What I like about this set is that the spikes are long and hold a fair amount of hair. I recently purchased a brush that had shorter sdpikes and found that it just did not get deep enough into her coat to dig out the loose hair that was underneath. The metal spikes on the brush are about 3/4" long, just perfect for our application.I also liked the Dematting tool. it's perfect for when the dog gets small tangles in her coat, with our dog that is usually in her tail where the fur gets all tangled together and becomes very difficult to comb. The Dematting tool allows you to get through that with little effort.I am giving this item 5 stars, I generally try to not do 5 star ratings but I really liked the quality of the tools. They feature a very nice thick (easy to hold) rubberized handle. The components all appear to be high quality and I liked the chrome trim ring around the tool handles.If you have questions about this product please feel free to leave a comment and I will responde within 24 hours.

I received this item for free in exchange for a review.I find it difficult to rate cables as wen I was younger and sold high end AV equipment, I would push high end cable brands such as Monster Cable, Esoteric Audio and other ridiculously priced inter-connects.As I get older I tend to think that a "cable is a cable" and that as long as the connectors are on nice and tight your going to get a good signal transfer.This particular cable is marketed as a Sony replacement, the truth however is that it is merely a micro USB cable that will work with pretty much anything out there. In fact I gave this to my wife to use next to her side of the bed to charge her Samsung S4 phone.As far as quality goes it seems to be a well made product the connectors are on nice and tight. The plastic sheathing on the cable is glossy and I would prefer a matte rubber finish but all in all that is just personal preference and nothing more.I have had other cables that were wrapped in cloth those look nicer but of course are more expensive here you are paying for the longer length in this case 10 feet which is great for when you need to be a bit farther away from your main unit or charger.I am giving the cable 5 stars as it performs as expected and appears to be a good value. I will post an update if something changes.As always if you have a question regarding this product please post it and I will usually respond within 24 hours.

I have young kids and they love to watch TV shows such as Octonauts and other Disney channel favorites. I had a simple goal, I wanted to let them watch Comcast TV, either in the family room or in the kitchen without having to turn my Denon receiver and all its sub components on.So I hook up my cable box to the input, the first output goes to my receiver which is normally where my cable box would be plugged into. The second output goes to a Toshiba 32" hanging in the kitchen and the third to my Sharp 52" in the family room.So video signal seems to work fine at all 3 outputs. However, Sound to the receiver (output 1) works fine, sound to the kitchen tv works about 50% of the time and sound to the family room well, 0 percent of the time unless I physically unplug the unit.So I guess I am just SOL, waste of time and money and I can't even do what I set out to do!

I needed a quick way to get more light in my unfinished basement. These allow me to put 3 CFL's or LED bulbs into a single socket, since each bulb is only consuming about 8 watts a fraction of a typical incandescent bulb it's totally safe and a cheap way to go.Very happy with both the price and build quality of this mount.I also bought some of the 4 way and they rock as well!

I got a deal on two of these $50 plus shipping so I could not pass it up.These can be installed directly into a cutout in your drywall but if you do you are pretty much asking for trouble. Sony offers the backbox for these but its ridiculously expensive and really needs to be installed before drywall is put up.My solution was to make a much smaller box that measures 1 cubic foot internally. I packed it with fiber-fill and installed it in a corner of my family room. Unfortunately if you don't have experience in doing drywall repairs I do not recommend fooling around with in wall speakers.Bass response is actually pretty good and paired to set of JBL in ceiling speakers they rock. The important thing to remember is that sound is created by moving air. These come with 8" drivers and if your main speakers have components larger than 8" these probably won't do much to boost your sound experience. But for me going from a pair of speakers that have 6" wooofers adding two subs makes all the difference in the world.Once again don't waste your time if you're not going to build or put it in a bockbox. you're just going to be disappointed and end up with two huge holes in your walls.

Illuminating a flag has always been a problem. You had limited choices, either you went low voltage and used a transformer and spotlight or you hired an electrician to run you a 110v light out near the pole. Either way the cost to do those two options would often place it out of reach for most folks.Now for under $40 you can get a simple solution that is automatic and requires no interaction on your part. The unit is 8.5" round 1.5" thick and features 20 white (5000k, bright white not yellow) LEDs.The unit comes with the rechargeable batteries included and takes approximately 8 hours of light to fully charge the three batteries.The unit has a light sensor located on the top of it which automatically turns the lights on and runs them until the battery is dead which seemed to be about 4-7 hours depending on how much direct sunlight the solar panels get throughout the day. (I tested it for 4 days, two of those days had minimal sunlight and were overcast).Overall the unit is well made and seems durable. However, I do question the long term durability of any of these products as the top is flat and will retain snow and rain. Secondly where the panels meet the plastic trim, the panels are slightly recessed allowing water to seep into the unit (tested), it then sits inside the unit and there are no drainage holes on the bottom to prevent excess water from building up within the case. Lastly I noticed that the battery compartments do not have any sort of weatherstripping which will eventually lead to battery corrosion.I am giving the product 4 stars. Mainly because it is a really cool device and it fills a very specific niche. However, I must say that I do not see this (or any of the similar products available here on Amazon) lasting more than two years before the wiring shorts out or rusts due to water getting into the unit.I received a free sample of this product from the manufacturer for the sole purpose of writing a review. If you have a question about this product please feel free to post a question, I generally will respond within 24 hours.I personally would recommend picking up a piece of plexiglass at the hardware store drilling a hole in the middle of it and mounting it on top of the unit to shield the light from direct rain. This should extend the life considerably.

I received two samples of the products. One with 2 glasses and 9 soap-stones and one with 4 glasses for review purposes.I had been wanting to purchase some of the stones for about a year now and this opportunity to test them out is definitely pretty cool.The product came in a nice gift box that measures 11 inches wide 5 inches deep and is 4 inches tall. Inside protected by foam inserts are the two double wall glasses a small felt pouch to hold your soap-stones and the 9 rocks wrapped in plastic.The two glasses hold a little over 1 cup with 3-4 stones in them and almost a cup and a half without the stones.The stones themselves measure 3/4" square and I was a bit surprised to see that they had a rough texture to them, (I expected or imagined they would be perfectly smooth).As for testing I am not a liquor person so I basically stuck the glasses in the freezer splitting the stones between the two and used them for beer. Overall it was a positive experience the kids were fascinated by the stones and desperately wanted them their drinks so the next day it was their turn and they loved them.As a side note, the stones are not 100% non porous. When I placed them in the kids grape juice they did pick up a hint of purple, It did however wash away (mostly) after a couple of rinses.Overall the quality of the set is outstanding, the glasses are very cool, the stones are nice the gift box was surprisingly sturdy. I would not hesitate to give this to someone as a gift.If you have a question regarding this set, please feel free to post a comment. I will usually answer questions within 24 hours.

I needed some extra light in the basement I used 4 of these with 4 Philips 60 watt LED bulbs in each. Makes a world of difference now I can see when I'm down there.Being that the LED bulbs that I am using only consume 10 watts each I don't have any concerns about using 4 of hem in one of these fixtures.This worked out so well in the basement that I am going to use two in the garage.

0:20 Mins About a year ago I was part of a marketing campaign for this company. I got to test out several samples of their products and I was very impressed by their quality and affordability.Being an old fart of course you need a woman's perspective to appreciate whether the jewelry will appeal to them and last. For that I sought out my nieces. With several High School girls having the opportunity to wear and give feedback I was very comfortable giving those products high marks. (they raved about them for a very long time!)This year the opportunity came around again and the girls were all more than willing to help out. We are going to look at 5 separate items and I will try to describe each in detail.This review is for the 18k Gold Plated Cubic Zirconia Crown Solitaire Stud Earrings (3.50 carats).First the picture of these shows a light blue. The true color is a much prettier deep blue which is almost a deep purple. The earrings are just shy of 1/2" round with that blue stone measuring a whopping 1/4" in diameter. Each earring is covered in white gold which in turn is encrusted with many tiny white stones. All in all a very stunning piece of jewelry. As stated earlier I know that this companies products hold up well. The pieces that the girls got last year are still worn and look great.The girls absolutely loved this style and at only $19.99 they seem like a very reasonable priced set for such high quality items. Please take a moment to look at the short 30 second video, hopefully you will find them as appealing as my Nieces do.About me.I am very selective about the products I review. I generally try to stay away from most marketing campaigns as I don't like reviewing low quality products. I encourage you to read some of my other reviews and see that I don't rubber stamp products with 4 or 5 star ratings unless I honestly feel they deserve it.You are welcome to post a comment if you have a question. I generally will answer questions within 24 hours.I will upload several images (or a video) of each earring, hopefully you can get a better idea of what the product is about.

I bought these to hide a wire behind my gutters. Unfortunately bending them around the gutter causes them to break. I just could not believe it! I have actually had them snap in my fingers while tightening them! The plastic is just so brittle that bending it anywhere where it is scored just breaks the tie.These stink, I wish i could use stronger language to describe how bad they stink!

So I saw the negative reviews about this breaking and I figured "hey, I take care of my stuff, I won't break it" well guess what? Second day, I placed my tablet on it and snap, heard a pop and the tablet fell flat to the table!So this might work best for holding your phone. It is only about 3.5 inches square and it appears to be well made as it's very heavy. Unfortunately the locking mechanism that holds this upright must be made from a cheap plastic because it just doesn't hold up.

I bought my wife a Samsung 12.2 note pro for xmas. She went to Ohio to visit her parents, took the charger but forgot the cable at home. With Prime shipping I was able to order this and have it shipped directly to her folks home. This is a pretty good deal for two cables. The cables have gold plated connectors and the ends seam to be nice and sturdy so neither one of us has anything bad to say about these.5 stars2 cables for under $10gold connectors, what more can you ask for?

My 70 year old mother needed a phone, even though she has been retired for 10 years I worry about her when she is out and about without some way to contact my wife and I should something go wrong.I have tried giving her a smartphone twice now. Unfortunately she is stubborn and has flat out refused them. This is a great little phone it is only 4 1/2" long 2" wide and a little over a half inch thick.The main thing I was looking for was something that had an easy to read screen and nice big buttons both of which this has. I was able to just get a sim card from my local T-mobile store and had this going within a minute.Overall she is happy with it, I feel better knowing she can call if something goes wrong and since she doesn't need data it is only costing me $10 a month, like the commercial says "priceless!"

My 3 boys are Nerf Nuts! I often got caught in the crossfire. I feel that the manual guns are a bit too clunky so I bought one of these. Since then we have ordered 3 more.There is a lot to like about this gun, for me the main thing is ease of use. The gun is very lightweight, even when compared to some smaller manual nerf products the gun seems lighter. My youngest is 4 years old and what is great about this is that I can load up a clip for him and he can handle it because the trigger is easy enough for him to pull and the gun is light enough for him to handle. (Some guns such as the Nerf Demolisher have a trigger that is difficult to depress, not to mention they are much heavier)There are a lot of folks who write reviews on these toys who complain about jams. let's be clear this is a toy, meant for kids not a precision made weapon. The darts are made from foam and soft rubber and wear out relatively quickly. In my experience you end up buying more darts not necessarily because they get worn out but because the kids lose them in the yard or the dog eats them.My 13 yo has modified several of these, With the mod you can open the top hatch while holding the trigger, this simplifies unclogging jams. If your kid is 12+ modifications are surprisingly easy and videos are readily available by searching by the guns model name on youtube.What I most like about this gun is its ability to handle different sized clips such as the 10 or 18. I would honestly recommend getting this gun and 2, 18 capacity clips over spending let's say $40 on a more expensive gun. The clips and added ammo adds to the guns fun factor.Here are some tips to prevent some problems.1. Teach your child to aim and then fire versus just unloading the full clip. This eliminates 3 problems.First this increases game play time and makes battles more fun. Sure it's cool to blast off 18 darts in a few seconds but then the gameplay has to stop while you reload.  Secondly remember the darts are made from foam and rubber and sometimes firing too quickly is what causes the jam. And lastly, This gun works by shoving the dart into the path of two spinning wheels. If you fire too quickly those flywheels lose speed in between shots, all of which in turn means the darts don't fly as far and tend not to fly as "straight" as they normally would.  In short aim, shoot wait a second then repeat.2. Don't over-jam your clips. Even though we use 18 capacity clips we rarely place 18 of the darts into the clip. The second biggest cause of jams is darts getting crushed and not popping up into the firing mechanism correctly. By not overloading clips you eliminate some of the pressure that distorts and ages the darts.  (my kids immediately tried to overload the clips)3. Use high quality batteries. While we normally buy the cheap Kirkland brand (Costco) AA batteries, this does considerably better if you use a high performance battery. Energizer or Duracell work the best. In fact Nerf recommends Duracell batteries. If your kids are older then you may want to invest into the higher quality AA's designed for high demand products such as cameras. They are definitely more expensive but they shoot darts farther and harder.As a family we have about 12 Nerf guns, this model is my overall favorite. Relatively small. lightweight, you don't have to cock it or anything, just load up a clip, pop it in there and have some fun!Lastly, by someone who has been shot in the eye with one of these darts. IT HURTS!Pick up some cheap safety glasses and make sure your kid wears them when they are playing!I've got some links for you here and as always if you have a question, post it I usually respond within 24 hours!N-Strike Elite 18-Dart Quick Reload Clip  (get 2)Nerf N-Strike Elite Dart Refill Pack (75 Darts)Nerf Zombie Strike Dart Refill PackDuracell Ultra Power Aa Batteries 16 CountDuracell Procell AA 24 Pack PC1500BKD09

Our dog really loves these but she destroys them within minutes. I buy 2 packs of these per month. I usually just drop one on the floor for her and she is in heaven for about an hour. She will throw these up in the air and then run after it or she will bring it to me to throw.I sometimes come across the rubber innards of the balls and what worries me is you don't find the remnants of the outer shell or covering. makes me worry she is eating that part.Gave it two stars because they are great for playing fetch with. But once the dog starts to chew they go downhill very quickly.

I received 4 of the Wolf Grilling tools to review. You can easily tell which reviewer bought their tools and which ones got them for free based on if Amazon shows them as a Verified Purchaser or not. I wish everyone who received a free sample would state that in their review.This review covers all 4 of the tools I receivedSpatula RRP: $12.99:    http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KYL53ZCOverall 14.5” long including the ring for hangingHandle is 4 3/8” longspatula part is 3” wide by 3 1/2” long (not square (tapered) so it's actually smaller than that.Tongs RRP: $12.99:        http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KYLHF9EOverall 13 1/2” longHandle is 4 3/8” longThe end part (not sure what to call it) The grabby part? Is 1 3/4” square also taperedFork RRP: $12.99:          http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KYLDDD6Overall 14” long including the hoop for hangingHandle is 4 3/8” longFork itself is 1 1/4” wide by about 3 1/2” longGrill Brush RRP: $12.99:  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KYKUG8COverall 12” long not including the string for hangingHandle is 6” long  plastic not stainless like the other toolsBrush width is 6” wideI have a simple rating system3 stars = Meets expectations1 or 2 stars = Fails to meet4 or 5 stars = exceeds expectations or knocks my socks off.The goodSo we will start with the good the tools appear well made. They are of course stainless steel and they have nice rounded handles.The badI hate being the guy who doesn't rubber stamp these as a 5 star item. But I try to look at the product in a realistic manner and I do actually use the tools several times before writing the review. My main concern with these tools is the size. Every tool is 1/3 shorter than any other grilling tool I have used before. You may ask yourself  “So what?”  but here is the thing. We have a Weber Genesis gas grill, middle of the road model not the ridiculously huge ones but a nice grill. WE started by putting 9 burgers on the grill and then using the spatula to flip them. The problem is because the tool is so ridiculously short when you are flipping burgers that are towards the back of the grill your arm is frickin on fire! The whole purpose of a grill tool is so that you can safely grill without the discomfort of burning yourself.So lets compare these tools to the cheap set I picked up at Target about 10 years ago.Spatula RRP: $12.99:      http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KYL53ZCOverall 14.5” long including the ring for hangingHandle is 4 3/8” longspatula part is 3” wide by 3 1/2” long (not square (tapered) so it's actually smaller than that.Compare to my old oneOverall 21” long including the ring for hangingHandle is 8 1/2” longspatula part is 3” wide by 4 1/2” long (not tapered) a perfect rectangle.Overall comparisonWhen using the Firewolf brand tool you immediately notice that the tool has a considerable amount of flex. This is because of the thin steel used when compared to my older set that uses steel twice as thick and has almost no flex to it when you apply pressure.  Overall 2 stars for first being too short to use and for having too small a flipping surface.---------------------------------------------------------Tongs RRP: $12.99:        http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KYLHF9EOverall 13 1/2” longHandle is 4 3/8” longThe end part (not sure what to call it) The grabby part? Is 1 3/4” square also taperedCompare to my old oneOverall 18 3/4” longHandle is 8 3/4” longThe end part (not sure what to call it) The grabby part? Is 2” by 3 1/2” (with one rounded side)Overall comparisonThis is where I thought the Firewolf brand did the worst very thin steel causes a LOT of flex making it difficult to pick up larger pieces of meat. You can easily bend the metal simply by using two fingers to pull the metal in different directions. This product on its own would be a 1 star item.Fork RRP: $12.99:          http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KYLDDD6Overall 14” long including the hoop for hangingHandle is 4 3/8” longFork itself is 1 1/4” wide by about 3 1/2” longCompare to my old oneOverall 20 1/4” longHandle is 8 3/4” longThe fork itself 1” by 4 1/4” longOverall comparisonSame issues, metal is too thin, not long enough, can be flexed very easily. I also was not a fan of the flared fork on the tool. The two forks are not straight pieces of metal instead they are angled, I tend to believe that the straight ones piece meat more easily and cut into it much less than the angular shape of the Firewolf unit does.Grill Brush RRP: $12.99:  http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00KYKUG8COverall 12” long not including the string for hangingHandle is 6” long  plastic not stainless like the other toolsBrush width is 6” wideCompare to my old oneOverall 22” longHandle is 9 1/2” longBrush width is 6” wideOverall comparisonBesides the length of the tool the two were almost identical. The twisted wire that makes up the frame was about 25% thinner than on my old set but that made no perceivable impact on its cleaning ability. This all comes down to whether you are a hot or cold cleaner.  I tend to scrub the grates and then turn the grill on. However my wife prefers to let the grill run for a few minutes and then scrub the grates while they are hot. For me the Firewolf scrubber worked just fine but my wife prefers the older one with the longer handle.So, What's the deal?Overall what it comes down to is if you live in an apartment and have a small grill on the patio or balcony these would probably be great for you. However if you are a serious grill-er then I honestly can't recommend them.Just for fun I browsed Amazon for grilling tools. Assuming I wanted to spend $40 (the combined price of these 4 tools) here is what I found.Mr. Bar-B-Q 18-Piece Stainless-Steel Grill Tool Set sells for $38.37. Almost identical to the set that I have which is over 10 years old. 18 pcs plus a nice case.How about something more similar to this?Cuisinart CGS-5014 14-Piece Deluxe Stainless-Steel Grill Set $27.69 all stainless steel and comes with a case.So overallquality = 2 starsdurability = 1 star (due to the thin steel and amount of flex in tools)value = 1 star (compared to other sets on Amazon)safety during use = 1 star short tool length makes it uncomfortable to use over the grill With that I can not recommend this set.
