I have mixed feelings about this product. First off I want to point out that anyone who has a review for this item yet does not show a "Verified Purchase" next to their review, received one of these for free in exchange for a review. I believe in being up front and honest about that and wish others did the same.So once again, I received a free unit in exchange for writing a fair and balanced review.This is the nicest shoe horn I have ever seen. It is very well made, has some heft to it and the features such as the expandable extension handle is pretty cool. Having said all that though it falls a bit short of meeting expectations and I have three complaints about this product.The Shoe Horn features a flexible section in between the horn itself and the handle. If you are older and just need an additional hand getting your shoe on it works great. However, If you need a hand getting those long stubborn boots on and need to apply some backwards pressure to squeeze into the boot then that cool spring feature actually works against you and makes the job much harder than it should be.My second complaint with this unit is the size of the horn itself. it really needed to be longer to accommodate taller shoes and boots. I think they fell short by making the handle so long yet skimping on the most important part.Lastly the expandable handle is neat but felt flimsy, the thin walled tubing gave the impression it would eventually fail especially if force is used. Which may in fact explain why the spring was used. By adding the spring you can't exert pressure and thus bending the expandable handle.  I also did not like that you can't push down with this when the handle is extended as that only causes the tubing to collapse into its not expanded stageSo What's the breakdown?Cool factor = 5 starsOverall features = 4 starsDurability = 2 starsusefulness = 2 stars (due to not being able to apply any backwards pressure)Overall 3 starsSo if you just need a light duty unit and the long handle will make it easier for you this is a nice unit. However if you need a heavy duty unit and you have bent or broken cheap units, this probably is not for you. 3 stars = meets expectations1 or 2 stars = fails to meet expectations4 or 5 = exceeds expectations

First off these are very small. Its a thin rubber toy made from very thin plastic/ rubber type product. It is built from two pieces the head and the body. Unfortunately my dog destroyed all 4 I bought within seconds.I have some other concerns regarding this product including the fact that it is a drop ship from China. Being that is is sold directly from a Chinese supplier and mailed to your home in 3 weeks there is no one who does a quality inspection nor verifies that this product is even made from materials suitable for ingestion from a pet.Having worked in a corporate retail environment for several years I know that retailers test products before committing to purchase them and generally do a good job of eliminating products not worthy of reaching the consumers.I gave this product two stars because of its ridiculously small size and very poor quality. I would expect a chew toy to last more than two minutes.

First off I believe in full disclosure and complete honesty when writing reviews, something I wish everyone on Amazon took a bit more seriously.I have a simple rating system.3 stars = Meets expectations4 or 5 stars = exceeds expectations1 or 2 stars fails to meet basic expectations (needs more development or better quality control)I received this product as a “reviewer sample” so it was given to me for the sole purpose of writing a review.  I will start by saying I have very mixed feelings about this product. I guess I was not sure what to expect besides a case with a built in battery and external wireless charger.The system is comprised of the following components. A. 2 piece plastic case. The back rests on the phone and then is held in place by a trim ring that goes around the outer edge of the phone.B. Battery holder/ extender  (features an extra battery built in)C. Wireless charging padD. Micro USB charging cablePhone InstallationPretty simple installation process. Use your fingernail to pry off the back of your phone. Remove the OEM battery and install it into the aftermarket battery/ holder.  Install the battery holder into the battery socket. I found this slightly difficult as mine required a small amount of  “cramming” to get it in place.The case is two parts separate them, then lay  your phone into the back of the case (there are two tabs that click into the phone itself.  Then snap the trim ring on (from the front) to hold the case together.First Impressions.Overall this is a very good concept. A hard shell protective case, a battery booster and a wireless charging system. Unfortunately, I am very disappointed in the case quality.  It reminds me of the cheap stuff you would buy from one of those mall kiosks. My issue with this type of product is it truly offers only minimum protection when you drop your phone.Lets look at the componentsBattery boosterThis is one of the products strongest points. Simply it doubles your battery life. (Usually I have to put my phone on the charger somewhere along the day in order to get a full days use out of the phone).  By piggy backing an extra battery you are able to get more done and not worry about running out of power.External Wireless charger.Nice simple unit made from aluminum and about the same size as your phone. Has protective rubber feet to sit on your desk and plugs into your external charger via a micro USB cable (cable is supplied). (Requires an external charger, not supplied)CaseUnfortunately for me, this is what I least liked about the product. Phones are not cheap and if you expect your phone to last you more than a year a high quality case is a necessity. I always choose a 2 part case that feature a hard plastic shell along with a soft rubber liner that attaches to the outside of the plastic. A combination of plastic and rubber ensures that if the phone falls it will be protected and most importantly the rubber surround will prevent the phone or case from popping open and ejecting your phone when it hits the ground.I used the case and battery extender on my phone for 2 days and then had my wife use it on her S4 for three days here is what she said about the case ”I feel nervous because the case is slippery and when I push a button it creaks and the edges pop open”.On 8-31 My son dropped my wife's phone and what I expected to happen actually occurred. The phone hit the ground the case popped open and there lay 4 pieces on the kitchen floor.And that, is the issue!The case is the “glue or binder” that makes the package work or not work! Each of us makes a decision as to what level of protection our phones need.  I know that in my active life I need to know that when I drop my phone it's not going to break. So if the case sucks, Where does that leave us? Can you use the battery and charger without the case? NOPE! Can you at least use the battery? NOPE! Can you use the wireless charging? NOPE! So your options are very limited.A. You deal with a low quality, low protection case to get some extra battery life and wireless charging.B. You go without and protect your phone with decent case..You of course will have to make your own decision. Personally for me the case is not going to work with my job and what my phone goes through. My wife on the other hand is much more careful with her phone and she is thrilled with the extended battery life.The breakdownSo where does that leave us?Cool factor 5 starsBattery boost 5 starsCase quality 1 starcase performance 1 starProduct usefulness without case 0 starsOverall I have to say 3 stars. A super cool concept that falls short only because of the case.In all fairness If you are one of the folks who buy those decorative snap on cases, you may find the protection adequate. What I look for in a case is protection not aesthetics.

Ordered 2 pairs both had an imperfection in the lens. Almost in the same spot on the right side just to the left of the bifocal (when looking straight on at them) there is a spot that is either not polished or has a small amount of plastic missing/ mosformed.On one pair it was far enough out of my line of sight where is was not an issue but on the second pair it was right there were it was annoying.Expected more from Dewalt.

I like the message in this dvd very much.  The only thing is that eckhart belches a lot of small burps during his speech and it can be distracting.  I would've liked those noises to have been edited out to make it easier to repeatedly listen to the speech.

I love Joanna Hoggs and I feel she doesn't make enough movies.  When I found out she was directing Exhibition I was already in line for my ticket.  But I found this movie to be ok at best.  It's about a couple living in a house of very contemporary design.  Something you might expect a young, artsy couple to live in rather than an older couple like these two.  The husband thinks it's time to move from the house while the wife is rather attached to it... VERY attached.  She literally has an erotic relationship with it.  Often using the house and it's furniture to get herself off.  When the husband tries to engage with her sexually she often isn't interested....but she does get turned on by the house.Strangely enough she's also somewhat afraid of the house whenever she has to spend too much time alone in it... and she is also apparently afraid of leaving the house late at night.  There is an implication that something bad happened to them either inside or right outside the house at one point in the past, but we never figure out what that bad thing might have been.There is one scene where we see her having sex with her husband, but the way she's rubbing up on the couch makes it seem like a threesome.  Slowly we see her start to move closer to her husband and being able to let go of the house.  It's an interesting movie, but we are left with too many questions.  I'm ok with unknowns in film, but feel that there is a line where if there are too many of them, you cease to care about the story and the characters.  And I think there are just too many questions with this film and it leaves us not caring as much as we should have.

I don't know what kind of warped minds wrote this episode about a woman's beauty being the cause of her being raped.  Then the "cure" for her not having to worry about rapists anymore is some potion that makes her look ugly.  I can't imagine many women were on that writing team, but one thing's for sure-  Those people didn't do an ounce of research on rape or rapists before writing that episode.Not only did it not make any sense (If this Wessen can't be in any intimate relationship then how the hell do they procreate? and how the hell did the mother and grandmother go through an entire sexual attack BEFORE killing the guys when this Wessen only has to feel defensive to release the toxin that instantly kills?)  But all of the characters imply that it is the female that is encouraging rape by the way she looks.  Also the episode claims that a man simply has to get aroused to stimulate the toxin in the Wessen-  Rape isn't really about arousal, but about power and in fact it's not so uncommon for rapists to not be able to get aroused for some time and they have been known hold their victims until they can find a way to become aroused. (Average rape lasts 6 hrs).  Furthermore Rapists are more likely to target victims that have a more insecure attitude (in other words seem easier targets) than they are likely to attack victims based on their looks.  Despite these facts everyone implies that the girl is the issue because she's the one that's beautiful and if you can just "fix" her beauty it won't be a problem anymore.  And indeed in the end her beauty is removed which results in her happiness & all is well! This was a truly offensive and sick episode and I can't believe they actually aired this.

For me it is the perfect size for clothing.  I also have the clean dirty cube in the half-size which is fantastic for traveling with my books and keeping them separated by subject.  They don't seem to sell the half-size version on Amazon though.

i liked it.  It was a little too annoying for me sometimes.  I didn't like the ghost of christmas present and the domestic violence going on there.  Not that I'm against physical violence for the sake of comedy, but it was overkill and ended up being more annoying than funny. Bobcat Goldthwait does a great job as the fired and disgruntled employee.  Bill Murray is really over the top in this movie and sometimes it's funny, but other times it's just too much.  There are a lot of sex jokes in the film so probably not something you want to see with the little ones during the holidays.

I just cannot understand for the life of me how everyone doesn't know the Hebrew Hammer; or how this movie has not become a holiday staple at everyone's home yet.  It is in my house!  You do not need to be jewish to  find this movie absolutely hilarious.  It had us laughing from even before it started and posted the dedication: "This movie is dedicated to all the jewish brothers and sisters that had enough of the gentile."  And then from the first shot of the creepy, cartoony jesus statue... It's just laughs after laughs.  I mean the leader of the Jewish Justice League is called Chief Bloomanbergensteinenthal.  You can't get more genius than that.I do think the movie could used a little more action though.  Especially towards the end in tyring to capture Santa Claus.  But overall its just a solid film.

Mehh...  I don't find Bill Murray's character in this movie to be very likable.  In fact I find him really annoying.  Once they enter into the army nothing remotely realistic happens in this movie.  Every single female character is there for only one purpose- to be a sexual object.  Even the female soldiers wear uniforms that were way too tight for regulation.  The cast has a lot of great supporting comedians in it, but we don't get to see most of them much so they're wasted in the film.  John Larroquette (Captain Stillman) however was well used and he does his character really well.  He is the best part of this movie.
I like anything with Bill Murray in it.  Every April should be Bill Murray month where everyone gets together and watches Bill Murray-athons.

The cards are not the greatest quality.  When I try to shuffle them like I would a regular card deck, the edges get damaged and peeled on the side where you are shuffling.  It's better to mix the card up by gently placing cards in different spots which is kinda time consuming.  But at least the cards are firm enough that they don't bend easily.As others have noted it does not come with a custom box for the cards so traveling with them I have to use a rubber band.  Not a big deal I guess.  You can just put them in a small ziplock bag for protection.The CD it comes with is truly wonderful.  This card deck is really helping me memorize the alphabet.

The lace is cheap (but that's to be expected for the price) and will get stringy if you use these often.  I kinda wish the lace was on the underside as that would give more uv protection and would also make it easier to use smart phones and tablets while wearing them.  The lace on the backs of the hands offer almost no UV protection as duh- lace is mostly see-through.

The first 2 weeks of use I loved this mat... but then I started to need a second mat to put on top of it.  Many of the excercises I'm doing require that I stand on my knees and this mat provided great support... but after only a few days the imprint of my knees would stay on there longer and longer to the point where 24 hours later my knee prints are still there.  Of coarse I move my knees around to different spots, but now my mat is full of knee prints.  The mat gets thinner at these points and now my knee starts to hurt while I'm on the mat.  I have to put an EXTRA mat on top of this one just so that it doesn't hurt now.  I'm going to have to look for something sturdier that keeps it's thickness.  In the meantime I've actually cut off the last 14" of the mat and use it to add extra cushioning for my knees while I'm using the mat.  I'm short so I don't need the full length anyway.I do think that this mat is great for yoga too and have had no problems doing so.  However it's not good for a serious yoga practice because it's too thick and stretchy.  For a casual practice it does fine.

I like the product.  It warms quickly.  I don't like where the cord plugs in.  It plugs into the side but into the very middle of the blanket on that side.  So it's very awkward as you're likely to carry the cord with you whenever you move the blanket.  It would be better to have the cord close to one of the corners instead of in the middle.  My previous blanket had it on the corner and that was definitely better.  The size is good.  I could've even gone with something a little smaller.  But it seems that with electric blankets size is limited to either full blanket size or tiny spa wrap size without much in between.  The size is smaller than a blanket which I like though.
I love this CD.  It is read beautifully and you feel like you are attending some sort of religious service just listening to it.

These are amazing.  The taste and texture are wonderful and they have virtually zero net carbs so you could eat the whole box and not raise your insulin or ruining a low-carb diet.  Of coarse I never eat the whole box because I'm trying to control my sweet cravings, but it's nice to know that the two-three pieces I generally take with my turkish coffee are not having any impact.  The box I received was fresh and yummy.

The show has gotten into soap opera territory this season.  Split personalities? Government mind control? Secret Ancient Plagues hidden by ancient Davinci code-like monks?  Are you kidding me?  And it's hilarious how the agents quickly accept these ridiculous soap opera explanations without so much as a blink.Berlin came and went as if he barely mattered when he was hyped up into this super mysterious guy the first season.  Reddington's ex loses a finger and a tooth and she barely mentions it as if it doesn't bother her that she's lost parts of her body due to Reddington.  The show is all over the place.  When Keen ends the first episode does her last scene by sporting a new sexy haircut and a low cut shirt to symbolize her "growth" as an agent our eyes rolled as it was too obvious and cheesy.  The story lines aren't as simple and clear as they were in season 1.  Did they change the writers this season?  Did they hire a bunch of new ones?  Or did they get so pumped up with the popularity of the first season that they became over-ambitious?  Whatever the problem is they need to stop the nonsense now.

I love this dvd.  It's somehow both really easy.... and yet really hard.  Making it great for non-fit and fit people alike.It's easy in the sense that it's easy to follow.  Tracy goes into detail on how to do the moves precisely and she doesn't go too fast (except in the ab section which I'll get to later).  If you're just starting out you can just do the workouts without weights or pick and choose from the 4 sections to move more slowly.If you are very fit you will still get your butt kicked though as she will recommend you use weights and you can do more than one section at a time.  My butt and lower back muscles have always been weak so the butt section is something I could not go move through all the way even without weights.  Only after 2 1/2 weeks of doing the butt section every single day was I FINALLY able to move through that 15 minute workout all the way through (although I still get out of breath by the end of it).  You really get to appreciate just how friggin' strong this petite little woman is watching her do all these moves without breaking a sweat AND while using 1.5 lb weights on her ankles!The ab section moves really fast.  She warns you of this when she starts this section.  I'm guessing she was running out of time on the DVD or something so she tried to cram the Ab section in there by moving super fast.  I have the VLC player on my computer and I am able to slow the playback down a couple of notches so that I can learn the moves.  Eventually I'll be able to do it full speed.

I use this even more than my larger getaway lunch tote.  It's a great size for bringing snacks and and ice pack.  I just don't understand why built has to make their designs so feminine.  Do they think only women carry their lunches to work?  I am female, but I'm not really a girl girl so the flowery and pinky designs are not my favorite.  But I also didn't want to get the basic black because I want to be able to quickly find my lunch in my bag without mistaking it for anything else in there.  I got the mini dot navy and at least that one is not too feminine or bright.
They only work on round plates and not square.  I guess I should've realized this by the picture.  Anyway, they were too deep for my cabinet.

This is my least favorite piece in the New Wave collection.  Unlike the other reviewer I don't have a problem with the tab being slippery, but I suppose that depends on various factors like the humidity in the room, etc. but what I don't like is that the lid does not lay flat on the bowl.  If you transport this bowl on a tray you will hear the lid wobbling on the bowl.

This book is probably best for an already practicing Hindu or scholar.  Not easy for a beginner or non hindu to grasp I think as there's not enough detail.  I had looked up various morning hindu prayers in the past and was surprised to not find them in this book.  For example, the one where one looks at the hand upon wakening does not seem to be in this book.  Instead there are other prayers to the grahas etc.  I thought the Gayatri Mantra was supposed to be recited at sunrise each morning, but the book doesn't mention when to recite it. (though of coarse the mantra is in there).  I think based on the time schedule mentioned in the beginning of the book it should actually be recited before sunrise.  I wish there was more detail on when the mantras and prayers are to be recited.  It also doesn't really mention any nightly rituals prayers before bed which I guess is ok since it is about the "Daily" practice of hindus.

I received three 100% cotton lint free cloths that are 28 inches by 29 inches. These are perfect to use as kitchen towels or for cleaning. They are thin but absorbent for drying dishes and are larger than standard kitchen towels. For cleaning, they are lint free and can be used for wiping down counters and appliances, washing windows and dusting. They're also machine washable and come out looking new to be used again.These are made in China. The material is sewn well at the hem and it appears to be nice cloth that I'll get a lot of use out of. I tend to go through paper towels quickly, and using these is more of a cost-effective option. I like how it comes in a pack of 3 and would recommend to anyone that needs cleaning towels around the house. Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

Hip & Joint Max soft chews are dark, rich, and have a strong smell of bacon. Each chew is about 3/4 inch in diameter and about 1/4 inch thick. Since they're soft, they can easily be torn in halves and quarters. The jar has a dosage chart based on weight and contains 30 "treats." The active ingredients are Glucosamine, Chondroitin Sulfate, MSM, Vitamin C, Omega-3 Fatty Acids, Yucca Schidigera Powder, & Hyaluronic Acid.The advantage of these is they're easier to give your dog in comparison to mixing powder in food or giving the liquid Glucosamine orally with a syringe. If your dog likes them, it's a stress-free way of giving them these supplements. I placed my tongue on one, and they are bacon flavored. If I could change anything, I wish the level of Glucosamine was higher. Usually for dogs under 25 or 30 lbs. they take about 500 mg. a day. This has 225 mg. per 2 chews. So, that would be about 4 a day. The jar comes with 30 in it.I like how this has a combination of ingredients known to help dogs with arthritis. It's made in the USA and appears to be a quality product with a lot and expiration date. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a tasty dog treat with joint support supplements. Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

1:35 Mins This is a self-balancing two-wheel electric scooter. In the owner’s manual, it’s referred to as a “Dreamwalker.” You ride it like a skateboard, except it’s electronic and goes up to 10 miles an hour. I think it requires more coordination and practice than a skateboard. A skateboard has four wheels, this only has two. What they have in common is the motions to control the board are similar. To speed up lean forward. To slow down, lean backward. To turn right, slightly till your left foot forward. To turn left, slightly tilt your right foot forward.It’s made of a sleek, black, thick shiny plastic and the board is about 23 inches long by 7-1/2 inches wide. It is one piece, but the two halves can twist and turn independently. The two wheels are each about 7 inches in diameter, have good tread, and fancy “hubcaps.” On the surface of the transporter, it also has thick foot pads with plenty of traction. It’s fairly heavy at about 30 lbs. – I am an adult woman weighing about 115 lbs., I could comfortably carry it a short distance. However, if rode farther from home and the battery ran out, it would be a bear to try and carry back. As an accessory for electric scooters, they should design a strap that fits around the middle portion so it can be rolled home. The wheels will roll manually even when the power is off. The charge on the battery lasts about five hours. The battery light in the middle will also turn to red once you’re down to 10% battery. When you get this it needs to be charged for 1-2 hours and comes with the power cord and battery charger. This is my first time trying out one of these and am having fun with it. I was a little scared at first. I still haven’t completely mastered it. The thing about me is I lack in coordination. I’m also very sedentary. I go to work and sit at a computer. I come home and sit at a computer. I don’t exercise. This has been going on for years. So, using this scooter is way out of my normal comfort zone. Now that I have a bit more experience, it’s not as intimidating. If I run into a chair it will stop – not a big deal. I’ve been practicing mainly inside, balancing myself by holding onto a chair, the wall, a door, etc. I can feel it in my calves and abdomen, this is good exercise. I think this is a great workout and I enjoy it. I’m working myself up and once I improve, I plan to start riding outside more. While smooth surfaces are best, you can also ride it in the grass and dirt. I would recommend this scooter for anyone needing to take short regular trips or get more exercise. Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

This is a 3.5-ounce glass bottle of extra virgin olive oil with black truffle. The ingredients are extra virgin olive oil, black truffle (tuber aestivum) aroma. The glass bottle is decorative with a thin neck and a rubber stopper cap.It has an earthy distinctive fragrance - kind of hard to compare to anything else. The flavor is unique as well, different but enjoyable. Since I've never tried or cooked with this before, I decided to play it safe. I mixed it with pasta. It came out very good and I ended up going back for a second helping.This is produced and bottled by Casina Rossa in Italy. It has a Best Before date stamped on the bottle of 30 Mar 2016, so I have up to 4 months to use it. That'll give me time to expand my horizons and try it on fresh salad & scrambled eggs. I would recommend this to anyone that wants an oil that will enhance the flavor of food with truffle. Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

I got four tubes of peppermint lip balm. These are standard-sized, safety sealed tubes that are dark brown, green, and white. I liked many of the ingredients i.e. coconut and Vitamin E oil. It also has flavor, so your lips taste good. The peppermint is subtle. If I could change anything, I'd add more peppermint. I'm a lip balm junkie and getting several at a time is convenient. One to keep in my purse, one for at the computer, one at work, and one in the bathroom. These are very moisturizing and I would recommend them too as a base before applying lip stain. Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

This is a stainless steel mug or thermos. It measures 8 inches tall by 2.75 inches in diameter and has a screw off cap. There are many similarities between this mug and the one it replaced. The one I had before was different from just any run-of-the-mill coffee mug. It was made out of porcelain but had the exact same style as this one. I would take it everywhere. Two weeks ago I was packing stuff in my car and forgot I left it on top. I drove off and when I turned the corner it flew off and shattered into pieces. I've been looking for something I would love as much, and this one is the closest I could find. Part of what I love is its beauty and uniqueness. There are variations on colors, but I chose the shimmery gold.Practicalities, 16 ounces is a nice, large mug and it's insulated. It keeps my coffee hot. It doesn't feel hot on the outside. It also has a seal in the cap to prevent any leaks. The edge I press my mouth to sip is smooth without sharp edges. The opening is wide enough that my nose doesn't bump it. It is a perfect diameter for my hand to hold. And, it probably won't break if it falls off the top of my car. Limitations I don't care about but probably worth mentioning, you can't use this on your stovetop, in the microwave, dishwasher, or freezer. This stays nice with a quick hand wash and air or towel dry. I truly love this mug and would recommend to all! Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

This is a stainless steel men's watch. It can tell the time and date. It has three hands that rotate "clockwise" - second, minute, & hour. The circular face within its SS frame is 1.6 inches in diameter. It is covered in mineral glass. The SS watch band is interlinking that in a close up, look similar to the pattern in a brick wall. It has a clasp that can't be seen from the outside. One size would probably fit most average sized men. Some may need an adjustment. My fourth picture shows the tool they include for adjustment. There are 10 sections on the band with pins. To take a section apart, you push the pin out with that tool. Then you can reconnect it to a different section to make the band smaller.The presentation and packaging of this watch is impressive. It comes in a nice box with the band around a pillow. you also get a record card, fancy gift bag, owners manual, & hair clip. I thought the hair clip was a nice gesture. To get this beautiful watch in the mail, and with packaging that already far exceeded my expectations, and on top of that, as if they didn't already do enough, they're also going to add a hair clip. It kind of sends the message that this company goes all out for its customers.If I could change anything, I thought the watch was wrapped too tightly in plastic wrap. It was so tight, I didn't even know at first. I opened the box and was looking at the watch. It looked like the face of it was cracked. It took me 5 minutes to realize that was actually plastic wrapping. It's around the face and band like a second skin. It has to be carefully peeled off. While I was relieved it wasn't actually cracked, I was worried I would damage it when removing it. Although, I did eventually get it off and it has been keeping accurate time. I'm happy and would recommend this to anyone that wants a quality watch at a low price. Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

This is a mini USB operated humidifier that holds 2.7 ounces of water. You don't have to measure it exactly. You just fill it up about 80% full. For the size, it does put out a surprising amount of moist air. You add water and let it sit for 3 minutes as the water is absorbed into the sponge stick. Then plug it into the USB, push the On button and watch it go. You can see a strong stream of fog coming out of it. If you place your hand a few inches above - you can feel it get moist.Scents: The owners manual is saying immoderate essential oil or perfume is not recommended. The description of this item says not to use it at all. So, this is not being sold as an aromatherapy diffuser. The benefits of it are creating some moist air around your computer work area for comfort. With that said, I did add some perfume. Just for this time to try it out. A a few drops. If you choose to do so, I probably wouldn't add more than a drop or two.This in a nice product, especially for anyone in a dry climate. Most of us spend a lot of time at our computer and it brings the moister air right where you're sitting. I like the rice cooker design and it comes with everything - humidifier, USB cord, and manual. Would recommend! Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

I got six pairs of socks. It is two different argyle patterns - three of each. Argyle is the name of a pattern of intercrossing diamonds or diagonal lines. The material is soft ring-spun cotton. They feel and look like many dress socks made from a combo of polyester, cotton, spandex, & nylon. Color combos: Pattern one is black, gray-beige, army green, & blue-gray. Pattern two is chocolate brown, army green, darkest blue, & gray-beige. The size is for a men's shoe size 6-12. The style is somewhat unisex and I think men or women can wear these. I'm an adult woman with a 8.5 to 9 shoe size and they fit well.When you turn these inside out, you can see sewing fringes or threads as if each diagonal piece was sewn in separately. And yet, that is in no way apparent from the outside. It looks to be all one piece. They also feel comfy and well-made. These socks are Made in Pakistan. That was surprising, as I'm used to seeing everything either made in the US or China. I like how the foot and ankle is a solid color and the calf has the argyle pattern. I would recommend these to anyone looking for a nice set of dress socks at a reasonable price. Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

This is a large, wireless, waterproof solar light that's easy to install. The upper panel itself is 5 inches by 3.5 inches - including the frame it's in, it is 6.5 inches by 4.4 inches. You hang it by 2 included screws so the panel is facing up to be exposed to the sunlight. It could be placed by doors, windows, or anywhere you need more light.On the lower side, it has the light with cover and 3 control buttons. The light is about 4.25 inches by 3.25 inches and it's in the frame that is about 6.5 inches by 4.4 inches (just the lower half). When you first get it, it's important to press the On button to unlock it. Then press the Mode button to set how you want it to operate.Basically, both Modes are motion activated and both will be bright if someone is near. It's just the dim mode will have a constant dim light even when people aren't around. The darkness mode will shut off.It took about 10 minutes to set up. Then, it takes 6-8 hours for it to fully charge. I like it because it's easy to set up and I really needed some extra light out on my patio. Would recommend! Thanks to the company for offering the product to test and review for my honest opinion.

This mask is absurd and adorable and a little bit sinister. When I first saw it on Amazon my reaction was, "Aaah, how cute!" Seeing it in person I feel the same. Although, I do find something about it a little unsettling or sinister...maybe it's just that I'm home alone right now and it's sitting here on its stand watching me write this review. lol. At least I took a bunch of pictures, so you can be the judge. I got this in plenty of time for Halloween! This is perfect for dressing up on Halloween or just everyday weirdness.It's 100% latex and surprisingly comfortable. I think it's kind of one-size-fits-most. Although, I probably wouldn't have a young child wear this, maybe teenager and older. I'm an adult woman and can easily slip this over my head, even while wearing glasses. Vision is limited. I can see through the nostrils and mouth, not to the sides. This is better for safer, unicorn approved indoor surroundings.This is a white unicorn with vivid blue eyes and a fluffy mane. It has good detail and the latex is very strong. I received a discount on this product in a special promotion. My review, my opinion and experience is honest and 100% genuine. Would highly recommend!

The cool white under-cabinet light gives off enough brightness to light up a small area. I turned off all the lights in my house and threw this under my desk. The area under my desk lit up fairly well. If I was still, it would automatically shut off in a minute or so but would come back on as soon as I crossed my legs or kicked out my foot in front of me. This has 10 LED lights that go down the length of it (with a lifespan of 80,000 hours or more) and as I mentioned, it's also motion activated. It's estimated the batteries will last approx. 6 months on average use. It's easy to change the batteries. You just slide off the cover at the end and insert (4) AAA.I actually bought 2 of these: warm white and cool white. The last picture shows a comparison between the two - they are identical except the cool white is clear without the yellow tinge. I haven't decided yet where to put them. I'm considering outside near the door, but trying to figure out a good spot where they would never get wet. In all these pictures I took it was pitch dark - I was out on my patio in the middle of the night.These are only about 1-1/4 inches wide by 7-1/2 inches. Smaller than I somehow imagined but great for lighting up dark corners and I love how they can be placed anywhere. If I could change anything about them, I would add on an on/off switch in addition to the motion sensor. But overall, I really like these! I received a discount on this product in a special promotion. My review, my opinion and experience is honest and 100% genuine. Would recommend!

The warm white under-cabinet light is powered by four AAA batteries. No electricity, cord, or outlet needed - it can be taken anywhere. It's not solar powered so it doesn't rely on the sun. Being battery operated it's sort of the same concept as a flashlight, except it has 10 LED lights that go down the length of it (with a lifespan of 80,000 hours or more) and it's also motion activated.I actually bought 2 of these: warm white and cool white. The last picture shows a comparison between the two - they are identical except the warm white has more of a yellow tinge to it. I haven't decided yet where I'm putting them. You just slide off the cover at the end an insert and drop them in. These are only about 1-1/4 inches wide by 7-1/2 inches. Smaller than I somehow imagined but great for lighting up dark corners and I love how they can be placed anywhere. If I could change anything about them, I would add on an on/off switch besides having the motion sensor. But all in all, I really like these! We have an elderly semi-retired working dog -- Rosie the Border Collie, that in the last  2 to 3 years, has shown a substantial slow down in her usual activities such as keeping the goat in line, keeping the deer out of the yard, helping at feed time, playing ball, catching the frisbee; she cannot even jump into the back of our pickup truck anymore.  So sad because she lives for these things.  We decided she needed some major help, via a good solid supplement, with quality ingredients that work.  The 4 major ones:  Tumeric curcumin, MSM, chondroitin, and glucosomine.  All shown to be effective in studies for animals and humans.  So, when I was offered a small discount for an honest review of the Infinite Joint Advanced Formula dog supplements, it was like it was meant to be, a match made in heaven.  I happily accepted the challenge and was even happier for Rosie that the supplements did help her and I was able to write this honest review, and not have to send them back!When I received the product and saw the list of ingredients I was pretty sure it was a no-brainer, that they would work.  Heck, the stuff in these pills would  be good to ease human pain too, BUT, of course, this supplement is for DOGS, you'd have to go to the natural food store and get one made for humans, but thank goodness there is this one for our furry family members.  We at first tried giving to her as a treat (I know silly us!) but she is the smartest breed so you have to be a little trickier.  We just crush one up and mix with her wet food -- one in the morn and one in the evening.  After only 1 week we saw results.  She was playful again and even started following the husband out in the morning when he feeds the livestock.  That shocked and overjoyed him as he had missed his feeding helper.  She used to just stay in bed and watch him feed.  That was HUGE!  She runs like a puppy again, and just seems overall happier with her life.  The whole family is grateful to see this change in the poor old dog.  Even though I am cheap by nature, I will continue to buy Infinite dog supps, very small price to pay for a happy old dog that may not have much time left on this earth.  She needs to be as happy, and as pain free, as possible.  She has been a great dog and deserves it!PS:  The supps that are similar to Infinite are double the price at my vet and the local feed store.

All natural and no harmful ingredients are a MUST for my supplements so before purchasing the Calamari Ink Products Super Calanchovy Omega-3 supplements,  I needed to research the long scientifically named ingredients that I did not recognize.  I compared the ingredients to a popular all natural brands version of fish (non salmon) supplements.  They all passed, for my standards at least, and I like to think of them as high.  Quick breakdown if you are interested:***hydrochloride is a salt resulting, or regarded as resulting, from the reaction of hydrochloric acid with an organic base (most commonly an amine).***Tocopheryl acetate, also known as vitamin E acetate, is a common vitamin supplement.***Pyridoxine is one form of vitamin B6.***Cyanocobalamin is the most common and widely produced form of the chemical compounds that have vitamin B12 activity.At first, I though the Calanchovy supplements were a little more pricey than other brands until I realized it contains squid ink.  Squid ink, common in Italian and Spanish cooking is very high in iron and antioxidants.  Studies are showing that it protects white blood cell production, which helps give your immunity a boost, and studies have found that the ink possesses antitumor and antibacterial characteristics.  And very heart healthy friendly.  In addition to the omega 3 fatty acids from the fish, it is SUPER and I cannot find any other supplement that uses squid ink in supplements.  The studies of squid ink for health are many and VERY promising.  Your health is worth it. Black is the new green!!I've been taking it for about 2 weeks now and have been around sick people I have manged to stay healthy.  No weird fishy after-taste at all.  And I like that you only have to take 1, so that works out to about .41/cents a pill, which is pretty good considering it is not your average omega 3 pill and you are getting more than just one supplement.  I cannot wait to get my blood results next time I go to the doctor.  I did receive a special price to try this product during a promotional event,  and am very happy that I was chosen to try it.  I am 51 and really need to step up the omega -3's to protect my heart health and overall health.

I am a HUGE fan of vitamin C serum, have used a few different brands, and the Toulon serum did not disappoint.  Very generous amount for the price, especially for a serum that has such high quality ingredients and more importantly, works.  I use it 2-3 times a week and what I like the most about it, it that it tightens and smooths my skin without being overly tight and uncomfortable.  Maybe that is due to the addition  jojoba oil.  I apply a thin coat on my face after cleansing, and, occasionally, when my face felt a little too tight, I just apply a tiny dab of my regular moisturizer over it.  My skin really is noticeably smoother and tighter since I have been using this product.  Perfect for when you want your skin to look dewy and fresh for a special event or even everyday.  I didn't really understand how some reviews said they got no results at all.  I see results every time I use it!More of why I love this product:  A lot of Vitamin C serums have ingredients in them that can actually harm your skin like preservatives, or DMAE and retinyl palmitate.  The ingredient list on the Toulon serum meets my high standards for putting on my skin.  You have to be so careful, way too many products out there that have harmful ingredients.  Natural and/or organic is very important to me.  Also, for a Vitamin C serum to be the most effective and for proper absorption, it needs to have a vitamin ration of 10% or above, with 20% being optimal.  The Toulon has 20%.What has REALLY sold me on the Toulon brand of vitamin C serum is the price for what you get.  I went to a very popular online seller of cosmetics and looked at 8 different brands of Vit C Serum ranging in price from $45 to $155, all the same size at Toulon, 1 oz.  The ingredients were almost all the same!  Unbelievable!  You don't need a fancy "name brand" to get spa-like results, that is for sure.  I did receive a promo code in exchange for an honest review of this product and my review is honest and truly the experience I had.  There really is nothing to NOT like about this product so it was an easy review.  Well, one small thing, the pump is great but be careful to make sure it is pointed at your hand.  It comes out fast and I have squirted product the wrong way a few times.  Too precious to waste!

I am new to matcha but after my experience with Coolahoo Japanese Organic Matcha, am hooked and it will be a part of my tea/health regime for the rest of my life.  I drink a lot of green tea for the many health benefits and one serving of matcha tea is the nutritional equivalent of 10 cups of regularly brewed green tea.  I feel victorious after drinking 3 cups of regular green tea a day --  10 is a HUGE victory!!  There are so many health benefits to matcha that to me drinking a cup a day is a no-brainer.  I feel healthier and have more energy, which is not easy at my age and work schedule.  And, I am trying to lose weight and the extra energy has given me the metabolism boost I need to get, and keep me motivated.  The top 2 benefits that attracted me to matcha was weight loss and cancer prevention.  Simply put, the chemicals in green tea, especially EGCG and ECG, inhibit tumor growth and protect cells.  There are pages and pages of research to support those claims, which I have read.  Very interesting say the least.I usually just dive right into something but reading, or at least skimming the free e-book first is very helpful.  Lots of creative and delicious looking recipes -- matcha ice cream!  yowza!  Cannot wait to make and taste it.  After reading the e-book one of my goals is to develop, make, and photograph a super yummy matcha recipe and share with Coolahoo, with the hope they like it and may use it in their e-book in the future.  Sound like a good goal to me!When I made my first cup of tea with the powder I thought it might need honey, but after another cup with no honey, it tastes just as good without it.  I read the one negative review recently and I did not find it bitter at all.  I actually find the taste very pleasant.  I am new to matcha but not new to knowing what tastes good.  Also,  I have just used a spoon to mix so far, and have had no problems with clumping at all.  Very smooth but I am going to invest in a bamboo whisk because I am in this for the long term now.  The price is very reasonable for high quality, organic, matcha.  I will stick with Coolahoo when I purchase more.Work-Days:  I have found that this Coolahoo Japanese Organic Matcha powdered green tea is absolutely perfect for the afternoon work day slump.  I've been reaching for a simple cup of matcha tea or a quick matcha tea latte that has helped my concentration and energy level to make it through the day.  Simple --  1 tsp matcha power and 2 oz hot water, stir/whisk into a smooth paste, add 4 oz milk.  I use almond milk.  A battery operated frother would be perfect to keep at the office.  Next on my list to purchase but still good without the "frothing".  I wish I had discovered the benefits of matcha sooner, but better late than never.  Matcha Cookies (recipe in the free e-book) is what I am going to make for my afternoon snack at work next week.I am a fan of this product/company and would really like to connect on Facebook but all the links the e-book provided are broken.  I'll try to find them myself on social media.I had already been reading about the health benefits of matcha and was ready to try, so when I was offered a promo code to try and review Coolahoo Organic Matcha I jumped on it.  I was a perfect test subject because I take my health *and* my reviews very seriously.  I did a lot of research and I am very happy to have discovered, and now reaping the benefits, of matcha.  I am trying to rid my middle of some belly fat and matcha is supposed to be excellent for that.  I will update my review in a few weeks if that happens.

Love Love Love!!  This Mooi Tech Bluetooth Speaker is a good looking little bugger too!  Even though the instructions were way better than other bluetooth devices I've had, I still had trouble, but it was completely my fault.  Ya gotta hold the on button down for a few seconds-  DUH!!!  It tells you "power on" and "power off" which is super helpful to me.  So dang simple!  Paired up fast and easy to my PC (yay online radio) and my iPod.  I was able to take the speaker all over the house and yard when paired with the laptop or my iPod.  I love that you can  take it all over and it still stays paired.  I charged it using the USB port on my laptop and it charged up fast.  Came with a really nice fabric bag to keep your speaker in.  VERY nice touch!We had a BBQ last night with some friends and everyone was trying to share music on their phones so I ran in and got my Mooi Tech Bluetooth speaker and everyone took turns pairing up with it and blasting our music!  I was using an iPod and the others had android phones.  The sound is excellent and can be turned up very loud.  The best volume and sound so far of all my bluetooth speakers.  I accidentally left it outside in the drippy fog all night and when my husband brought it in, he apologized for it being wet.  HA!  It is waterproof!  And it was still charged up.  Played for about another hour after being left on all night.  My sister has a waterproof bluetooth by her pool that she paid over $60 for at a big box store and everyone liked mine, the Mooi Tech speaker, better.I love music in the shower so I take it with me there too.  First time I tried suctioning it to the shower it fell off and bounced off the floor.  Never stopped playing, so I am very happy that it is tough too, as I am hard on stuff sometimes.  I hadn't used a suction cup in a long time and didn't get it wet enough to stick.  Once I did that, it was stuck like glue.  Very strong suction which was impressive.  Oh, don't forget to close the flap at the charge port when in the shower.  I didn't and mine got wet but didn't hurt it.  I don't want to take any chances as I love this speaker and want it to last.I haven't tried the camping strap and hooks yet but I certainly will (another nice touch added in the package).  It will be perfect for hooking to a tree when camping or even your bike.  This Mooi Tech speaker would make an awesome gift for the sportsman in your life.  It can be taken camping, fishing, boating, hiking, anywhere you go.  My husband has hijacked the Mooi for his boat so now he is purchasing another for me.  I received the first one with a promo code for my honest review and buying another at full price.  I rely on honest reviews when I shop so it is important to me to be honest and helpful.  I truly do not think you will be disappointed.

I love lots of pepper on everything!  Especially fresh salads and veggies.  I haven't had a fresh pepper mill in years, and have never owned an electric cordless one.  I forgot how savory fresh ground pepper can be!  First of all, the Eukein Electric Mill looks great on my kitchen counter.  Glass and brushed stainless steel -- my favorite.  After I stopped staring at it, the batteries and pepper were very easy to load.  The $1 pack of AA batteries has lasted a long time ,  and I've been using this mill a lot for the last 2 weeks.  No turning and turning a non-electric pepper mill  -- you can use your pinky finger to get as much fresh ground pepper as you want.  I also like that you can easily adjust the coarseness of it.  I love milling up a generous sprinkling of coarse pepper on an olive oil and sea salt rubbed steak and then searing on a hot pan to perfection  --  easy pepper steak!  I like medium coarse for salads.  At the table, as this is very portable, everyone can change the setting to their preference.  The cap on the bottom helps keep the pepper fresh.  Peppercorns can keep for over a year or longer but I don't have to worry about that, I use it too fast, but some folks may not.And, black pepper is good for your health too so my new Eukein Mill is making it easier for the whole family to get the health benefit of eating more pepper.  Black pepper is what they call a carminitive, a substance that helps digestion and that promotes sweating and urination.  It works like this:  It stimulates the taste buds in such a way that an alert is sent to to the stomach to increase hydrochloric acid secretion, thereby improving digestion. Hydrochloric acid is necessary for the digestion of proteins and other food components in the stomach.  It also has impressive antioxidant and antibacterial effects, and they say (I hope it is true) that the outer layer of the peppercorn stimulates the breakdown of fat cells, keeping you slim while giving you energy to burn.  PASS THE PEPPER PLEASE!I received a promotional price for my honest review and it was an easy review to do because I truly love the Eukein Mill.  I will not use it for salt, not yet at least, because I use pre-ground sea salt, very sparingly, so will concentrate on using it for peppercorns.  I use the Eukein Mill a lot so if you have any questions, I can certainly try to answer.  I feel like a professional chef using this!  Would make a great gift for the foodies in your life or a very useful splurge for yourself.  I bought another for my sister and she loves it as much as I do.

These 18" Felt Christmas Stockings are the PERFECT set for my family.  Each stocking has a handy hangar on the left side for easy hanging.  They are sewn evenly and tightly and seem durable enough to stuff treats into (or coal). "Thank you for the time I've been given. Thank you to everybody for your love and kindness, for your honesty and persuasion. Thank you for telling me how it is but entertaining what I wanted it to be. Thank you for listening and for letting me into your lives again. Love Adele x"This is how the most successful female recording artist of this decade chooses to address her audience, in a short note on this, her hugely-anticipated follow-up to the record-breaking 2011 "21" album, a 30+ million seller. Indicative of her appreciation and good intentions, the note is every bit as honest as its writer, a 27 year-old lady, surprisingly composed and reserved, given her phenomenal success. Records have been broken already with the release of first single "Hello", and if one listens to "25", they will realise that, not only it was not rushed, but evidently the greatest effort was put in order to present an album worthy of its predecessor. In fact, "25" is better than "21"; more well-crafted, accomplished, and intense, less simplistic, and just as emotional and heartfelt. At least half of the new songs could rival "21"'s 3 smash hit singles. Highpoints are the rhythmic "Send my love (To your new lover)", the gentle "Remedy" (dedicated to her son), "Love in the dark", and "Million years ago", 2 gorgeous ballads.But this is an album that is solid throughout its 48-minute duration (60' for the deluxe, which adds 3 more tracks). Minimal but rich-sounding, with her voice front and center, "25" is a mature and subtle offering. Every possible aspect has been taken care of, from the actual songs, to the artwork (Adele is steadily developing into a Queen of black and white!); and the mastering is spotless - most will remember the terrible CD transfer of "21". Just days ago, Billboard reported that "25" is expected to become the fastest-selling album in the US since tracking began in 1991, with over 2.5 million copies in first-week sales based on projections by Sony Music. It seems to be a matter of time before these expectations are confirmed, but regardless of how "25" is going to perform, Adele is already a saviour, having generated an unprecedented interest, and breathing life in the music industry. "25" has everything it takes to become not only another million-seller, but, also, and more importantly, another timeless music collection.

I loathe manufactured bands but I love(d) the legendary Spice Girls. This is One Direction's fifth - and final for some time - album, their fifth November release in a row, their first as a four-piece, following the departure of the yummy Zayn Malik, and their last, before taking a much-needed break (they rolled non-stop since forming in 2010). 6 years (right, no more numbers) into their career, 1D are building upon a good foundation, with "Made in the A.M." expanding on the already existing template; the outcome is another great, ambitious pop-pock record. The songwriting is quite remarkable for their genre (on this 1D co-write 9 songs). With an overwhelming sense of levity and fun, and an effortless honesty even on the heartbreaking songs, one cannot help but get caught up in the whole affair. I fell instantly in love with their "You and I" single, and its accompanying brilliant video, when randomly watching it at a friend's house. If that can happen to a guy, then their immeasurable success can easily be explained.Because it's always the songs that matter. New single "Perfect", "Infinity", with its soaring synths and strings, the '80s-inspired soft-rocker "What a feeling", and the tender ballad "If I could fly", are some of this new set's strongest tracks. Noone is denying the fact that it is all manufactured and light-hearted, and although the songs are not bringing anything new or claiming originality, there is nothing wrong with that. Expecting some kind of musical masterpiece from 1D, is only laughable. However their achievements so far, are anything but. Boybands are serving a purpose; as long as they hold on to that, and are honest with their audience, they should be acknowledged for it. Sheer proof that talent shows can generate a successful career (and often exciting musical acts as well), 1D have been writing music history, entertaining the whole planet while breaking records along the way. They are a pop phenomenon which deserves praise for consistently producing solid, enjoyable pop; that's exactly what "Made in the A.M." is.Note: Closing track, "History", an almost acoustic, singalong number, is a telling swansong. "This is not the end", Louis croons. I'd believe him :)

Who would've thought that Justin Bieber was capable of such an unexpected turn! Just as the cover suggests, on this, his 4th outing, he appears less of a mainstream crowd pleaser, presenting a succession of subdued and introverted songs, addressing his troubled adolescence, emphasizing his remorse, and his desire to be cleansed. All the more apologetic and mournful, this is his chance to say sorry, and while he is doing it, he exhibits a clear vision for his sound. A sleek mixture of electro-pop, urban R'n'B, stripped-back digital beats, and off-beat vocal samples, brings attention on his soft, supple singing, assisted by personal lyrics, and surprising restraint exercised throughout. The result is a regretful look back and a fresh start, emotionally, and musically. The presence of EDM star Skrillex amongst the production credits, compliments Bieber's breathy voice, backing up the sense of a pretty major artistic transformation; from teen pop idol, Bieber is quietly blooming into a grown-up sophisticate.No.1 smash "What do you mean?", and last single "Sorry", are highpoints, along with opener "Mark my words", the funk-flavoured "Company", "The feeling", a dark duet with Halsey, electro-ballad - and brand new single - "I'll show you", trap track "No sense", and the title song which closes the album, a pensive piano ballad in which Bieber dedicates himself to God, defending his behaviour by saying that "We weren't put in the best position to make the best decisions". But the most honest, fragile, and sympathetic moment is to be found in "I'll show you", where he laments the strain of fame: "I'm not made out of steel / Don't forget that I'm human, don't forget that I'm real". Affirming the notion of a young man who has come through testing times to emerge with new maturity and purpose, it looks as if JB is finally showing his best side to the public. Never thought the day would come that I'd say this, but Justin Bieber sounds pretty great. "Purpose" is surprisingly interesting and enjoyable, cool, even. Ain't that shocking!

It took her really long, but her first fully-fledged seasonal album is here, 15 years since her Kylie-cious cover of "Santa baby" in 2000, a seasonal favourite since. Considering that most of her '80s peers have already presented at least one Christmas record, and the fact that she's been having at least one release of new, old, or tour material as often as every 2 years, it is rather surpring that Ms Minogue did not release a festive record sooner. "Never too late", though. "Kylie's Christmas" arrives 28 years into her recording career, and is as joyful and fun as anyone would expect from pop's eternal - and most beloved - princess (nevermind she's 47). As someone who never feels like struggling to impose her character in the music world all these years, this works in her favour on this particular album. What we get is a mix of classics and newly-penned festive songs, with Kylie doing on here what she has been doing all along, sticking to her fun and frothy formula. Those sweet vocals we first came to enjoy on her "Abbey Road sessions" album, are on this set, too; Kylie's mellow delivery on more subtle numbers is most splendid. Standouts include her take on The Pretenders' "2,000 Miles", the jazzy "Oh Santa", the Iggy Pop-assisted "Christmas wrapping", disco duet with sister, Dannii, "100 Degrees", and the Chris Martin-penned "Every days's like Christmas". It only takes a look at the cover photo and a couple of songs for the listener to feel the warm and cozy atmosphere, giving the impression that Kylie sings "especially for you", making you dream of being right next to her amidst presents and decorations, having a cuddle. Mmm, how I'd love to "kiss her once" under the mistletoe ..."I should be so lucky"!Note: Deluxe edition is the one to buy, as it contains 6 new tracks (3 of the standard edition, and another 3), plus a 6 video DVD of Kylie in the studio (if you thought you can't love her any more, you'll reconsider!). A limited white vinyl edition will be released on 27 November, too. Merry Christmas, everyone, 'tis the season to be jolly!

Overlooked by mass audiences, pop chameleon Mylene Farmer enjoys the adoration of millions in her native France, where, in the course of her 3-decade career, she has evolved from popstress to pop Empress. With 56 singles (14 of which No. 1s), 30+ million records sold, and an endless array of awads, accolades, and records broken, she is enjoying royal status and success equal to that of Madonna. A true artist in every aspect of her work, every album, single, video, and tour, is a special event. "Interstellaires", her 10th studio effort, comes 2 years after "Monkey me", the album that "corrected" the slight misstep that was 2011's "Bleu noir". Of course, as her fans know so well, in her case misstep does not mean bad. Because those who have experienced records such as the sublimely brilliant "L'autre...", "Anamorphosee", "Innamoramento", and "Avant que l'ombre", know the sky-high standards she sets with her releases. This new album finds her without her long-time collaborator Laurent Boutonnat. Although the first time they parted ways ("Bleu noir"), the result was evidently less spectacular than usual, this time around nearly all tracks on this new record are exceptional (just mentioning 2 highlights, "C'est pas moi", and the title track). Co-writer once again in all of these, she creates those sexy and hypnotic compositions she is so loved for through the years, completing the mysterious atmosphere with her astonishing, eerie vocals. Transcending the barrier of language, she remains as compelling as ever. Her unmistakable sound, a little more guitar-oriented than usual, but essentially pop, is nothing less than mesmerising. Dramatic, dark, haunting, irresistable. A true return to top form, "Interstellaires" is truly stellar.Note: As one of the very few artists who still produce special editions of her albums, "Interstellaires" is available in various formats (digipack edition, book edition, box set, vinyl), really a collector's dream. Even the standard edition is special (with a 20-page booklet so exquisitely designed); one cannot go wrong with any edition they choose.

She is - more than often - called a self-centered pop diva, but noone can accuse Mariah Carey for being silly when it comes to business. Using the lyrics of her 1994 Christmas classic "All I want for Christmas is you", this same-titled book is her first attempt as a writer, telling the story of a little girl dreaming of a puppy for Christmas. The idea is as cute as it sounds; and it is executed just as successfully, too. Chances are, adults and children alike are already familiar with the lyrics of the song. The interest comes from the story told by the illustrations (by Colleen Madden), which present the little girl as a cartoon version of Mariah (similar to that used in her "Heartbreaker" video). The story follows the little girl throughout the holiday season, in all her festive activities (baking, skating, shopping, visiting friends and family etc). Though it can be a little tedious to read those over-familiar to many lyrics, combined with the beautiful illustrations that do most of the work of telling the story, it all works rather splendidly!One of my favorite spreads shows the little girl, well, little Mariah, while all the other children are making snowmen, she is making a dog out of snow, complete with pine cone ears. Cuteness overload. (For MC fans who remember Jack, her adorable Jack Russell Terrier, this can bring some extra appreciation of this image). What is among the book's greatest qualities, is the multi-ethnic cast of characters; all children's books should feature this, and so I was more than pleased to see Mariah not missing the opportunity to portray a positive message. The quality of presentation is fantastic, with the glossy paper, and the hardback cover, and makes this 32-page book worth the purchase. Seems to me that, apart from the song itself (officially the biggest-selling Christmas song ever - 14+ million copies sold), "All I want for Christmas is you", the book, looks set to become another beloved tradition. With the ever popular, 15 million-selling "Merry Christmas" album turning 21 years old this month (watch out for the gorgeous deluxe anniversary red vinyl edition), Mariah may rightfully be considered as a modern Christmas Queen!Merry Christmas, everyone, 'tis the season to be jolly!

Too young to know them during their heyday, I have come to know and appreciate Erasure and their music in the mid '90s, but I understand that they were undeniably an important part of the cultural fabric of the '80s UK society. Though less controversial than some of their peers, they also pushed boundaries and broke taboos, creating excitement like few other bands before or after them, while producing some fantastic music along the way. Bought this new 30th anniversary release with no hesitation, as I already own previous greatest-hits compilations, "Pop! 20", and "Pop! 40". Which is why I find "Always" not their most comprehensive collection to date, since, of their 13 studio proper albums, 3 do not provide any songs on here ("Cowboy", "Loveboat", and "Light at the end of the world"), and another 5 are only represented by 1 single each. For a release that celebrates the duo's 30 years in music, this should feature tracks off every record, regardless of how successsful or not these may be.At least, as far as the song selection is concerned, this 19-track (+1 remix) retrospective is great, featuring almost all the big hits, and flows rather smoothly, not always the case with singles which are chronologically listed as on here. What is more interesting about this set, is the remixes. Cannot quite understand why this could not be a 2-disc set (hits+remixes), but, even though 2 discs of remixes may seem too much or unnecessary, it is anything but. In fact, these different takes on the originals offer a most interesting alternative listen, representative of Erasure's extensive fusion of synth-pop, electro-dance. The beautiful hardbook packaging compliments the content, including a 20-page booklet with new - highly amusing - sleeve notes. Had this edition also included a DVD with their videos, then it would have been almost perfect. Still, "Always" presents a large piece of the band's body of work, and makes for a near seamlessly enjoyable experience altogether.

Featuring his collaborations with Disclosure ["Latch (2012), "Omen" (2015), and Naughty Boy ["La la la" (2012)], and of course his solo singles ("Lay me down", "Money on my mind", "Stay with me", "I'm not the only one", "Like I can"), this new edition of one of 2014-2015's best-selling albums is a sort of mini greatest-hits album. Adding an extra disc of previously japanese-only bonus tracks, brand new cuts, acoustic versions and new collaborations, plus one magnificent cover of Amy Winehouse's "Love is a losing game", this edition is perfect for first-time buyers (like myself, who thought I'd wait some more before getting this), who will enjoy this in all its glory. Buyers of the original set are going to feel cheated by this enhanced version, but nevertheless this is a fine pop-soul record, crafted as if it was destined to become a classic album. Sam Smith may be the most plain name, but this offering is anything but. So heartbreakingly melancholic, yet, so addictive. Even the new atmospheric cover photo is more fitting to these songs, compared to that of the standard release. If only it included his 2014 "Have yourself a Merry little Christmas" cover, and the new Bond theme, then it would be absoluterly awesome. Still, it's a perfect little thing, and most probably will sell a lot (well, Adele's "25" is on the way so...). Gorgeous.

Anastacia's first greatest-hits album, the fantastic "Pieces of a dream" (2005), although released just 5 years into her career, boasted an impressive number of hits for such a short recording period. This updated version comes exactly 10 years later, offering a couple more hits, plus 2 brand new tracks. Truth is, following her first retrospective release, this talented little lady (5' 2") with the big voice (a mezzo-soprano) has been dealing with serious health issues, but it's also a fact that none of her 3 subsequent albums managed to come close to the huge success of her first 3. So, 6 studio albums, and 24 singles later, the "Ultimate edition" comes as a reminder of why Anastacia has been dubbed the Queen of sprock. 14 out of 17 tracks from the first best-of are on here [no "Made for lovin' you"(4th single off her debut album), "In your eyes" and "Pieces of a dream" (new tracks on "POAD")], with 5 more added on ["Stupid little things" (from "Resurrection"), "Best of you" (from "It's a man's world"), "Love is a crime" (from "Chicago OST"), and "Army of me" and "Take this chance" (both brand new)]. Once again, "Boom", the Official 2002 FIFA World Cup anthem, is omitted, and singles from 2008's "Heavy rotation" (2008) are excluded (Anastacia has admitted to regretting the forced change in direction on that album, so, it's justifiable). Those of us who have her first greatest-hits will be torn, those who haven't got them need no further thinking about buying this. It's a nice little package, complete with a booklet with photos and lyrics, but there isn't an extra incentive to make this an essential purchase. To be totally honest, "Pieces of a dream" overall is more desirable than this, but the 2 new tracks on here are worth buying. Well, just to support her, because she deserves it, if thinking of buying, choose this one!

The original version of "1" was released on November 13th, 2000, issued on the 30th anniversary of the band's break-up. The Beatles' first singles compilation available on a single disc, it debuted at No. 1 in its first week in both the official UK and US album charts, and topped the charts in 35 countries around the world. It went on to become the best-selling album of that year, and the best-selling album of the decade worldwide, selling 31+ million copies. 15 years later, this epic collection gets refreshed, just in time for the holiday season. Repeating the exact same tracklist, it features every No. 1 single released in the UK and US from 1962 to 1970, with a bonus disc of 27 promo videos, which is really the attraction on this deluxe package.The song selection is nothing less than extraordinary, representing appropriately each of the band's different styles and phases: Merseybeat style (1962-1964, tracks 1-8), folk-rock (1965-1966, tracks 9-16), experimental-psychedelic (1967-1968, tracks 17-21), and back to basics-rock (1969-1970, tracks 22-27). The sound quality of the songs is, without a doubt, the very best to date. Remixed from the original multi-track masters, compared to the 2000 original release, the audio is sharper, crispier, crystal-clear, truly an audiophile's dream come true. In addition to these new stereo mixes, this blu-ray version, also, features surround sound 5.1 mixes presented as Dolby TrueHD, and DTS-HD Master Audio (Dolby Digital and DTS in the DVD version).The video presentation is eye-popping. When someone of my generation gets to see old footage restored and enhanced to such level, then it's apparent that technology has reached inconceivable heights. The video disc alone is reason enough to buy this set. Presented in a classy, DVD-sized, gatefold digipack, and including a lavish and informative booklet (which has been given a poppier mini face-lift), "1" deluxe is one complete package. What sets this particular collection apart from others, is that it spans The Beatles' entire recording career. If there has been any singles album that shows the true genius of The Beatles, on any level, then it is definitely "1". Not a greatest hits collection, but it totally stands like one, being a comprehensive compilation.So many artists, current and past, have called The Beatles a major influence. One listen to "1", and anyone can realize why. The Beatles redefined music in their own image, and established a legacy no band will ever equal. They became the greatest band the world will ever know. There aren't many artists that can boast 27 No. 1 hits (I can only think of Mariah Carey's "1s to infinity" with 17 No. 1s coming close). It's really occasions like this when an item makes one comprehend the value and significance of certain things, which are beyond rating. So many words can be used to describe this (aptly-titled) collection; monumental, stellar, pristine, and essential, are some of the the most-appropriate.List of variations of "Beatles 1/1+":- standard CD- CD+DVD- CD+blu-ray- CD+2DVD*- CD+2blu-ray** These editions come with an additional 23 videos on disc 2, including alternate versions, as well as rarely seen and newly restored films and videos. The double-disc video editions, also, feature a 124-page hard-bound book with illustrations. The DVD and blu-ray video editions are, also, available as stand-alone packages.Here, I've listed the songs included on "1", along with the release dates, and chart placings.01.
