My hair looks decently smooth and full when I use this product.  It doesn't really add shine like it's supposed to.The directions aren't very great for this product.  There's basically a Style Inspiration for a Sleek Ponytail but that's all.  For that it tells you to apply cream to damp hair and blow dry.  Doesn't say how much.  I apply about a nickle sized amount and blow dry.  The cream smells great.  It has a perfume scent to it that I really like.  It's lightweight and isn't sticky or stiff on the the hair.Overall, I don't think this product is bad but I don't think it does much for me either.  I'm sure it's different for everyone so try it if you want.

I think this is a really great Desk Lamp.  I use it on my bedside table and it's perfect.This lamp is nice and tall but the base is small enough that's it doesn't take up too much room.  It can be folded up when not in use so it's pretty compact and saves space.  The arm and head are both adjustable so they can be angled many different ways and the head itself is rotatable too so you can shine the light right where you need it.The light can be very dim or very bright.  There's 4 pre-set modes that you can choose from.  Study, Read, Relax and Sleep.  Each one has a little image to represent it so it's fast and easy to select what you want.  Aside from those 4 modes, you also have a plus and minus button so you can adjust it to any level you choose.  I do a lot of reading in bed so I like being able to adjust the light to what works best.  I also make a nightly trip to the restroom so it's nice to be able to turn a light on dim so it doesn't bug my husband but gives me enough light so that I'm not stumbling around in the dark.  When I need a brighter light, I have that option too.  It can pretty much light up most of my bedroom if I need it to.This lamp also has a USB charging port which is very handy for me.  I always have my iPad, Kindle and Cell Phone on my night stand so it's nice to be able to charge any of them overnight should I need to.The quality of this lamp is excellent.  It's made great and seems to be very durable.  I can see it holding up for years to come.I really like this lamp and would highly recommend it.This product was provided free of charge for an honest review.

I have the White Cream Nail Lacquer and I think it's decent.  Not great but not bad either.It goes on easily and covers the entire nail pretty well without getting on my skin.  The problem is (with this color anyway) that it takes several coats to look evenly covered and then it starts looking too thick.It dries really fast and feels silky smooth but unfortunately, it chips too easily.  The lacquer can last for quite a while but it's not easy to go that long without it chipping.  Mine seems to chip within hours.I like the white color.  It's nice and bright.I think this lacquer is fine for short periods of time but due to the chipping, it's not one I'd use for a long period.

I think this is a nice Paper Shredder.  It can shred up to 8 sheets of paper at a time and although there's not a designated slot for credit cards, you can still shred them in the main shredder.This shredder is really easy to use.  The only button is the power button which you simply slide to forward or reverse shredding.  You can shred up to 200 sheets before you need to let the motor cool down.The shredder is nice and powerful and it cuts perfectly.  Shredding is pretty fast and effortless.  For a shredder, it's pretty quiet.  Much quieter than any other shredder I've used in the past.  The size is nice, it fits right under my computer desk and doesn't stand out or look bad.The basket can hold a good amount of paper shreds but when you need to empty it it's really easy.  The shredder has a handle which is helpful.  You just grab the handle and lift the shredder off of the basket and empty.  There's a little window on the basket that allows you to see the level of paper shreds so you know when you need to empty it without lifting the shredder off.I think this is a great shredder and I would definitely recommend it.This product was provided free of charge for an honest review.

I really like this Lightweight Moisturizing Lotion.  I've been using it along with Tresemme's Max The Volume Root Lifting Cream and it's a great combination.I have hair that is shoulder length, wavy to curly, thick, coarse, dry and pretty frizzy.This Lightweight Moisturizing Lotion really helps to add moisture to my hair without weighing it down.  It's extremely lightweight and it makes my have incredibly soft and pretty smooth.  The only thing it doesn't completely help is frizz.  It helps quite a bit but not completely.  2-3 pumps in the palm of your hand is all you need.  I apply it to my damp hair, add the Root Lifting Cream mentioned above and blow dry.  This small amount goes a really long way and lasts all day.I think this product works great, especially in conjunction with the cream mentioned above.  I would give it 4 1/2 Stars and recommend trying them.

I really like this Root Lifting Cream.  I've been using it along with the Tresemme's Max The Volume Lightweight Moisturizing Lotion and it's a great combination.I have hair that is shoulder length, wavy to curly, thick, coarse and pretty frizzy.This Root Lifting Cream really helps lift my hair and give me some great volume.  It's very lightweight on my hair and it lasts all day.  A nickle sized amount in the palm of your hand is all you need.  Rub it from root to tip of damp hair and blow dry.  This small amount goes a really long way.I think this product works great, especially in conjunction with the lotion mentioned above.  I would highly recommend trying them.

We just installed this faucet in our half bathroom on our main floor and it's absolutely beautiful.  I really love the look of this faucet.  It turned our small, plain bathroom into something neat and modern looking.  It's the highlight of this bathroom.  It looks really great.The faucet is very solid and excellent in quality.  It's a nice taller height that extends a bit further than standard faucets and is wider than most.  I like all the flat, smooth sides.  There is a single lever handle that controls both the hot and cold water.  At the back of the handle there's a small red square on the left and a blue square on the right to remind you which side is hot and which side is cold should you, guests or kids need it.  The water comes out in a nice, wider spray which I really like.  It's powerful but not overly so.My husband installed this faucet in about an hour.  He's installed a few faucets over the years and says this one wasn't harder than any of the others.  Pretty much everything was included that was needed except for a couple standard tools and things that most men will already have.I think this faucet is awesome and I would highly recommend it.  We're very pleased with it.

This collection of Zahn's work is a nice mix of sci/fi and fantasy.Good short stories are hard to write and Zahn does an admirable job of making his writing unpredictable. It's nice to be able to read a story in one sitting and like any collecton, some of his stories are better than others. For the most part though, these are "A' stories with a few "B"s mixed in. I like an anthology like this. It comes in handy at doctor's offices and before bedtime. Zahn's "Pawn's Gambit" was my favorite.

So great is Tomas’s grief at losing his mistress and their young child that he turns his back on the world and God. He symbolizes his displeasure by walking backwards. One day he finds the journal of  Father Ulisses, a Catholic priest stationed in Angola.  Father Ulisses's journal describes the cruelty of slavery and the church’s indifference to the slaves’ plight. He confronts the church hierarchy and gets excommunicated for his efforts. Disillusioned with Christianity, Ulisses carves a cross that symbolizes his feelings. Tomas becomes obsessed with finding this crucifix. He borrows his uncle’s horseless carriage and drives to the “High Mountains of Portugal.” The descriptions of his troubles with the car are hilarious and pitiful at the same time. During his trip, Tomas unwittingly runs over a young boy with the car, this deepens his sorrow. At the end of his journey Tomas comes to a startling conclusion about Christianity and so concludes the 1st part of the novel.The 2nd part of the book describes a pathologist’s conversation with his dead wife. She explains her version of Christianity as an Agatha "Christ"ie novel. Next, a mysterious woman visits the pathologist with a suitcase containing her dead husband. This is Rafael, the devout father of the boy Tomas killed.  The father neglected to keep track of his son and later found him dead in the roadway. His wife wants an autopsy performed. Her husband was so filled with self loathing and guilt that the autopsy reveals his extremities are filled with vomit. A chimpanzee is also found inside of the man. Is this intended to be the embodiment of Christ?In the final part of the book, the great nephew of Rafael moves back to the small Portugal village where Tomas killed the boy. The Canadian is accompanied by a chimp who teaches him to live in the present and enjoy just “being.” The three parts of the novel are intricately related by geography and ancestory. The reader gets to decide if they succeed in bringing about a revelation or if the novel is simply the fantastical musings of the writer.The High Mountains of Portugal is an allegorical novel that examines faith and Christianity. It is thought provoking and profound. I enjoyed the read.

I loved Anna and the Swallow Man. It's a great story, well told. As happened so many times during the Holocaust, Anna's father leaves home one day never to return. Suddenly, the people Anna once knew become distant and unwilling to help. Locked out of her apartment, she has no way to get food or shelter. In desperation, she chances upon a stranger called the Swallow Man. He takes her under his wing and together, they navigate war torn Poland and Russia trying to stay alive and away from those who would harm them. The plot moves quickly. I recieved the book one day and had it read the next.This would make a great companion book for Anne Frank and it's written for the age group that usually studies the play. It would also be a great book to teach inferences. I would recommend it for the more advanced, mature reader. I have read so many books that I tend to read with detachment, but I can imagine a young girl reading this with a sense of wonder and mystery. According to Erin Clarke. the book's senior editor, "It reveals life's hardest lessons while celebrating its miraculous possibilites." I couldn't  agree more. It would make a great book to read together with your daughter or son so that you can discuss the many themes found in this marvelous story. Reading the book was a great experience, sharing it with someone else would make it even better.

Benincasa lets it rip in DC Trip. She writes with no inhibitions or filters. This is raw Amy Schumer humor with a high school field trip setting. People familiar with Hedwig and the Angry Inch will appreciate her writing. Imagine two young chaperons who are inexperienced teachers combined with some potty-mouthed, nubile girls, two factions of which are constantly feuding, throw in some boys and you've got the basic ingredients for this novel.These terrorist sophmores end up in the White House where they drop enough "F" bombs to totally destroy the decorum of our nation's capitol. The book is replete with poddy humor, drug use, sexual explicitness, female feuds, teenage angst, and gender confusion. It is at times funny and poignant. This book is not for the conventional, staid conservative but countercultural naysayers will love it.

This is a beautiful, stylish watch. According to the band size, face circumference, and looks I also think it is designed for a man. The band was way too big for my wife and by comparing it to other Invicta watches, it is either a unisex piece or designed for a man. Any woman thinking about buying it should know that she'll have to have the band adjusted which is a pain in the sitty down.I received the watch for an honest review and I hope this information is helpful. If you put your cursor on the watch to enlarge it and like the looks of it, buy it whether you're a man or woman. The watch works well and really is a nice piece.
Brittany Howard's voice is powerful and soulful.She reminds me of Janis Joplin.

I like that the new Hefty bag's slider locks into place and the slider is easier to close than that of the Ziploc Freezer Bag. So these are good bags, but the Ziploc's plastic is thicker and the bag is sturdier than the slider. America's Test Kitchen researched storage bags and found the Ziploc to be the best, but if these are cheaper, they'll get the job done and they are easier to close.

This book couldn’t be more timely. There was a news sensation last week when a United States destroyer sailed within twelve miles of the reefs in the South China Sea. These reefs have been developed into Chinese islands with airfields and harbors. China issued grave warnings about the consequences of the so called “invasion”.  This book explains China’s outrage.In the recent Democratic presidential debate, Jim Webb, who has served as a United States Senator from Virginia, Secretary of the Navy, and an Assistant Secretary of Defense in the Reagan Administration was asked what he thought was the greatest threat to our nation and he replied, “China”. Peter Navarro’s extensively researched book, Crouching Tiger, explains why there is need for concern and what can be done to counteract China’s rise to power.The book starts by describing China’s one hundred years of humiliation. It has been invaded and exploited by many western nations, including the United Sates, and was brutally occupied by the Japanese before and during WWII. China’s militarization is a product of the distrust caused by these incursions and their desire to become a predominant world power in the Far East.The book goes on to assess China’s military capabilities, its efforts to gain American technology, and its relationships with other Asian nations. It also describes China’s efforts to gain hegemony over East Asia and renationalize Taiwan. The final part of the book explains what might trigger a war with China and what the Unites States can do to preserve the peace.Navarro is a master at condensing mountains of research into a very readable, and more importantly, understandable account of the Sino/American relationship. I received an electronic copy of the book and wasn’t going to read it until I received a hard copy, but I opened the file, read the first few lines and before I knew it had the book read. It is a fascinating look at the most populous nation in the world and one whose economy has now surpassed the GDP of the United States. It raises the question of whether or not China will now surpass us in military might and world influence.

I first put these on as I was watching television so I could  adjust the band and see if they fit. The noise reduction was so good I could barely hear the T.V. Next, I used them with my I-Pod when I went for my walk. Compared to my fairly expensive earbuds, these had a much clearer, defined sound. Finally, I compared them to my other headphones. I listened to three songs with those on and my ears hurt afterwards. Next, I tried the Sentey headphones. They are so much more comfortable. The earpieces fit around the ear better and they are better padded. The sound was substantially better also with more bass and better clarity of sound. Great sound, great price.

This is a book for those of you who are still operating under the myth that if you can just find the right person to love, you'll be happy. Both authors state that you have to learn to love yourself first before you can love others. One must stay in the moment and shed expectations to enjoy another person.Lodro explains how to approach relationships from a Buddhist perspective and Meggan uses Gnostic Christianity to explain giving and receiving love. Both of them provide valid, easy to understand concepts about relationships. The practical advice they give is sure to increase a person's self-awareness and provides a pathway to develop deeper more lasting, satisfying human relationships. Anyone still searching and interested in self-improvement will find the book helpful.

The appreciation of art such as this painting of a pug is, of course, totally subjective. The expressive eyes,vibrant colors, and the fact that I love dogs attracted me to this work of art. It added a burst of color to the wall adjacent to our kitchen. The painting is a reproduction done on 100% canvas, hand stretched on a pine frame. It was easy to hang with a push pin. I've had the piece up for over a week and it has begun to grow on me. I used it to replace a poster an aerial view of the Boise State blue football turf with orange suited players. (My wife made me take it down.) She was out of town when I hung this up and when she came home and saw the pug she wasn't pleased. I'm hoping it will grow on her. I whimpered and went belly up with my paws in the air pleading to keep the painting. (I told her it's a reminder to eat healthy.) So far it's worked. Stay tuned.

I have worn Wrangler jeans most of my life. They are sturdy, dependable, and well worth the money. I own two pair of Wrangler long leg pants that are of the same weight denim as these shorts. I've had them for a couple of years. They are comrfortable, fit well, and look good. So when Vine offered these shorts, I ordered them knowing I was getting quality for the price of a review. I'm 6'1" tall and these just cover the top of my knee cap.They are loose in the thighs and very comfortable. The length is such that you don't have to worry about getting sunburned thighs and yet they are much cooler and pleasant to wear in the summer than full length jeans. When these jeans get old and faded they'll be like wearing soft cotton flannel pants.

I saw Conner and Cayden Long's story in a television news piece, so I was intrigued to discover a book had been written by their mother. The book didn't disappoint.  "Expect A Miracle" inspires with its story of Jenny Long's struggle to find her place in the world and provide her children with the unconditonal love she received from her mother. Jenny's soul was forged in the fire of mistakes and adversity and she rises above them to become an inspiration for others, but that is just one part of the story. She gives birth to two sons, Conner her eldest, and Cayden, a special needs child with spastic cerebral palsy. Advised to institutionalize Cayden, Jenny shunned medical opinion and along with her husband, Jeff, decides to bring Cayden home and provide him with all the love and care she can muster. Along the way, she discovers what a prince her son Conner is. Conner devises a way to share a sport with his brother. The boys enter a kid's triathalon as a team and, unwittingly, they become a nationwide phenomenon. To truly appreciate their story you need to read this book. At an awards ceremony to honor the boys, a documentary was shown that described Connor's efforts to love and care for his brother. After viewing it Lebron James said, "I don't have to preach anymore. I can just show my older son what he can do for his brother." His sentiment moved me to tears.

Vengeance Road is told from the first person point of view of a young woman who is seeking revenge for the hanging and murder of her father by the Waylan Rose Gang, a notoriously vicious group of criminals who carve a rose on their victims. Kate Tompkins, the gritty female heroine, has one purpose left in life and that is to kill those who left her father hanging from a tree and stole the journal that points the way to a fortune in gold. The plot races along as Kate picks up two brothers who vow to protect her and help her in her quest.The road to vengeance is paved with shoot-outs, bar brawls, an outhouse shooting, and a race to the hidden gold that involves Apaches, the Rose Gang and a mysterious shooter thought to be a ghost. Kate's race to avenge her father brings revelations about her past and her own true nature asshe seeks to kill the brutal Waylan Rose. The quest will end all too soon as the reader races to find out what's going to happen next.The book is marketed toward young readers but I think anyone who enjoys a good western will love Vengenace Road. I's done with my review so I's bid you adieu.

The United States Constitution states that all of its citizens have the right to a fair and speedy trial and that no cruel or unusual punishment will be administered. Buser's book points out that for the poor and disenfranchised, especially blacks and Latinos, this isn't the case. Many inmates of Ryker Island end up there because they can't make bail. The court system of New York City is inundated with cases and so a Ryker's Island detainee can wait months for his or her case to be heard. By the time they do make it to court, it's often easier and wiser to plead guilty to a crime they may or might not have comitted. While they are in Ryker's they are often beaten, terrorized by other inmates, or put in solitary confinement. After weeks or months of cruel and unusual punishment, the only thing they can think of is how to get off the island. Buser does a good job of pointing out the failings of our justice system. She starts her career as someone who cares and tries to make a difference for those she comes into contact with, but budget cuts and bureaucracy wear her down and make her job impossible. Her account is written in clear, easy to read prose. It explains why there is so much upheaval in places like Ferguson and Cleveland and gives the reader a deeper understanding of some the injustices minorities face. A more in depth look at the gap between the haves and have nots in our country can be found in Matt Taibbi's book The Divide: American Injustice in the Age of the Wealth Gap

I am pleasantly surprised at how good the food I cook on this is. I made pork rib shishkebobs with fresh garden vegetables and they were fantastic! The next night I loaded the grill with boneless/skinless chicken breasts, chicken shishkebobs with vegetables, and veggie foils. Everything came out great and the skinless chicken never stuck to the grill.Clean-up is easy. The grill pops off and I put it in the sink with the female part of the plugin facing up. Most of the residue came off when I sprayed it with warm water. The rest disappeared after I used dish soap and a dish rag.The grill heats up quickly and cooks the food evenly.Amazon double packed the grill so none of the plastic parts were broken. I put it together as I watched television. It is light and can easily be carried to wherever you need it. The grill costs less than half of what I paid for my gas grill and when you add in the cost of propane, using the Foreman grill becomes even more economical. I probably won't be using the gas grill I bought last summer anymore. This is easier to use and the food tastes wonderful.

I used to buy this at WalMart several years ago until they quit carrying it. It adds flavor and spice to vegetables and is especially good in gaspacho. I've looked for it for years and then one day, for some reason, I decided to try Amazon. Lo and Behold! there it was. Thank you Amazon.com.This sauce also tastes great on soft boiled eggs mixed with pamesan cheese. It's not red hot so dont' worry about it being too spicy, it's just super flavorful.

I got this for my wife. She drives back and forth to Boise, Idaho which is 170 miles away and wanted a container she could re-use. It cuts down on buying bottled drinks and the resulting empty plastic containers.She can't tip her head back to use a regular go-cup and needed something with a straw. This is extra tall, but it fits nicely into her Subaru Outback's cup holders and holds 20 oz. of beverage. However, it's too tall for the cup holders in my Corolla (not that she would deign to ride in a 1998 Classic). The nice thing about this is that she can buy a Diet Coke, add lots of ice, and it stays cold. I also fill it with filtered water when she's home. I recommend that everyone drink only filtered water to ensure they are eliminating the carcinogens found in water sources across the country.This is BPA free, heavy duty pastic that will not leech chemicals into your water like a lot of bottled water will when exposed to the sun. For me, the bands are kinda of a gimmick, but if it helps someone drink more water that's great.

I bought this to make my "specialty" soft boiled or poached eggs. I cook the eggs until the yolk is just starting to firm and then add pamesan cheese and Frank's hot sauce. Lordy, these eggs are good and the Krups Egg Cooker makes them easier to fix, no waiting for the water to boil plus the eggs stay hot so I can make more than one serving. I'm pleased with my purchase.

This is a rat trap. If you're thinking of buying this keep that in mine. Mice are lighter than rats. If you buy this and find your bait gone with nothing caught, you're probably trying to catch a mouse with the wrong trap. We recently found a drawer with mice droppings, so I inadvertently ordered this. I've had the trap set for over a week and have had to rebait it once without having caught anything. The trap is easy to set, but it's the wrong trap for what I'm trying to catch.

Deceit describes the people and the manipulations involved in a merger between two corporations with competing technologies and the hedge fund that engineers the merger. Most of the players involved set aside their ethics and use underhanded tactics to position themselves and their businesses advantageously. Garrett Carlssen, who helped develop the technology that allows computers to read and record information from bar codes which both companies use, observes as the players from all three firms play the game of greed and corruption involved in corporate takeovers.Adelson writes his account with the insight of someone who writes of what he knows. His characters are well defined and their motivations explained. The novel includes the subplot of a relationship between Anne Mills, who works for the hedge fund, and Carlssen. She comes to regret her unethical actions as she realizes money can't buy happiness and actions have consequences. This adds spice to the story.This is a good story that lacks focus. Abdrupt changes in point of view and anecdotes that don't advanced the plot slow the novel down and make it less readable, but, all in all, I enjoyed this tale of Wall Street.

I enjoyed my romp through small town America. Cobb's writing is simple and easy to  read. He populates his story with a small town sheriff who works for the benefit of the community, young adults who drink, do drugs and carouse, and a protege Sheriff Gordon trains and hires. When a horrible accident, caused by a hit run driver, takes the life of one of the town's trouble causers while he is being arrested, the corrupt town council chairman uses the incident for political gain at the expense of the arresting officer, Ronny Forbert. The consequences divide the community and produce catastrophic results. The novel provides a snapshot of a dying town with little economic opportunity and the effect it has on young lower class citizens.For me, the flaw in the novel is the lack of develpment of Ronny Forbert. The author fails to paint the picture of someone capable of doing what he does. The novel somehow seemed incomplete and the ending was unsatisfying, but it was still well worth the read.

We were having trouble streaming Amazon or Netflix movies. Our router is on one end of the house and the T.V. is on the other. This WiFi extender solved our problems. The movies load quickly and we can even get subtitles. We get a crystal clear picture and the signal doesn't buffer nearly as often, before we couldn't even get Netflix half the time and Amazon movies were almost unwatchable. Set-up is easy as it comes with a setup disc. We're very satisfied with this product. My wife even gave me a kiss, she was so pleased to get these services back and working better than ever before.

Untwined tells of identical twins whose fingers were entwined while in the womb. The delivering doctor had to “untwine” their fingers before their mother could give birth to them. The two girls, Isabelle and Giselle, are as close as any identical twins could possibly be until a horrific car accident leaves one dead and the other in coma. As the surviving twin lies comatose she remembers their shared past.This poignant account, written in present tense, tells of their high school days and experiences with their family and friends. Danticat explores the surviving twin’s loss of her carbon copy sister, her sole mate and friend. The author’s characters are vivid, their dialogue and emotions true and the novel would be a Godsend to high school students who suffer the loss of a loved one.
The socks fit well and come to just below the ankle. They are comfortable and keep my feet from getting so hot. Good buy. Good bye.

This is a nice looking, medium weight pan of sound construction. You can fry anything you want in this pan without oil and it will not stick. I fried two 85% lean hamburgers, dumped a half can of Nalley's chili on top of them when they were done and topped the whole thing with cheese which melted to the bottom of the pan and the whole concoction  slid out of the pan without leaving anything behind. So this is a great pan for braising.The manufacturer recommends using butter or a little oil, no EVO and no cooking sprays, when you fry and to use low to medium heat. So when I tried to brown some hashbrowns, it didn't work even though I used butter and oil and turned the heat up. When I tried to fry two eggs easy over, I couldn't get under them to turn them over. I had to chase one of the eggs clear across the pan and trap it on the edge where it bunched up into a ball. So this is a great pan for cooking things  a certain way and I'm sure with a little practice I'll be flipping eggs like a short order cook. It's also reasonably priced. 9/30/2015 The more I use this pan the better I like it. I started turning the heat up higher (just past medium) and it made all the difference in the world.

The towels are attractive and I like that they are bigger than our other dish towels. They are 100% cotton and the manufacturer recommends cold water wash with like colors. If it wasn' the for the cold water wash they' d be a 5.

Wright uses the personal story of an Incan intrepreter, Waman, to describe the Spanish conquest of the Incan empire. Waman is kidnapped at sea by the conquistadors and is forced to become Pizarro's translator. Through his eyes we view the great Incan Empire with its massive fortresses, palaces, terraces and canals. Wright draws on historical accounts to paint the portrait of an accomplished civilisation both in its achievements and in the way it treats its citizens, that is, until the Spanish invade.Pizarro, inspired by the riches Cortez brought back to Spain, is financed by the Spanish crown to find and conquer this land. Spurred by greed, these "Gold Eaters", as they are referred to by the Incas, launch a brutal, ruthless, campaign to subjugate the Incas. Wright's descriptions of the atrocities committed in the name of Chritianity are vivid and bloody. His use of Waman as someone who has a foot in both cultures allows him to compare the religions and customs of both worlds in a very effective way. Wirght adds flesh to his historical account by following Waman as he lives among both the Incas and Spaniards and seeks to reunite with his childhood friend and mother.I'm a big historical fiction fan and while Gold Eaters isn't a fast moving barn buster, it is a novel that explores the Spanish conquest of the Incan Empire in a profound and historically acurrate way. Wright would have had to immerse himself in the history of Peru for years to write such a descriptive account of the customs and daily life of the Incas and I applaud his effort.

Zero World takes you on a roller coaster ride of action and intrigue. Imagine a spy whose memory is cleared after each mission, who has no remorse, whose sole purpose is to complete his mission, who has an implant that enhances his physical and mental capacities and you have the perfect recipe for an assasin called Peter Caswell. After each mission his memory is reset and he is sent on another mission. These missions have a time limit and Caswell always kills his target on schedule until one day he fails. This failure leads him on a journey of discovery that ultimately causes him to seek the truth about who is and who he is working for and what their purpose is.This is a fast paced thriller that keeps the reader turning pages until the last word. It's more James Bond than I-Robot and I very much enjoyed the read.

A year or two after Holes came out I was teaching an advanced L.A. class (8th grade) and I asked how many hadn't read the book and 2/3 of them raised their hand. When I asked why, they said their teachers wouldn't let them because it was below their reading level. With a little wrangling, I managed to get a classoom set and we tried to read the book together. A few of them took the book home and read it that night and all of them loved it.Fuzzy Mud is also a good read. I particularly like the way Sachar explores the exponential increase of living organisms and the stress it puts on the environment. Sachar plants the seeds of knowledge in a good story about bullying and peer pressure. The story succeeds. This is an easy to read book with great themes and I highly reccomend it. Sachar's novels appeal to both avid and reluctant young readers and, if I could, I'd give him a pass straight to heaven.

Survive the Night is written for someone with a child-like understanding of the world but contains adult themes of drug use, sex, and murder so I’m not sure who the audience for this book would be. The author fails to establish a believability that would appeal to a more mature audience because it fails to develop a logical, coherent story which leads me to believe it must be written for junior high or high school kids.A group of six teenagers finds its way to a party in the New York subway where no one can leave until the next day.  A free spirit named Shana slips her best friend, Casey, some type of drug. When Casey gets separated from the everyone and finds another member of the group gutted and dead, she goes back and tells the rest of their friends and they embark on a search. Finding nothing they assume Casey is hallucinating. The group ends up hopelessly lost in a labyrinth of tunnels where a tentacled creature kills one after another of them after they do one stupid thing after another to escape, kind of like the Geico commercial with the chain saws.The book is written in present tense, first person, I’m assuming to make the reader wander if Casey was hallucinating or if all the fantastic events really happened. The writing is good enough to keep you reading, but again, when you find out Casey was given Ecstasy which, to the best of my knowledge, doesn’t cause hallucinations, the author loses her last shred of credibility. This book reminded me of a teenager writing for other teenagers and the hospital scene at the end of the book had me rolling my eyes.

Minor's Stir Fry sauce has a nice balance of sweet and heat. I poured a cup of it over four quarts of stir fried vegetables and chicken and found the stir fry tasty. It's kind of like a hamburger helper for vegetables and I'm thinking it might help families get their children to eat veggies. I used wild asparagus, a red pepper, snow peas, carrots, celery, and a white onion in mine with sauteed chicken and served it over noodles. The sauce can also be used as a marinade or a basting sauce.At 71 oz. there is enough sauce to feed an army which means there's going to be a lot left over after your initial use. If this doesn't keep in the refirgerator, I wouldn't buy it unless you have an army of people to feed. Finally, while I like it, I wouldn't want to eat it more than once or twice a month.

Fasta Pasta takes the work out of cooking pasta. Since I bought it, I eat more pasta and less meat which is a good thing. The noodles come out aldente everytime and you don't have to wait for the water to boil. Also, it is super easy to wash and anyone who can read directions can cook perfect pasta pronto.
Whitey Morgan goes Honky Tonkin' on this album. His voice and the driving rhythm are sure to get your blood pumping as he sings some old country classics.

Imagine being on an extremely advanced spaceship regulated almost totally by a computer that you helped design. Now imagine being infiltrated by another spaceship whose mercenaries have introduced a virus that messes up said computer so that it doesn't function properly but seemingly has a mind of its own. This is the premise of Lightless. The computer scientist, Althea, has a natural bond with Ananke, the computer she was instrumental in creating. The "System", a ruthless interstellar government that will destroy anything and anyone who dares defy it, has manned the ship with three people, including Althea, who are blindly loyal to the System. The infiltrators, who are working for  those who want to overthrow the System's government, unwittingly  use a program that changes the Ananke in a profound way so that they can use the ship for their own purposes. Althea's efforts to fix her computer so that the surveilance cameras and life support systems work properly prove fruitless and her frustrations mount. When one of the infiltrators is caught, an "investigator" is sent to unravel the intrigue and the reader observes as the plot twists and turns until it reaches its ultimate conclusion. The read is quick and over too soon.Lightless is an exploration of Artificial Intelligence and the ramifications of intelligence without compassion or ethics.  It helped me understand Steven Hawking's concern about making a machine sentient. I applaud C.A. Higgins for an extremely enjoyable, thought-provoking read. If you like this book check out the movie, "Ex Machina" now playing in the theaters. The themes are very similar.

Set in a broken world where life is fraught with danger, Adam Stone has only one way out. If he wins the Black Water Trail Race, he gets a one way ticket to Sky Base where living is easy and luxurious. Before the race he hooks up with Kane an enigmatic biker, who disappears at random, and Sadie, a girl he loves. When Levi Blood kills Adam's brother and destroys his home, he has no choice but to enter the race, a mad motocross dirt bike race with booby traps and wicked jumps, a race where contestants use sling shots to kill other contestants. Many start but few finish this dangerous course of madness and all three main characters enter the race that only one can win.Hofmeyr keeps the plot moving so fast with his lean prose and exiting plot elements that the reader hits the finish line wishing he or she had written the book. This is movie material folks and I'll be the first one in line when it debuts. If you've ever read the Alex Ryder Novels, Stormbreaker (Alex Rider), this is as action packed and exciting. Think Mad Max and his world of insanity, populate it with three people you care about and then read like the wind to see what happens and you'll experience why reading a good novel is so awesome.

Virtues Of War is a Star Wars, action packed, space battle novel. Terra comes under attack when the Centauri colonies rebel. The novel centers on three characters as they are thrown together by the war. Coles develops their personalities well and science takes a backseat to action as the fleets of spaceships bombard each other. Just when Earth is most threatened, the trio plays a key role in the Expeditionary Force's efforts to quell the rebellion. The reader is propelled forward as the very existence of our main characters and Earth itself is threatened.While I enjoyed the book, it would have been better if I knew why the Centauris were rebelling. Usually a rebellion involves mistreatment by the imperial government and I had to hope I wasn't rooting for the wrong side. Also, Coles used too many acronyms. Their use impeded the flow of the writing. A reader would enhance their experience by listing each acronym and what it stands for on a book marker for a quick reference. While these minor flaws detracted from the book's quality, it was still an enjoyable read and I'm sure most sci/fi fans will enjoy the book.

The writing In the Language of Miracles flows like warm honey. I was reading a military science fiction novel when this came. I read the first few pages of Miracles and the writing and the story drew me in like a good book should. Rajia Hassib tells the story of an Egyptian family whose son has committed an unforgivable crime. Because they are Muslim, the whole family is blamed and vilified through social media and the two children are shunned at school. Their lives are put on hold as they seek to deal with a horrible tragedy that has alienated them from a community that already viewed them as suspect. The family is torn apart as the blame and guilt often causes the family members to turn on each other.Hassib's story is not only a study in character but also in culture. Each chapter starts with a quote from the western world and a corresponding quote from the middle eastern or Arabic culture. By showing how Arabic and Western beliefs are similar and developing empathy for her Egyptian characters as they deal with the hate and rejection of the community, Hassib demonstrates how we are more alike than we are different. I very much enjoyed the book as it explored scapegoating the family for a brutal act committed by one of its members.

Iceberg Slim is the result of ten years of research and interviews by Justin Gifford, PhD., an associate professor of English literature at the University of Nevada.  The book is far more than a biography of Robert Beck, a pimp, who operated in the 1940s and `50s. It is also a historical and sociological examination of black culture and countercultural from the 1900s until the Watts riots of the early 90s. As such, it helps explain contemporary black minority culture as it relates to the dominate white institutions of government and law enforcement. According to Gifford, by 1990 one quarter of all young black men were in prison, on parole, or under surveillance by the justice system and almost half of the prison population was black. Opportunities to make a living were few outside the sex trade or drugs. These circumstances closely parallel the plight of today's inner city blacks. According to Time magazine, in Baltimore "one in four juveniles was arrested from 2005 to 2009."Thus it was that Beck's role models in his formative years were the black males who dressed well and drove nice cars. These were the pimps, bootleggers and drug dealers. Beck says that he was "street poisoned" by the promise of easy money and sex. In and out of prison, he interviewed other pimps to learn his trade. When he ends up in Leavenworth Prison, Beck reads voraciously and was heavily influenced by Karl Menninger's The Human Mind and the idea that "the absence of parental affection accounted for much criminal behavior." His knowledge of psychology increased his skills at manipulating women into prostitution and he becomes a highly successful pimp. Eventually a reoccurring dream about his mother and his guilty conscience convince him to quit the trade.Eventually, Beck becomes a writer and gains fame and adulation by writing his most famous work `Pimp", a work widely read by the black counterculture but mostly ignored by Caucasians. He dies during the Watts riots of 1992 hoping that the black revolution had finally begun.Iceberg Slim explains Robert Beck in the context of the historical times in which he lived. Reading the book gave me a deeper understanding of today's race relations. In a 1967 speech, Martin Luther King Jr. pointed out that America is facing a triple threat of racism, poverty, and militarism. In a Time editorial written last week, Tavis Smiley asserts that these problems still threaten our democracy. He says, "Protest and riots-uprisings- could become the new normal," if these issues aren't addressed. Gifford's book shows us how a society produces an "Iceberg Slim" and reminds us that many inner city blacks have suffered for decades under the yoke of poverty, lack of opportunity, and injustice.This book has explicit language and content that some might find offensive, but it is an honest, no holds barred account of Robert Beck's life.

Keret writes in the tradition of Jewish humorists like Isaac Bashevis Singer who once famously said, "Life is God's novel let him write it." While Keret has a more secular, modern point of view, his stories and humor are decidedly Jewish. The Seven Good Years is a collection of humorous anecdotes that centers on the first seven years of his son's life. The book makes for a light read that is at times funny and at times insightful. It would make a great companion for a plane trip or a wait at the hospital. My favorite part is when he is demoted to a yoga class of pregnant women. After they all give birth and the class ends while he still looks pregnant, he ends up taking a pilates class for exercise. Now that's inspiring.

In the Nazi's heinous attempt to eradicate European Jews, they invaded Poland and herded Polish Jews from around the country into the Warsaw Ghetto. This book follows Aron and his family as they are herded, like cattle to the slaughter, into the Ghetto. Only they are not slaughtered, that would have been too merciful, rather they are forced to starve, to scrounge for food and water, to watch their fellow Jews be beaten and shot on the whim of their Nazi persecutors. They are forced to watch brothers, sisters, mothers and fathers die or be killed. Jim Shepard's book is an accurate portrayal of this brutish, hellish barbarism.The story is told through the eyes of Aron, a small child who doesn't fully grasp what is happening. He and his friends become smugglers to bring food and goods to the Ghetto for trade and barter helping their families survive. Aron is forced to make several Sophie Choices, something no child should have to do. After his mother dies, he ends up in an orphanage run by Janusz Korczak. This allows Jim Shepard to detail the heroic efforts of Korczak to care for and love more children than is humanly possible. It also enables him to put Korczak's Declaration of Children's Rights before the reader's eyes.Telling the story through the eyes of an innocent gives the story a poignancy that tears at the reader's heart. Aron loves his family and friends, but sometimes his decisions cause their deaths and I wanted to pull him out of the novel and hug him and tell him it wasn't his fault. The book engages the reader from beginning to end as Nazi inhumanity attempts to destroy Jewish humanity.For further reading, after your heart heals, one of the best books I've read about the Warsaw Ghetto is Lucy Davidowicz's The War Against the Jews: 1933-1945.

Breakout is a smooth, easy read sure to appeal to middle schoolers. Having taught 8th grade for fifteen years I found his portrayal of Anthony and the issues that the book centers around to be realistic. When a member of his band gets suspended he gets mad. He then takes his anger out on a language teacher who's trying to get him to do an assignment. Teens, especially 8th graders are teeming with displaced anger.He finally finds an outlet for his anger by writing a song with the "F" word in it. His friend posts it on the internet and it goes viral. Anthony then has to deal with the consequences of his new found fame both at school and at home. The book's themes include peer pressure, community standards, expressing anger in a socially accepted way, and empathy.The author's handling of the issues is both tasteful and well-done. He captures the feeling that teens sometimes have that the next school dance or sleep over, or in this case playing in a concert is the most important thing in the world and if they don't get their way that world will end. They can be both willful and short-sighted and Kevin Emerson's story captures that angst.

Sometimes a song will come on my I-pod and I'll ask to myself who is this? It's good music. Invariably it is a song from this album, one I haven't heard in years. This is a great album and represents War well. Well worth the price.
Love Annie Lennox. Love this song.

Having gone through a bout of depression in college, I could very much relate to Styron's anguish. His book is an admirable depiction of the affliction. The one thing that helped me more than the antidepressants and counseling was daily exercise (running). For further reading try Scott Stossel's My Age of Anxiety: Fear, Hope, Dread, and the Search for Peace of Mind.

I very much enjoyed reading The Temple of Light. The novel has several interesting story strands that center on Niccolo, the rightful heir of the Duke of Milan. Since he is young and vulnerable, and those vying for power would think nothing of killing him, he is kept hidden by a secret society of Celtic priests who have infiltrated the Catholic Church. As the years pass, he bears witness to court intrigues and murders and the priests’ efforts to build a temple to bring man closer to God. He also becomes involved in alchemy and the secret rites of the druids.  Piazza adds spice to the novel by having Niccolo fall in love with Angelica. Their love is forbidden since he is noble and expected to rule while she is a commoner. He also befriends an assassin and his sister which gives even greater insights into the machinations of the aristocracy especially when the Inquisition is involved.  This complex novel gives a snapshot of life during the 15th century and displays Piazza’s knowledge of Italian history, so much so that at times I found myself lost among the myriad of names and the relationships between the characters. If the novel were better edited by taking out all those characters that are not absolutely essential to the story, I think it has best seller potential.

It's the Stones. These are some of their best songs remastered. If you need to read a review of their music, life has passed you by or you're very young, in which case, buy this album to hear some real rock n' roll.

Martha Stewart demonstrated a super easy recipe on her show last weekend. She grated a wedge of Parmesan cheese, added a stick of softened butter and blended them together in a mixer. After her noodles were cooked to aldente consistency, she drained them and reserved a cup of the water. She then stirred into the noodles the butter/Parmesan mixture and added back some of the cooking water until the noodles were covered in the sauce.I ordered these noodles with the express purpose of trying this recipe. It was comfort food at its finest.These noodles cooked perfectly and they were so good that I forsook a really tasty pork roast so I could pork out on the fettuccine. Seriously, if anyone happens to read this, try the recipe. You'll love it!

After I watched the movie with Anthony Hopkins, I had to read the book. I found The Rite to be thought provoking to say the least. It contains many credible accounts of possessions and exorcisms. The book provides an in depth and fascinating look at the why and how of exorcisms.Anyone interested in theology or the occult will find the book interesting. Many might even find their faith in the church strengthened by the book. After my own read, I find myself contemplating several questions.  If there are demons and they can truly can possess a human being, why is possession more frequent among Catholics than other religions? Why is demonic possession ( in Western industrialized countries) found almost exclusively among true believers of the Christian faith? Is a demon simply the embodiment of evil that forms an entity in a person's mind?Can the phenomenon described in the book be explained through science or psychology? Why does Rome seem the be the epicenter of possession?Reading The Rite brought back memories of a book I read in the 80s about the Church of Satan. Prior to writing this review, I read the reviews For Michelle RemembersMichelle remembers; the True Story of a Year-long Contest Between Innocence and Evil. Most of the reviewers think the account is a fraud, but I think it was one of the scariest books I've ever read. I bring the book up because it might be of interest to those of you who enjoyed this one. I loaned my first copy to a Lutheran minister who had a nervous breakdown not long afterward. He never returned the book and I haven't seen him since.

I enjoyed this book from beginning to end. It recounts a timeless struggle between father and son. Sam Keen, the father, is an overbearing parent who tells instead of shows. Gifford is the proverbial rebellious child, deeply hurt and angered by his father's abandonment through divorce and circumstances. Now as grown-ups, they try to reconcile by sharing their views and perceptions of the past. Writing this book together gave both a deeper understanding of the other and the reader also gains a deeper understanding of their own familial relationships.The book is both poignant and fascinating and the writing is superb. In fact, the prose flows like a fine and delicious wine flavored with rich content.

Revlon Love is On Eau De Toilett. "Loved by Women, Irresistible to Men"?Don't get me started on the bottle itself.  It took me about a minute to figure out how to open it.The scent is interesting, and it seems to be an interesting combination of scents, both from feminine perfumes AND masculine colognes.  Perhaps that is why it is "Loved by Women, Irresistible to Men"?

I swim 4000-8000 yards a week, and depend on my goggles to be hassle free.  At first, these Cressi Flash Adult Swim Goggles were awkward to adjust... I was getting some water infiltration every lap.  But I finally found the right combination... not leaking, and not too tight.  So don't give up on them too quickly.The funny thing is, I'm finding myself occasionally hitting the mini-buckles with my arm when I flip.  I didn't know my arm came so close to my head.  They do stick out a bit (the buckles, not my arms).

These gloves are well made, and the knit wrist area is tight and long enough to prevent dirt or snow from entering your glove.  My large gloves fit appropriately in length, but it is designed for fingers that are pudgier than mine... there's extra space that my hands have to heat up.  On the other hand, there is enough room for me to wear a glove liner.The product? Dickies D89331 Creme-Colored Grain Pigskin Leather Palm Glove with Extended Knit Wrist

These Wdvalle Cycling Men's Biking Gloves do the job.  The job?  Protecting your palms during a fall or crash.  Providing padding for extended rides when palms can become sore.  Provide an extra level of visibility when using your hands to signal a turn.  And a bonus is the soft, absorbent material for wiping the dripping nose!Here's my caution.  There are a lot of "parts" for these gloves, with a lot of sewed seams.  The more seams, the greater the opportunity for a seam to fail.  My experience?  I ride my bike for recreation and commuting about 50 hours every year (yes, I keep track of time, not miles).Disclaimer:  I received a free sample of this product in return for an unbiased review.

This knit beanie with a tassel is made of an acrylic yarn constructed in a loose weave.  It will not fit tight against your head, but has a great deal of stretch to cover your hair. At first, I thought the loose weave was a criticism, but instead it gives the beanie a light "footprint" on your head.  In other words, you'll forget that you are even wearing a beanie!  And attractive to boot!Disclaimer: I did receive a free sample of this product in return for an unbiased review.

I've been using this recharger everyday for the past 9 days, for both a phone and for a tablet.  I've had no problems, but I have to admit that I am freaked by some of the other reviews that indicate a high failure rate.  Really?  I'm taking this on a trip to Peru and it could fail?The packaging lists numerous countries that these adaptor tips will work in:"The six tips correspond with the six most used power formats across the globe. The first tip is compatible with outlets in the United Kingdom, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Malaysia. The second works in continental Europe, the Middle East, Indonesia, India, Brazil, and Chile. The third allows you to power up in North America, Japan, Taiwan, Thailand, and the Philippines. The fourth and fifth are exclusively for China and South Korea, respectively. And the sixth plug can be used in Australia, New Zealand, and Argentina."But... I'm going to Peru!  Well, this should work, but why are some countries listed while others are not?I'm wondering how much I should trust this unit. I want to, but a traveler has to depend on the equipment in the suitcase.  I leave in a month, and I will continue to use this everyday until then.  More when I have additional data!

These Sterling Silver Oval-Shaped Jade and Diamond Stud Earrings clearly are striking!  They are large without being heavy on the ears.  And did anyone notice the resemblance to a turtle?  To a sea turtle enthusiast, this is a plus!I would have liked some of the "natural" lines and shade variations that you see in untreated jade.  Without them, this piece looks more "fake" than I would like.  As for the diamonds, they are small (natch... see price), and they are supposed to be in compliance "with the Kimberley Process to ensure that their diamonds are conflict free." How do you ever know? The 6 stones total 0.06 carats.The matching necklace would be a good complement: Sterling Silver Oval-Shaped Jade and Diamond Pendant Necklace, 18"

The Good: The design pattern is pretty and seasonal.  It's got a nice shine, and is a good size. The weight is pretty light, so it's easy to move around.The Bad: The sticker on the back is awful to pull off. I had to scrape away at it just so that it wouldn't show through the spaces on the top. The stubs are only on 3 of the 6 points - it's stable if you are very careful about placing an item directly on the center, but if you nudge it even a bit to the side the whole thing tips! And as it's about a half inch above the table, anything on top would certainly spill. The stubs are also not very attractive looking - they are black rubber and look cheap.Bottom Line: It's a great holiday decoration, and nice for holding something you're not worried about spilling (like the butter). But I wouldn't plan on using it to balance the Christmas cranberry sauce!

The Good: The size is great - it's really elegant looking and not overpowering as a pendant. There's a nice balance between the white sapphires around the border and the blue sapphire in the middle, and the blue color is very bright! All are extremely sparkly and catch and reflect light. It's also very lightweight, which is great for an event piece (won't pull on your neck as the night goes on).The Bad: The clasp could be a little nicer looking. But that's nitpicking.Bottom Line: It's lovely!

Dishtowels?  These DII 100% Cotton, Machine Washable Oversized, Everyday Kitchen Basic Printed Damask Kitchen Dishtowels (Nautical Blue) are thin and oversized.  Okay, okay, they are designed to BE oversized, but that makes them seem more useful as table runners.  So it is an interesting tradeoff... thicker and smaller cotton dishtowels, or thinner and larger dishtowels? What's your preference?
So the cat swallows these small tablets whole... and this is supposed to work as a cat breath mint?  I don't think so.

I don't use no-show socks for long trail runs or road runs of 10 miles or longer.  I like to have my ankles covered.  However, I use no-show socks exclusively in the gym, on a treadmill, for shorter runs, and for just kicking around.  I am liking these socks!  I especially like the "pull-on heel tab," not for pulling in on, but for reducing the chance that the back of the sock will slip down, letting your shoe rub against your heel.

I don't have long hair, but after 2000 yards in a chlorinated pool, I am surprised that this Zealios swim shampoo leaves my hair with tangles, tangles that I don't have with other shampoos.  It is really obvious.

This is probably my 8th or 9th mini bike pump, covering a variety of manufacturers. This Kitbest Aluminum Alloy Mini Portable Bike Pump will not replace any of the ones I currently use.  I like that it has holes for both Presta and Schrader values, but the plastic pump shaft, the thin plastic handle, and the bulk compared to other pumps, all add to make this one less desirable.If you depend on your pump, make sure you get a dependable pump.  My fav?  For Presta valves, Blackburn Airstik 2 Stage Pump.I received a free sample of this product in return for an unbiased review.

This necklace was larger and brighter than expected.  That's always a good start!  I have Beaux Bijoux created opal earrings and finger rings.  This Tree of Life Sterling blue opal pendant is on a very light 18" chain, but is about the size of a quarter.  The blue opal is brilliant, and matches the rings and earrings exactly.

Even the CDC refers to it as "the obesity epidemic."  Clearly, obesity is a major health issue in the US.  In The Evolution of Obesity, by M. Power and J. Schulkin, you will learn about the whys and hows of fat storage in the human species (and in many other animals, I might add).Here's a taste of what to expect:"In the case of human obesity, we did not evolve under conditions of high food availability and little required exertion. We evolved as a species that had to work hard for its food" (p. 97)."Many people think they are more active than actual measurement reveals" (p. 122)."...although we eat food, what we actually need are nutrients" (p. 229)."Obesity isn't excess weight; it is excess adipose tissue" (p. 244)"Just consider for a moment the  expectations you would have it an animal's liver or adrenal gland doubled in size.  That would have metabolic and health consequences.  Obesity is an increase in adipose tissue well beyond the functional range that was typically experienced in the past.  The secretions from adipose will likely be  out of balance with the other organ systems" (p. 247)."We propose that modern obesity can be explained as evolutionary adaptive (or neutral) responses that in the modern environment result in maladaptive physiological responses. We further propose that many of the differences between men and women in the propensity to obesity and the associated health consequences are reflections of the different  adaptive pressures that have shaped male and female biology" (p. 265-266)."We evolved as an active species; we are not sessile creatures. Physical activity was a part of our ancestors' lifestyle for millions of years" (p. 326-327).This was an academic review of an important and timely topic... the extraordinary capture of energy in the form of excess adipose tissue in humans, the health consequences of this capture.

The idea of this heated wrap is much better than how this Serta Cuddler Electric Heated Wrap with Pockets actually works.  First, the photos show the wrap with pockets on the outside.  However, there's a HUGE label (greater than 5" by 5") on the - inside? outside? - of the wrap, on the same side as the pockets.  So, if you are wearing it with the pockets out, there's a very unattractive label on your shoulder.  Turn it the other way, with the pockets inside, and the feel of the soft fabric is affected by... the huge label!  It's hard to tell which way is which even by looking at the seams.Okay, back to the idea of the wrap.  Who doesn't want to be warm, right?  But the heating elements are concentrated in the BACK of the wrap, meaning that when you are sitting, the heating elements are pressed against your back.  Your back is HOT, while your front is... not. It is a weird feeling!  I wanted to pull the wrap more tightly around me so that my front could get some of the heat from the heating elements.  And as a shaw, the cord just gets in the way, or you forget it is plugged in when you get up...The design was just awkward, through and through.

Pros: Totally adorable and well made. Extra silly when you replace the "Vader" eyes with the confused/spinning pair! Easy to put together just from the image on the case.Cons: Almost all of the "extra" pieces fit inside the tater, except for the mustache! If it were just a bit smaller, all the supplemental pieces could fit inside the body itself, eliminating the need to keep the carrying case (although it is nicely built).Overall: It'll make you chuckle every time you glimpse it.

As for any sunscreen, the effects are really judged when the product fails! The weather conditions as I use this product are not associated with high levels of sun exposure. Regardless, this product is a sunscreen spray with multiple active ingredients.  It goes on white, but the whiteness disappears after 10-15 seconds of rubbing it in.  The whiteness helps in making sure you see what is covered and what is not.  The odor is slight, and typical of most sunscreens.  There is an initial greasy/oily feeling, but it goes away.I tried treating one hand and not the other to see whether there were visible effects simply from the active and inactive ingredients... no effects were obvious.

This collectable Lenox Holiday 2015 Toy Soldier Accent Plate is very attractive, with a clever nutcracker figure in the center of the plate, the "2015" date, and a gold edging.  It should make a nice gift for the person in your life that collects such things.

These kitchen washcloths were not as "robust" as I expected.  The cloth portion is very thin, and the mesh portion allows food to be trapped between the mesh and the cloth.My biggest concern is that a white washcloth shows stains, particularly red tomato stains. So these are attractive when new, but their looks diminish quickly.

Idealia Life Serum has a non-greasy feel, and it absorbs easily and quickly into the skin.  There's only a slight odor.  The quantity for a cream, used regularly, is not great.Does it give you visible results?  Not for me.

These Ammex APFN Blue Nitrile Gloves (Latex Free, Disposable, Powder Free) are designed for medical exams.  The lack of powder means that they can be harder to put on, particularly if your hands are damp (in other words, make sure they are dried after washing). There are 100 gloves here (50 pair).  These gloves have more coverage over the wrist than most models, so if you are resting your hand on a patient, your wrist won't come into contact with their skin.

These Ammex AAMV Anti-Microbial Vinyl Gloves (Latex Free, Disposable, Powder Free) come in a box of 200 gloves (many gloves come in a box of 100, so check).  As vinyl gloves, they are not near as "stretchy" as latex gloves.  I would normally wear a M or L glove, but I know that I can stretch a S to fit me if needed.  For these vinyl gloves, don't expect the stretch.  With that said, they seem to give me a better "feel" of the material I am holding than other gloves.  That's a plus.  As far as the anti-microbial material, never depend on this to protect you!  Double your gloves if necessary, use hand sanitizer, and wash your hands.

This book, The Professional Guide To Urban Wildlife Removal, is a useful and accurate guide to the DIY oriented person, as well as the person wanting to engage the services of a NWCO (nuisance wildlife control operator).  DIY?  Author David Vyse gives pretty thorough instructions on how to identify and locate the culprit, and then how to get remove the animal or get the animal to remove itself (and babies).  Finally, Vyse discusses the minor construction tips needed to prevent future damage.I like the contents of this book, but it is rather limited on the species covered (raccoons, skunks, squirrels, "birds," bats, and mice).  As a 50 page book, it seems pricey.  However, have you looked at the prices for hiring a NWCO?By the way, hiring a professional is indicated if a bat is located in a room that a child or adult has or had been sleeping in, if there are significant waste deposits, if considerable ladder work is required, or if you think you might have left an animal inside your house after repairs. It's expensive, but you need to make sure the problem isn't worse because of your efforts.

I've not been happy with the numerous travel razors I've tried over the years.  They are too loud, cut too poorly, hard to clean, or battery hogs.So far, I'm liking this Panasonic ES4815S Pro Curve Compact Mens Shaver With Double Blades.The positives:  It's not as loud as some (less chance of waking up your roomie).  It feels good in your hand, and leaves you with a close shave (although not near as close as my Norelco SensoTouch 3D).  I don't shave in the shower, so I really don't use the "wet/dry" feature, although the O-ring and cinching mechanism sealing the battery compartment seems robust.The negatives: It's a narrow cutting field, so it takes longer to shave (it is a traveling razor, after all).  I didn't feel that the shave was particularly good over the angular parts of the face (edge of jaw, chin).  You have to keep working at these areas.  There is no trimmer, not a brush, as some travel razors have.I'll write more when I get a sense of how long the batteries (2-AA, not included) last.

Pros: For this Star Wars-themed Crayola Light Up Tracing Pad, the platform itself works very well. After adding in the three required AA batteries, the light is very bright and even. The colored pencils and markers are only half size (a few inches), but good quality. There are two sets of activities - using the markers to color in the plastic sheet designs, and using the pencils to trace character images onto new sheets. There are a variety of designs - a couple of large backgrounds, an image of each major character, a few ships.Cons: Some of the images aren't set up well for tracing. They're either overly detailed or have huge black areas that take forever to fill in. It would be better to have simpler backgrounds that could be more easily worked behind the many great character images. Also, some of the images seem a little repetitive - how many clone/dark side helmets in different sizes do we need?Including a pencil sharpener would have been a nice touch. Also, the battery case screws are unnecessarily tiny, so have a small screwdriver on hand!Bottom Line: It's a great, fun toy that could use a little tweaking. Use the platform, and supplement the tracing with other images.

This Aoneky Bearing Jump Rope does what is promised.  Although the promotional literature notes that it works for individuals as tall as 5.9 feet, a 6 footer can use it easily.  You can adjust the cord length for your height, but if you trim the cord, taller people won't be able to use it.The handles are deliciously comfortable!  It is very light, and if used outside, the cord won't absorb moisture or collect dirt (it's a plastic material). I cannot vouch as to the longevity of the cord if used on an abrasive substrate, such as a concrete sidewalk, however.This product was sent to me, free, for an unbiased review.

Out of the box, these 18k Yellow Gold-Plated Sterling Silver and Genuine Madeira Citrine Elongated Drop Earrings are attractive and bright.  On the ears, they are LIGHT!  The slightest shake of the head has these earrings moving, like aspen tree leaves in the wind.

This is a preliminary review, as I need to take this camera (Samsung Electronics EC-DV180FBPWUS Dual View Wireless Smart Camera) through its paces under a variety of conditions.  Initially, I was irritated at once.  The camera did not come with a memory card!  What?  So I had to wait for a few days to order one (I chose a Samsung 32GB EVO Class 10 Micro SDHC ).  Installation of the card, and initial set up of the camera was intuitive and easy.Selfies are the talk of the town, and digital cameras have to compete against smart phones.  So this camera has two LCDs, "a 2.7-inch screen in the back and a 1.5-inch screen on the front."  And guess what? Transfer cables are not necessary, since the camera has built in wireless connectivity.So my future tests will include both indoor and outdoor photos, and traveling with the camera.  No case was provided, by the way.

Do you ever feel bad that you are taking a perfectly good plastic bag and trashing it... full of trash?  I really like the idea of reusing other, older plastic bags, but those flimsy shopping bags don't fit my tall kitchen trash container.So along comes Hefty's Recycled Plastic Tall Kitchen Drawstring Bags, with 65% recycled plastic. I wish Hefty would be clear as to the source of this plastic... is it post-consumer waste?  Which recycled plastics are being used?  #2? A mixture of plastics?These are gray in color (I assume reflecting the multicolored recycled plastics).  But they seem as strong and as useful as the traditional Hefty bags.  And I do love the drawstrings!

These are attractive earrings, but they ended up being much heavier than I expected.  If you are used to lighter earrings, it may be an unpleasant/uncomfortable experience.The earrings look very different from front to back, with the stones located on the front.  See photo.

I use a powered chlorine for my spa.  In this regard, that product seems very similar to these Clorox Control Bleach Crystals (I don't use either for laundry... trust issues).The powder dissolves slowly in cold water, and when used appropriately, there is a faint chlorine smell that lingers around your sink or toilet.As advertised, you'll worry less about splashing or spillage with powders as opposed to liquid bleach.  However, there is an awkwardness when you remove the lid.  When new, there may be some granules lodged in the threads... be careful that you open it over the sink to keep these particles from falling on the floor.
Nice work gloves when you want to keep those hands clean.  You know how "small" gloves still fit larger hands because they stretch?  These don't stretch as much, so "small" means "small."

These Peltor Sport SecureFit Eye Protection eyeglasses are very, very light, with a uniquely shaped frame that hugs your head without giving you a headache.  Shake that head... you will not dislodge these glasses.This set comes in three tints: clear, yellow, and gray.  They are shatter resistant, not unbreakable.  Although sold as a shooting/hunting aid, they really will work whenever a light eye protection is needed.  They will not fit over existing glasses.
Not the thickest cotton tee, but this was a good price for a shirt with an approved NFL logo.  It still fit after the first wash (always a good sign!).

These Ammex GPNB GlovePlus Black Nitrile Glove ("Latex Free, Disposable, Powder Free, Medium") have just been put through the test, planting 9 potted plants (see photo).  Rocks, twigs, and dirt.  No holes in the gloves with some 100+ actions with the trowel.  Rinsed them off, and looked good as new.My hands aren't covered with powder either!

I like self-winding watches.  No batteries, no winding... what's not to like!  This Lucien Piccard Men's Paragon Analog Display Automatic Self Wind watch is huge!  You've got to have a large enough arm/wrist that the watch rides appropriately on your arm.And has anyone ever asked you for the time, and you held out your arm for them to see?  It's not going to happen with this watch... the numbers and  hands just don't jump out at you.  With that said, it is attractive, and will engage people seeing it for the first time.  "Is that a watch?"Looks more expensive than it is.

These Hefty Tall Kitchen Bags are what you would, and should, expect from Hefty.  Even with a bag with some heft to it (pun intended), you shouldn't expect this bag to rip open and dump garbage on the floor as you are carrying it outside.The new thing for me here is the "odor block" feature.  These bags have a very faint scent of apple (I'd say green apple).  It's not overpowering, and I really doubt that it's going to hide the smell of overripe fish, sour beer, or rotten potatoes.  However, as I open the door to the trash can, it is a scent that is pleasant.

I don't care for the high fructose corn syrup, nor the abundance of sodium, but I have to admit that this Clamato juice is tasty and spicy!  You can't help but notice the richness of the complex flavors.  Yummy!

These heavy duty Ammex ILHD Gloveworks Heavy Duty Latex Gloves are thicker than the "ordinary" latex gloves, although they fit both a small and a large (slim) hand. Powder free, they come in a box of 100 (by weight, not actual count).  If you've ever used the ordinary latex gloves in the garden (digging, shovel use, planting) you know those gloves will fall apart rapidly (my hands break out when exposed to fine dust and dirt).  These last until the project is over.  Nice!

These Ammex XNPF Xtreme Blue Nitrile Gloves are for non-medical uses.  Mine are large, and they fit appropriately for a large glove.  They come powder free, and may not number exactly 100, since they are "100 by weight."  So that's about 50 pair.I use them for working on bicycles and in the garden.  They last much longer than the classic latex gloves... you'll probably toss them because they are sweaty inside instead of because they have holes.

I lived in California's oak woodlands for 10 years, and even today I have a bottle of blue and valley oak acorns sitting in my office... a "gift" from acorn woodpeckers attempting to fill a barn (read about them in this book).  I watched California ground squirrels, made hundreds of nest boxes for western bluebirds, and collected unique oak galls.I really spent time trying to understand the oak woodlands.  And this book, Secrets of the Oak Woodlands, did a good job in capturing many of the nuances of the denizens of this ecotype.  Not all, but who could?Needed one additional chapter on people in the woodlands.  We are not such great neighbors.

This is a tough review.  I like IZZE products (Izze Sparkling Juice), including these USDA Organic flavored sparkling waters, but...Twelve ounces of flavored water in a glass bottle?  The bottle with plastic color printed labels?  The cap?The USDA organic label may be attractive to some, but when offset with the HUGE energy investment in processing and shipping, and the obvious waste stream (please recycle), for 12 ounces of water... ?But I have to give this product 4 stars for the quality taste. IZZE!

I never read the first book, Peak, by Roland Smith.  This one, The Edge is the sequel.  However, The Edge really is a stand-alone story.  Smith makes the necessary explanations to provide the reader with enough information that, if you read Peak, great, and if not, no problem!This is a thrilling yarn that is well-worth reading if you like adventure stories.  And it works for adults as well as teens.  Peak (the character's name) is chosen for a "Peace Climb" that turns into anything but.

This total alkalinity increaser seems to be the consistency of other brands I have used.
