All parts are very smoothly finished and easy to get clean.I am definitely happy with this purchase and hope to get years of use from it!

These wipes are for geared for makeup removal, and they work fairly well for that purpose. They are a good size, and there is a decent amount of wetness to them, although there could be just a tad more moisture in my opinion. For no makeup, or just light makeup, one wipe will effectively clean your face. For full makeup (foundation, eye-shadow, etc), it will definitely take two wipes.My skin tends toward dryness, and these wipes leave my face a bit sticky, as well as somewhat drier than with my regular face cleanser. I find I need an extra bit a moisturizer afterwards. They have a light pleasant scent but do smell a bit like alcohol, even though I could not find the word 'alcohol' in the ingredients. Also, I'm not excited about the propylene glycol in the ingredients; but since these are not an everyday face cleanser for me I can use them one in awhile without worrying about it too much.Basically, although these do not perform as well as water & a good face cleanser, they do serve my purposes....an occasional convenience when needing a face cleaning substitute.

I will begin by saying that my rating is based upon the faulty product I received, and if the situation is resolved I will amend my rating. All in all, I think this has potential to be a convenient little unit.First the good.....I absolutely love the size and weight of this little pc. It is lightweight and easy to hold, and the prop works great. You can choose the angle for the prop, and it stays in position securely. Although there is no cd/dvd drive, if you have hard copies of software you can transfer the setup files to a usb and install them that way. I will not be using all my software on this, as it is mainly going to be an on-the-go type unit for me. But so far, the few things I have installed have worked well.As far as setup goes, it was extremely easy. I think even a first time user could do it. Once the 'really quick' setup is complete, everything runs smooth and fast. There was absolutely no time spent on downloading & 'updating' Windows....a new but pleasant experience for me.Now for the bad....The detachable keyboard does not work. The original one didn't work, and the replacement they sent after being on the phone for almost two hours didn't work either. The tech support folks were friendly enough, but they could not get it working, even after manipulating the pc through remote assistance. Based on some of the other reviews, it appears this keyboard malfunction is a recurring issue. So after another 40 minuted on the phone today, they gave me two choices, either send it in for repair, or exchange the whole unit through Amazon. I have already emailed Amazon to see if I can just get a whole new replacement.So basically, I'm giving three stars for now. If the keyboard issue gets resolved without much more time and trouble, I will definitely amend my rating and my review.UPDATE 12/16/14: See Comments for update

I have used only two other electric toothbrushes before, one was a brain scrambler, and the other was not. Yet the non-brain-scrambler I was using up until this Oral B, cleaned better than the scrambler. I don't think it was slower, it just seemed to be smoother.When I was offered this product in exchange for my honest review, I almost didn't take it because I love my non-scrambler toothbrush so much. But I travel periodically and like to have everything in doubles so I can keep a toiletry bag packed and ready to goI'm glad I did, this toothbrush not only cleans really, really well, it is very smooth like my other favorite electric toothbrush. If some of you don't know what I mean about brain scrambling, it's when the toothbrush is so vibrational that it feels like your brains are shaking around in your head. My older one that did this was a cheaper one, so that's probably something to look out for!As far as the features of this toothbrush go, there are some really great ones. It of course has the two minute timer, as well as a mini 'pulse' timer for each section of your mouth. There are also a variety of modes for deep cleaning, gum care, etc. But my number one, hands down favorite feature is the Pressure Sensor!Let me explain.........To say I tend to use too much pressure is putting it mildly. In fact, I have even gone through periods of vertigo after too vigorous a brushing with my electric toothbrush. We all have little calcium carbonate crystals (otoliths) in our inner ears, and sometimes for reasons 'unknown', they can break loose and travel to our semi-circular canals, wrecking havoc with our balance. I know it's from brushing too vigorously with my electric toothbrush, because the last three times I went through a several day bout of vertigo, it was after a very thorough brushing. When I say thorough, I mean I go through a minimum of 2-3 of the two minute brushing time periods, and I strain to get every crevice of my mouth that has never seen daylight. And I probably press too hard. My last bout of vertigo was a good reminder to say the least. I'll stick with two minutes from now on.But my point is, I can't say enough about the pressure sensor! It repeatedly reminds me that I'm pressing too hard, and I'm finally learning to ease up. If this toothbrush ever gets lost, stolen, broken, or beamed into space by aliens, I will definitely buy a replacement. Immediately!And finally, let me clarify about my brain scrambler...based on my statements you may think it's just me. But believe me, I have had both of my previous electric toothbrushes out side by side, and compared them one right after another. Some are definitely smoother, and some put out some mega brain scrambling vibration!

I bought these for a month long camping trip we took with our dog in October. After getting them and reading the ingredients, I decided they were definitely worthy of human use as well. In fact, the ingredients are better than many of the wipes made for humans.So I ended up using these on those days we couldn't get to a shower, and they worked great! It took 2-3 wipes for each 'bath', but there was no sickening powder smell, no residue, and they cost way less than the expensive bath wipes made for people. I actually felt nice and clean after using these. They are bigger (8"x7") than most wipes, and also a bit thicker and softer.I feel I no longer need to buy separate human wipes when we go camping. At 100 wipes for around $6.50, it's a no brainer! I highly recommend these if you want a wipe that is tougher (yet still soft and gentle), than your cheaper discount store wipes.

I did not have to pay for these; I received them in exchange for my honest review. The price at the time of this posting, is $17.50. At first I thought this was way too expensive, but that was before I realized that the one pack of five cloths I received was just a portion of what the consumer gets when they actually buy these. When you buy them, you actually get 30 cloths, (6 packs of 5 cloths).My immediate impression after the first use was that they are awesomely fantastic! They are big & thick, they work as advertised, and don't leave a residue or smell. They do not fall apart at all, and they have plenty of wetness to do a whole adult bath, yet they are not dripping wet.My husband and I go on long camping trips (sometimes roughing it), so it's hard to get a shower every day. I will still buy the cheaper, smaller wipes for quick hand wiping, etc, but these wipes will be perfect for substitute bathing purposes, and I will definitely buy them for our next trip.

First I will say that I received this item in exchange for my honest review. I have written a lot of reviews for 'freebies', and although most of my ratings are usually favorable, I have found it necessary to give some items lower ratings. This is not one of them!Simply put, this is the perfect mattress pad. I got the queen size, and it fits my bed perfectly. I have a 9" mattress with a 3" memory foam on top of that (12" total). Although this is advertised as being able to fit up to a 22" thick mattress, and on my bed there is plenty of spare material under the mattress, it still hugs my mattress nice and snugly.The loft is medium cushy....enough to add a bit of comfort, while not being too thick for my washing machine. It did have the unpleasant 'new' smell when I first opened it, but I washed it before it's first use to take care of that. It washed up nicely, it fits great, and is very comfortable to sleep on.Bottom line, I cannot find one negative thing to say about this, and feel very good about giving it a five star rating!

This is the first multi charger I have tried so I don't have anything to compare it to. It works great though, just as I hoped it would. I have two Sansa MP3 players, and two cameras that can charge via usb. With all four plugged in this unit, they charged completely and quickly.It is fairly small (about 4 1/2" by just over 2"), and I find it easy to slip it in a corner on my desk, or in the corner of my kitchen counter for an unobtrusive way to charge things. I have always charged everything separately before, and never really thought about buying a more efficient contraption like this. But I was offered the item in exchange for my honest review so I thought I'd give it a try. Now just after a couple of uses, I would miss it if I didn't have it. If it suddenly went 'poof', I would for sure fork out the money to buy a replacement! This is a nice item that works as advertised, and I have no problem giving it Five Stars!

I have used this brand of silver internally off and on as needed for several years. Actually on their website, they have a stronger one (600 ppm), that is the one I use. And for those who are worried about the 'topical use only' notice on the label...it is true that the FDA requires this on all angstrom silver. If you find angstrom silver in a health food store that does not have this notice, they are simply not complying with regulations.Colloidal silver is not the same thing, it is definitely inferior.You can find lots of info online on angstrom particles vs colloids. One such website gives the following info: 1. It takes 1 million angstroms on a horizontal plain to cross the distance of one micron. 2. A colloid has been found to be a micron or bigger in size.This means that the angstrom silver particles are at least one million times smaller than colloid particles and are easily absorbed by the body. (The website in question was at cilihealthstore.com/home/news/size-matters-angstrom-vs-colloidal/).I always hear about the 'danger' of silver...specifically that it will turn you blue. There was once a guy on tv who turned blue from colloidal silver. He admitted he took large quantities of it regularly for several years. He had no other adverse effects.This product is angstrom silver, not colloidal. Since the particles are smaller, they tend to not get trapped in the tissues.  As I said, I have used this as needed for years with great results. Usually for something like a sore infected tooth, but once I used it successfully on an infected eye. It always works great, and I do not have to worry about it killing off the beneficial bacteria in my digestive system.I have nothing to do with this company, I just didn't want this product to get a bad rap unfairly. If you check my review history, you will see that I have reviewed several supplements and health products from various companies. I have a background in nutrition and managed a health food store for years.Oh, one more thing....I have used this for my dog as well, with great results. My neighbor has a dachshund with a bad toe...he has been on various antibiotics for the past 2-3 years. A couple of months ago, she started putting just a few drops of the angstrom silver in her dogs food. The toe has finally cleared up and her dog is walking normally again.I am a big believer in going natural whenever possible. Angstrom minerals (no matter which one you use), have particles smaller than any cell in your body, and absorption is pretty much guaranteed! I hope this info will shed some light on this product for those who are considering it.

These shapes are magnetized along all the edges, and it's amazing how many structures you can come up with. I gotta be honest, I thought this set would be nice to keep around the house for when kids came over. But I am a 57 year old gal having a ton of fun it myself! And of course my nieces and nephews have come up with some pretty cool creations as well. It literally keeps them occupied for hours! Also, none of the pieces are big enough for a child to choke on...so it's a very safe toy.The only thing I didn't care for, is that the set did not come with any photos, instructions, or any information about the product whatsoever. But I didn't let that detract from my rating because it's very easy to just jump in and have fun! Plus, this is an item I received in exchange for my honest review so maybe the packaging is different in that situation???In any event, this is a great toy to have around, both for kids and adults who are 'young at heart'!

I want to be clear right off the bat....these do not taste like rich, gooey, sugar filled/ hydrogenated fat filled, candy bars. Also, don't expect them to taste anything like the girl scout 'thin mint' cookies.That being said, I personally really like these. The taste is definitely chocolatey, with just a touch of mint. The texture is as some say, a bit chalky. But take it from someone who has managed a health food store and has lots of experience with many different bars.....the taste is better than I expected, especially given that the majority of ingredients are definitely do-able. They are mostly organic, plant based, gluten-free, and non GMO!When I look for a protein bar, I want the following....good ingredients, a decent amount of protein (these have 15 gms per bar), no trans fats, and low sugar (no matter what the source). These bars do have 19 gms of sugar, which is the one and only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 (wish they would've use a bit of stevia).When I am working out hard though, I feel like I can handle the sugar on those days. Bottom line, these are a great protein/energy boost for shortly before or right after a hard workout. They are a bit spendy, but that is to be expected with higher quality ingredients.

This is not a product I would pay for. I chose to receive it in exchange for my honest review, and I had high hopes. I have bags beneath my eyes, maybe not the biggest bags on the planet, but big enough that no makeup technique will hide them.The product is supposed to make a difference quickly, after anywhere between a 3-10 minute treatment. I left it on for 10, and it did not make a difference. Absolutely none at all. And it's not like they recommend using it more often for better results....it says to use it before a girl's night out, etc. So there should be at least some improvement right after using it.I generously gave it two stars for a couple of reasons. First of all, the product has pretty natural ingredients which is important to me. It felt good on my skin and did not irritate at all. I mention that because in the past my eyes have become irritated and watery with other products. So for most people I would say this is fairly safe to use, although please keep in mind that anyone can be allergic to anything, no matter how natural.The second thing I liked was ease of use. I know some have had issues with the skimpy instructions, and yes they are minimal. But the process itself is minimal. Just pour one whole vial on the set of two pads, let it soak in, and put them on under your eyes. Maybe the reason I had better luck with the actual procedure is because I separated the pads a bit before pouring the solution on. So I didn't have to work much at getting them apart. It was a bit tricky getting them on smooth, but I just used a q-tip to help maneuver them and work out the few wrinkles that were created.The bottom line though and the reason for my poor rating, is that there was absolutely zero difference in the look of my eyes with this product. The price tag at the time of this review, is $75.00. Based on my experience, there is no way I would ever pay even $5.00 for it. This might work for some. But it definitely doesn't work for me.

This is my first time trying a version of this particular software, and although there is a bit of a learning curve, it is well worth the time.I have a lot of experience with Photoshop & Photoshop Elements, and have always used those for most of the flyers, trifolds, graphics, etc. I need to do for my business marketing. I periodically would try something more geared to the type of publishing I need....such as MS Publisher, etc. But I found that although those programs had their benefits, nothing could compare to the the results I could get with my Photoshop products. (I use lots of photos in my marketing materials.) Although Photoshop had a few limitations as far as desktop publishing goes, I was able to work around those limitations in order to make use of all it's other advantages.When I was offered the Corel Draw in exchange for my honest review, the first thing I did was look at other reviews. (I don't want something just for the sake of getting a free product.) Long story short, the few reviews that were posted at the time looked promising so I decided to give this a try.I have now used this several times, and have gone through some of the tutorials. I was really glad to see that I can use a lot of layers, rearrange the order of the layers, and adjust the transparency of the layers. Page components are simple to place and move, text is very easy and intuitive, and there are a ton of features that I never knew I could get outside of Photoshop. I think I have found a piece of software that I can actually get a lot of use out of.At this point I am by no means an expert, but I plan to keep using this and learning more about it in the next several weeks. As I stumble upon anything else that is noteworthy, I will be sure to add comments to this review. Since I did get this for free, the big question now is, would I buy it? Knowing what I do now, you bet! It's great to crawl out of my 'Photoshop box' and learn something new that I feel is worthy of my time!

This thing works really well, and there are several things I like about it.1. There is a nonslip grippy thing at the top where it hugs the shower spigot, so it doesn't slip down like my old one did.2. You can't tell from the picture, but in addition to the two larger hook-like projections at the bottom, there are four more smaller ones inbetween. The way they are arranged makes it perfect to hold a razor on two of them.3. On the bottom shelf, the wires are shaped in a way that allows separation of items.4. The shelves are nice and deep... enough to hold fat bottles, yet the shower spigot still clears the unit.5. And last but not least, I love the look of it. The two front sections are made of a bright beautiful textured material that is the most heavenly color of blue I've ever seen.Those are the pros. As for cons, there aren't any in my opinion. I really like this caddy, it is extremely functional not to mention beautiful!

Sorry to be negative and I hesitate to even leave a bad review, as the majority of my reviews are positive. This product however is one I will no longer use, hence the one star.Before I start my rant, I will say that yes, I did clean it before the first use as per the included instructions.My biggest gripe, is that this sprays so fine that a big portion of the oil just goes into the air. Every time I spray it, you can see feathery, cloudy stuff floating in the air for a long time afterwards. It looks similar to walking into a room where people are smoking, except it's more confined to about a 3'x3' area around where it was sprayed. So not only is some of the oil wasted, it leaves a very fine mist of oil on other nearby work surfaces. I always scoot away right after spraying and wait till I can no longer see the mist in the air; so I'm not breathing in oil.Plus, it's very inefficient. I have to pump the heck out of it, only to get just a few seconds of spray, and only a small percentage of it goes into the pan.I bought this to replace my last mister, which was a simple sprayer (not the pump type). The old non-pump sprayer worked for a solid two years before breaking, but I have not been able to find another one like it.Bottom line, I have tried this off and on for the last couple of weeks and I just don't like it at all. So today I took the oil that was left in the mister and poured it back into my olive oil bottle. I know many people have given favorable reviews, and it was based on those reviews that I bought this product. I really had high hopes, but unfortunately this sprayer doesn't work well for me.

This is a decent wallet and I will probably use it, but quite honestly I was hoping to like it a bit more.The flap that the bills fit in, is pretty tight....you can just barely get unfolded bills in it. If I end up using this wallet I will probably fold my bills just for easier in & out use.In addition to the bill pocket on the inside, there are three credit card slots, and a slot for a driver's license. I was hoping to have a couple more slots, but three is fine in a pinch.Of course from the photo & written description you can see that the outside of the wallet has a change zipper on one side and a cell phone pocket on the other. I have a standard flip phone, and it fits perfectly in the phone pocket. All in all a nice wallet for quick trips where you just need to carry a phone, cash, and a few cards. Keep in mind though that this is Not an rfid wallet, even though it's made by Travelon.If I had to say what I like best about the wallet, it's probably the print on the inside. I got the one that is gold on the outside; the insides are printed with a tan background and beautiful blue, lavender, and yellow flowers. Quite pretty!

I first tried these a couple of years ago. They work surprisingly well, especially if you take two capsules at a time. I use them on an as need basis. The directions say to take one capsule 3 times daily. I do not take them daily, just during high stress times; I take 2 caps a few times throughout the day and they really do seem to with my stress level. A bottle lasts me a long time that way. Also, I sometimes take one at night along with a melatonin and I sleep better than with just melatonin alone.If you have constant stress, you may want to try taking them as directed (one each dose, but take them every day).I have taken these for a couple of years and am on about my third bottle now. I will continue to keep them handy!

These feel great, especially when you put some 'weight' into it. I sit on a couch, put these on the floor, and either do both feet at once or put both balls under one foot at a time. If I could change anything about them, I would like to have bigger ones. A larger size would give you more coverage. I have some sandals with pretty good nubs like these, and with those I can do bigger sections of my foot. For me, it just feels better to have that bigger coverage.That being said, these are pretty easy to work and my feet feel refreshed, yet relaxed when I'm done.

This purse has a lot of great features, security wise (strap can't be cut, locking zippers, rfid, etc). It's also very streamlined, lightweight, and comfortable. The flashlight is surprisingly bright for such a teeny little thing, and you can either detach it, or use it attached to the strap that hangs inside the main body of the purse. The flashlight strap is long enough to give you some freedom with the light, yet it's not so long that it gets buried in your stuff. The same strap also serves as an attachment to hook your keys onto.What I don't like about the purse, is that it is just a bit Too streamlined (flat). There is no specified cell phone pocket, especially for the older flip phone type which I carry, and when all the pockets are filled (I don't carry much), your stuff will somewhat infringe upon the two bigger sections of the purse. Since there are no inside photos at the time of this review, I will describe all the pockets & measurements below:The main body of the purse measures close to 2 1/2" wide at the bottom when pulled taut. This measurement is divided between the main zippered section, and the front flap pocket (about 1 1/4" ea). Behind the front flap pocket is a flat slide pocket. (Not very secure, best for things that won't slide out easily). On the back is a flat zippered pocket. Inside the main compartment, are one zippered pocket, three card slots, and one slide in pocket behind the card slots. I find that the pocket behind the credit card slots is the best fit for my cell phone.A pen loop would have been handy, but I can live without one.I am trying to get used to the narrow spaces in this purse, because I really do like it otherwise. To give you an idea what I put in the purse, here is a list of what I carry: A lipstick, a chapstick, a comb, a skinny eyeglass case (for those sunglasses that clip onto regular glasses), gum, a small travel pill box, a few Dentek brush picks, my cell phone, a pen, and a metal RFID wallet. I use a separate wallet because the three card slots are not enough, plus I like to be able to take the wallet out and put it in a jacket pocket for short trips to the store, etc. For bills and change, I use the zippered pocket inside the main purse compartment. If I am going to an appointment where I will be in a waiting room, I can actually fit my kindle in the main compartment as well, but its very tight & makes it hard to get to my wallet and other stuff.If you carry more than what I do, you may want to go with a bigger purse, or use this just for 'minimalist' times. If I could change anything about this purse, I would have added a cell phone pocket inside the front flap section. That way the phone could be kept separate from the other stuff you may want to put in there. As it stands now, I have to use the flat slide pocket (behind the card slots) in the main section. It's a bit bulky and gets slightly in the way.So there you have it. It may sound like I'm doing a bit of complaining, and I don't mean to; I just want to be thorough about what I like and don't like. I just really like to have things organized, at my fingertips, and easy to get to. All in all I really do like this purse, but may look for one that is just slightly bigger.

These are medium sized scissors, great for office use, and for various light to medium weight fabrics. I used these on several papers and fabrics, and they did well except for on heavy denim. On the denim, the blades were sharp enough, but the scissors themselves seemed to flex somewhat. But since I have heavier duty shears for those stiffer type fabrics, I will keep these in my office and happily use them there.I almost took one star away because of the flexing I felt when cutting the denim. But I decided to stick with five stars, because these scissors aren't specifically advertized for thicker fabrics. The description says they will cut through a variety of papers and fabrics, but it does not say that heavy fabrics are included in that 'variety'. Plus, the brand being 'Mead', leads me to expect more of an office experience from them.As far as the feel, the finger holes are very comfortable and slightly cushy. They are ergonomic and I feel no hand strain with them.I have no problem recommending these for everyday office use or light/medium weight fabrics.

I like this filter, and I could not think of one bad thing to say about it, hence the five stars. It's a filter. And it fits my Eureka. And it works as expected.As for the scent, I could not detect much, but I did detect it a little. So for those of you who are sensitive to strong smells, I don't think this filter will be a problem. If you expect to be hit over the head with an out-of-this-world-freshness, you won't get that either. It's just a nice, faint, pleasant scent.Before trying this, my vacuum (a couple of years old) had never had it's filter changed, and it was starting to smell a little 'vacuumy' when I ran it. That vacuumy smell of course, disappeared with this filter, and was replaced by the mild scent described above.I received this filter in exchange for my honest review, so I did not pay for it. After checking the prices that are current as of the writing of this review, the cost on this filter is only a buck or two more than the plain Eureka brand, and about a buck less than the 3M brand. Would I pay for it when it's time to change filters again? Of course!  Even though the scent is very mild, I like it better than the plain unscented filter I had before, and to me that is worth paying an extra buck or two.

First let me say that I received this product for free in exchange for my honest review. I am generally pleased by most items I try, and am usually able to honestly give favorable reviews. I wish I could have done that for this item.I like timers, I find them handy, and use them for Christmas lights, garden watering, etc. So I am not new to timers. I thought it would be nice to have another one for my candle warmer, which I always turn on then forget to turn off. That's why I decided to give this product a try.When I first opened this package, I thought Wow... this is a small, nice looking, unobtrusive timer. (I am used to bigger ones.)So my first impression was that I thought I was going to love this. I have always been able to easily program all my other timers. Granted, I usually look at the instructions but they have always been easy to follow. Definitely not so with this timer! Maybe all the other timers I've ever used were just very simple, but nonetheless...well, just read on:First: You need to set this up with the correct date, time, latitude, sunrise/sunset times, and daylight savings time option. This portion of the setup alone, consists of ten steps.Second: You need to set up the timer for your event(s). You can have up to seven events, and your events can be either just one day, every day, just weekends, or just weekdays. You can either choose actual on/off times, or have the timer coincide with your sunrise/sunset times (from the first set of steps). You need to go through 14 steps for this, although a couple of the steps may prompt you to skip ahead in certain situations.Third: In order for the event times to actually work, you then need to set the operating mode. This is a three step process, although you need to choose from six options in step one alone. I won't get into the details, but I think it would have been much simpler to choose from either 'On' (using event times), 'Off' (disable timer completely), or 'Random' (using timer, but with 30+- delays to give lived in appearance). Another option that is important, but not included would have been a 'manual' option, to bypass the timer. Instead there a few other options that complicate things unnecessarily.Before I continue, I will mention that you can operate up to two different items with this timer, but both must use the same event times.Ok, after all was said and done, I did finally get this darn thing programmed and plugged in. And it does work...which made me consider giving four stars instead of three. But I didn't because I KNOW I will need to keep the direction sheet folded and placed near the timer. If I ever want to change the programming I will definitely need instructions again.This thing has a lot of options, but to me they are unnecessary ones. I'm surprised something this complicated wasn't set up to run two different devices independently, instead of both having to be on the same time schedule. And I would prefer a manual option (as mentioned above) as well. If there is a mode that works as a manual option, the instructions were definitely not clear about it.Would I ever buy this if I need another timer? Maybe if it was the only one left on the planet, and I had no choice. Sorry folks!

This carpet washer does a very decent job of cleaning the carpet. There are pros and cons, but all in all I feel very good about recommending it.First the pros:1. This has to be by far the easiest thing I have ever put together. I did read directions, just because feel incomplete if I don't. But I would not have needed them at all. The top part of the handle needs pushed down into the main handle, and then three screws need put in the unit. Of the three screws, 1 is longer than the other two. The directions are very clear as to which screws go where, but honestly because of the placement of the holes, you can tell where the matched pair of screw go vs. the single longer screw. Basically, that's it. Put the handle in and put in three screws. It took just a few minutes.2. It's super easy to get the water tanks in and out. The top one is for the cleaning solution, and the bottom one is for collecting the dirty water. When it's time to refill the cleaning solution and dump dirty water, it is very quick and easy.3. This is simple to run, and for the most part it cleans really well (I have medium nap carpet).  For more soiled areas you do need to either pre-treat, or go over it several times with the machine.4. This has double cleaning brushes, which is of course better than just a single brush! On my carpets I still had to make many passes in areas (see cons), but I imagine lightly soiled carpets and/or low nap carpets would be very quick and easy to clean with the double brushes.To summarize the pros, this works as expected for a good 'home' carpet cleaning machine.Now for the cons:1. For areas that are minimally soiled, a couple of passes work very well. But for more soiled areas, I found myself having to go over several times, releasing cleaner, then sucking up water, repeating, etc. (I have a medium nap carpet).2. It does suck up the water fairly well, but not as well as I'm used to from having my carpets professionally cleaned. No matter how many times I went over an area to suck the water back in, it never got to a point where it was dry enough for me. In an ideal situation, when the cleaning solution is empty, the dirty water tank should be close to full because they seem to be about the same size. I would empty the dirty water at the same time I would refill the solution tank, and it seems like about 75% of the water was being sucked back out of the carpet. It might be better with a lower nap carpet.To summarize the cons, it is a bit time consuming to really clean a carpet, and then to get as much water out as possible. A LOT of passes are required, unless you are just touching up a minimally soiled carpet.I would like to emphasize though, that I did not let the cons detract from my rating, because let's face it...this is a home machine, not a commercial one. So I feel it would be unfair to expect it to work like a commercial carpet cleaner. My expectations are high, but not unreasonable.I guess the bottom line, and what made me choose five stars, is that even though this doesn't quite measure up to a professional job (in terms of water extraction and speed), it still does a very good job. I am extremely happy with the way my freshly cleaned carpets look!

I am very happy with this computer. But I'll first address my one and only issue, which was set-up time. I was surprised that the computer automatically ran about a 15 minute self diagnostic upon booting, then I was prompted to run a more thorough "recommended" diagnostic. The prompt said it could take up to 30 minutes. Since it was recommended, I did it. It took an hour and a half! Then next time I went to start it, it tried going through all that diagnostic stuff again, so I cancelled out of it. Now it starts normally and quickly. I really haven't had a new computer do that before, so I didn't know what to think. But all is well now so I did not let that one small issue detract from my rating.Now for the positive comments....One thing I really like about this computer is that it came with less bloatware (software I don't need), than most new computers I've gotten. I did not have to go through and uninstall a bunch of stuff! It did come with McAfee Antivirus, which I may go ahead and use for awhile.By today's standards, this computer has a somewhat minimal configuration, and has no dvd drive. But that did not alter my rating either, because the price tag is really great. Plus, a really nice separate dvd can be purchased for around $20-$25. In comparison, I have seen lesser computers in this same (or even higher) price range. Just that fact alone made me want to give six stars, but alas, five is the limit. Although I received it in exchange for my honest review, I would have no issue paying what I consider to be an excellent price for it.I also love the all-in-one aspect of this system. Some people may feel that having to keep it plugged in is a pain, but I personally find that to be a non-issue. For me, this is like a desktop without the big heavy tower. And it takes up less space depth wise on my desk than my laptops do. Granted (as mentioned before), the configuration is less beefy than many desktops, or even laptops for that matter, but since the price is minimal as well I feel it is a fair trade-off. And despite the minimal configuration, I have not found any significant speed issues thus far.The other thing I really love is the 19 1/2" display. It's awesome to have such a big screen, and it really doesn't take up much room at all. It's nice and thin, fairly lightweight (yet sturdy), and it's not at all cumbersome to move around. I also love the keyboard. It is about an inch smaller depth wise, and about 1/2" shorter lengthwise than my other wireless keyboard, so it is very streamlined. The keys are standard sized and very comfortable to use.I am still fairly new to Windows 8, so I will be using this computer to really learn the ins and outs of that operating system. If I run into any negative issues in the next several months I will be sure to update my review. But so far, so good. I am a happy camper!

I love this toothbrush!!!My previous one was a battery operated one (also a Philips) and although it was decent, this one is far superior.This one does not cause a vibration that makes me feel like my brains are being scrambled. My previous one, I would have to hold really lightly against my teeth because of the wicked vibration.And yet this one works better, even though my brains feel nice and tight inside my head while brushing. It feels much gentler, while at the same time I can tell the head is oscillating much faster. But best of all, it cleans extremely well! I have adult braces, and a regular toothbrush just doesn't do the job. This thing makes my teeth feel so slick and smooth, like I just came from a professional cleaning. The brush head is pretty small, but I really like it for getting into small spaces. I have a small mouth anyway, so the small head is a big bonus.So yeah, I am loving this toothbrush! If it conks out or stops working as well down the road, I will be sure to update my review.

All in all, I like this bike rack. I'll address the cons first, then the pros.This is a nice bike rack once its put together. The photo makes the rack look pretty simple, but there are a surprising number of pieces and hardware to assemble. So my first 'slight' con, is the assembly. But...I did not let that affect my rating, because let's face it, a lot of items need assembled nowadays, and very few of them are simple. Plus, once it's together, it's done.My second con, is the weight. This is heavy and cumbersome to maneuver, both during assembly and when inserting in the hitch.My third con is access to the tailgate. For my vehicle, there is no way to open the tailgate with this rack on.As for pros.....Both of our adult size mountain bikes fit really well. They are easy to take on and off the rack, and feel secure when mounted on the rack. Also, the rack does feel very tight and sturdy once you get it bolted into the hitch. So even though the weight of this rack is heavy, I do feel it adds to the sturdiness of it.I feel the pros outweigh the cons for the most part. If there had been a way to access the tailgate with this rack on, I would have given five stars.

As soon as I took this out of the box I was disappointed. The utensil holder is attached to the drain board, but there are no holes to drain the silverware. There is no way I will use it this way, as I don't want my utensils sitting in water, or even dampness. That is a breeding ground for bacteria! Plus, the way the main part of the tray is shaped, it holds all the water in, there is no feature to sit it on the edge of the counter so it drains into the sink. The drainboard is deep enough to hold a good amount of water, so it's not that I think it will overflow or anything. I just can't get past the sitting water. If you are one of those people who washes dishes, puts them in the drainer, then dries them and puts them away immediately, and then dumps & dries your drainer, well then you might like this product.The only reason I gave this two stars instead of just one, is that the rack (without the drainboard & utensil holder) fits in the larger side of my double sink, so I can envision a use there for small batches of dishes. It will not fit in a standard sized sink though. (I have one of those extra deep sinks that is bigger on one side and smaller on the other side.) If you're wondering how it will fit in your sink, the measurements of the drainer only without the board, is 14 1/2 x 12 3/8.Others have complained about dishes not standing up and glasses falling & breaking, etc. I personally didn't have a problem with that, but I use lightweight Corelle. Plus, I found that plates were more stable facing one direction than the other. For cups and glasses I had no problem at all, they stayed put. But that really doesn't do me any good since I will only be using this as an in-sink drainer. That doesn't leave room for many cups, as they will be unable to fit on the outside slot thingys between the drainer and sink.I received this product in exchange for my honest review, and bottom line I'm glad I didn't pay for it. It's a nice looking little set, but the lack of utensil drain holes, as well as the lack of a way to drain the main board into the sink, are not great features for the way I like to do things.

The title of my review covers the top two things I look for in a cleaning product.First of all, Scent.... I will pay more for a really fresh, clean scent. When I'm at the store looking for cleaners, I open all the bottles and sniff them to see which one I like the most.  Actually, they don't even have this  particular cleaner at my local store (I live in a tiny town). So I was excited to try it in exchange for my honest review. I knew I loved the scent of Gain laundry detergent, so I hoped this smelled just as great. And it does!Second, Does it clean well? Yes!!! Mainly, I have used this diluted in a spray bottle for bathroom sinks, counters, faucets, and kitchen surfaces as well. (You don't need much to do the job!) I have also used it to mop my floors. In all cases I am very happy with the cleaning power.  Surfaces are squeaky clean, and no filmy residue. And of course I love how clean my house smells too!Now that I've tried it, I'm bummed they don't carry it at my local store. I am going to take the bottle in when it's empty and ask if they can keep it in stock. Bottom line, it works, it smells fantastic, and I highly recommend it!

The first thing I want to say is this: If your insomnia has NOTHING to do with caffeine consumption, find another product...Maybe straight melatonin, or herbs like Valerian, Hops, & Skullcap. If your mind races with stress or worry at night, then add theanine to the aforementioned products.Ruta Sleep is specifically meant to get rid of the caffeine in your body so that it doesn't keep you awake. It has two active ingredients; Rutaecarpine (the caffeine eliminator), and time release Melatonin (a natural hormone we all produce at night to help us sleep). Of course as we get older, our natural melatonin production decreases greatly. This is why so many of us more mature adults suffer from insomnia, and why melatonin is added to many of the natural sleep aids out there.Ok, on to the meat of the review; does rutaecarpine eliminate the caffeine? Well yes, I think it does. I am not a coffee drinker, but I do drink tea fairly regularly and have to watch the amount I drink. I get the shakes if I drink more than three cups a day. If I take 2 of these capsules in the evening of a 'three cup" day, then 'shock of all shocks', I actually start getting tired! In fact, I almost get downright sleepy. But if I don't hit the timing just right, then it doesn't work as well. In other words, if I miss my 'tired' window and stay up even a little bit past it, then I can't go to sleep very quickly. But on the other hand, if I get to bed right during that 'tired' sweet spot, I go to sleep within 30 minutes (that's really fast for me). So timing is an issue. I think each person has to go through a little trial and error to find out what works best for them. And for me, once I'm asleep I generally stay asleep pretty well. So even though the melatonin in this is time release, it's not an important factor in my situation. My issue is the initial time it takes to fall asleep, so like I said, the trick is to go to bed during that sweet spot of sleepiness.So yes, I think this product has the potential to work really well for caffeine users. The description is pretty clear about caffeine elimination being an important mechanism of action. But if your insomnia has to do with factors other than caffeine, you may want to try something else.

This is a very nifty little gadget. I'm a sucker for organizational containers, and tend to collect so many of them that I have 'clutter' from all my containers. Which defeats the purpose, of course.This awesome little thing though, was actually useful from the first day I received it. It can be used as a round tabletop-desktop container, or it can be 'unfolded' into to a double half moon shaped container that attaches via magnets to a refrigerator, file cabinet, or any other metal surface.Right now, this is in my sewing room on the side of a metal cabinet beside my sewing table. I keep my seam ripper, scissors, and presser-foot screwdriver in it, as well as my chalk pencil and a few other sewing essentials. The magnets are very strong, and so is the material it's made of. The container is very stiff, even though in the picture it looks kind of like one of those soft can coolies. It can really stand up to holding some heavy items.The only problem I have, is that it's not on my refrigerator where it worked really well the first couple of days. I moved it because I decided it'd be even better in my sewing room.So even though I received it in exchange for my honest review, I will be buying two more; one for my refrigerator, and another one for my office. I love anything that organizes without cluttering up my work surface, and this fits the bill!

First of all, I'll say that I received these plates in exchange for my honest review.Second, I'll say that I accepted these plates in exchange for my review because I have been using them for a few years now and still love them.My local grocery store sells these, along with a few other choices. I have bought the others a few times, but only if the sale is too good to pass up. Most generally, these are the best buy for my money. They are pretty darn sturdy, and hot heavy foods are generally not a problem for these plates. There is a decent sized rounded lip around the plate that really helps hold the food in. Of course if you're going to eat a huge 8" chunk of lasagna that is 4" high... well, you might want to double the plate. But your basic piece of chicken, potato salad, and baked beans will work well with just a single plate. The 10+" size works great for just about everything, especially bigger appetites. I even use this size plate for serving; it works well to hold a plate of cookies, crackers, candies, etc. The medium (8 1/2") size is perfect for most appetites, and the small (6 3/4") size is awesome for snacks, desserts, or kid's portions.This particular green/pink design has been around for awhile now, and although function is the main feature I look for, the nice design is a definite plus. (I like pretty things, and these are pretty.)Bottom line, there is no reason to give less than five stars, so five it is!

I just bought two of these bigger bottles, for the second year in a row. Always before I bought the small bottles just because I love the scent and like to put drops of it in the water kettle on my wood stove. It makes the house smell awesome in the winter. It also works great in an oil burner. or in a steam inhaler.My new favorite use for this though, is for wasp repellant. I am allergic to both wasps and bees, and was reading about natural repellants. I found out last year that eucalyptus oil works wonders. I put in a sprayer that can spray oil type products, and I spray it on all the areas that wasps like to build nests in the spring. (Cheaper spray bottles will cause it to clog, even if you thin it with water). We have a lot of wood on our decks, both in the flooring, railings, and ceilings. There are cracks in the ceiling that make great 'nest' spots, so I also spray it in all the cracks. Last year was the first year we didn't have any wasp nests in those areas. Early on, I do think a small nest was forming because I saw a few going in and out of a specific crack. I got up the next morning while it was still cool and sprayed the heck outta that crack, and a few wasps came stumbling out and died. I didn't see any there after that.Another great time to use this is when you are building a deck, a wood fence, or anything that will need stained. Put some teak oil and eucalyptus oil in with your regular stain, mix it well, and all your wood will naturally smell 'bad' to the wasps! I don't know how long that lasts, but I would think you'd need to re-spray vulnerable areas in subsequent years. And I don't remember the ratio for it, but I'm sure an online search would give you the same info I got.One other thing I do is dab a few drops of this on my clothes and on the bill of my cap. It also keeps the mosquitos away!So bottom line, I will order a couple of these big bottles every year. It may not guarantee that I won't get stung, but it sure raises the odds in my favor!

I have in the past, used two other types of elastic shoelaces. The first type had hardware that went at the bottom of the laces as well as at the top....a bit of unnecessary complication in my opinion. The second type were the simple curly laces that stay put, just by the nature of the curls that stuck out of the top holes. Those were hard to lace and kept needing the curls stretched out during the lacing process, but were 'ok' after I was done....and the laces did not come out of the holes 'very often'.Enter the Ten Seconds Elastic Laces: I had just gotten a new pair of sneakers that came with the old tie up laces, so off I go to the Amazon website to find some more of the curly stretch laces. I happened to see these, and at first the hardware in the photo turned me off because of my experience with the other ones mentioned above. But the more I looked at the photo and read the description, the more worthy they appeared. So I ordered them. And I am extremely happy with them. They laced up very easily and smoothly, they are WAY easier to adjust, there is plenty of string to keep loose enough for my high instep, and the little hardware clip at the top is nice looking and took only about two seconds to feed strings through & adjust. With my shoes on, the shoestrings feel nice and secure, my shoes do not feel at all like they will slip off, yet there is plenty of give so my feet don't feel constricted.Now that I know how much more I like these over all my other stretchy shoestrings, I am going to go back an get the black, grey, and white. (I got brown the first time). I guess the bottom line, is that for me these laces are perfect!

The first thing I did when I received this flashlight, is try to impatiently rip it out of the packaging. It's in there tight, so when it gave loose it flew across the room and hit the tile floor in my kitchen. I thought "oh crap", and tried to turn on. I had to first unscrew it and take the little protective paper out that conserves the batteries. But once I did that, it came on, no problem. So first thing I can say, is that it definitely withstood a pretty hard fall.Next thing I wanted to test out was the light strength/brightness. So I waited till it was dark (I live in a rural Montana area, so dark is DARK!). I took it out on my deck, along with four other flashlights (5 total). On it's highest of the two intensity settings,this flashlight was brighter than all but one. The one that beat it out was a 'Coast PX25', but at the time of this review, that flashlight costs $30.85 compared to $17.90 for this Rayovac.The beam width was about the same in both, but the Coast was noticeably brighter. But then again, the Rayovac was noticeably brighter than the three remaining flashlights I compared it to. All of the flashlights I compared this to, were fairly small handheld ones, averaging 3 1/2" - 4 1/2" in length. The Rayovac is slightly larger, at just under 5 1/2", but the heavy duty rubber protective covering accounts for some of that.Bottom line, I feel this flashlight deserves 5 stars. If the cost was as much as the Coast flashlight, I would've given four stars. But given the reasonable cost, the light quality, and the "can safely be dropped" factor, I am very happy with this flashlight. It'll be a great, sturdy light for my husband to throw in his pack for those pre-dawn hikes to his hunting spots next fall!I should note that I did receive this product in exchange for my honest review, so my references to cost are for the benefit of those who would have to pay for this flashlight. If I had to choose between this Rayovac and the brighter Coast light, (and pay for it out of my own pocket), I would choose the Coast for myself and the sturdy Rayovac for my husband.

Here is the original review I left. Please also read the comments afterwards, as they give additional info on how this situation played out:Original Review:First of all, let me say I do not normally leave one star reviews. You can easily verify that if you want. Now I'll get into the pros and cons of this computer:Pros: Price is good for the ram, hard drive size, etc. That's it, no more pros.Cons: This is probably just going to be one long rant.....This laptop has not run well from day one. Start up time averages 7 minutes from pushing power button to password login screen. Runs ok after that when offline, but email and internet are slow.I have been on the phone with Toshiba tech support a number of times. They have determined it is a windows software issue, and they will not warranty that. Furthermore,  I cannot restore this computer to factory settings without losing Windows 7. Apparently it originally comes with Windows 8, and is downgraded to Windows 7 prior to being shipped to the consumer. The restore discs that came with the laptop are Windows 8, and tech support said I need to contact Amazon to get a Window 7 restore disc. Plus, if I did decide to restore to factory settings using the Windows 8 discs, I need to change some bios settings first, according to the paperwork that came with the computer.I don't really know if I want Windows 8, I want to use a lot of the software that I already have that works with Windows 7.Edit...Am on the phone wth Amazon customer service right now. Will see how it goes.I can only assume that the factory downgrade from Windows 8 to 7, caused some issues. If the slow startup was normal, and just something that was simply going to happen, I could live with it for the next 5-6 years. But no one seems to be able to tell me if there is something really wrong, that could cause more problems in the future. They can only guess that it's an operating system issue.I have owned only about 4-5 computers in my life. They last me quite awhile and I can usually figure most things out for myself. This particular laptop was a huge waste of $800.00! If anyone else who bought this has had the same issues, please let me know how you handled it. Once the box is opened, it is apparently non-returnable.Edit: Just got off the phone with Amazon, they are sending a replacement. Also, I received an email from Kaspersky support who was also looking into the problem for me. They said there were driver issues at startup.If the replacement laptop works better, I will amend my review.

This little light is pretty handy. It was easy to interpret the mounting procedure and it works for my purposes. I have it under a cabinet that is about 5ft wide, and at the ends of the cabinet are a wall and a refrigerator. Given that the cabinet is in kind of a closed off area, I thought the light would be really birght, as it would be more contained. But it's really kind dim, even on the brightest setting. Also, it's not much of a spreading light.Nonetheless, I really like it and it does the job it was intended for. I have all my dog food, dog treats, supplements, etc in that area. In the morning I like to mix up my dog's breakfast concoction in that space and not have to turn on the big overhead lights. It works perfect for that.

As a quilter, I have used a variety of irons in the past few years. As long as the iron gets good and hot for seam pressing, I'm pretty easy to please. For this iron, there are many pros, & only one con in my opinion:Pros:1. Heats up quickly and gets nice and hot. As another reviewer mentioned, it does have the automatic shut off, but when I'm ready to press a few seams, the first thing I do is reactivate the iron by moving it down then back up again. By the time I get my quilting blocks placed on the ironing board, the iron is once again hot and ready to go.2. I don't use steam much, but of the three irons I currently own, this one has by far the largest steam reservoir. With my last iron, a little plastic container came with it for the purpose of filling the water reservoir. One fill up is all that iron could hold. I used that same cup to put water in this iron, and it looked like it only filled it up about 20%. So I'm guessing this will hold about five times as much water as the other iron. A nice feature, as this iron is just a tad smaller and lighter than the other one.3. The cord is very long (about 12 ft), a great plus in my book.4. The handle extends into a heel type rest for keeping the iron upright. This heel also keeps the cord from getting in the way when ironing.5. Fairly lightweight (therefore good for taking to quilting retreats).6. No annoying beeps!!!!! This may not mean anything to others, but to me it's important. The last iron I got is great except it beeps when you plug it in, it beeps when you turn the dial on, and it beeps when it goes into auto shut-off. Nothing is more distracting than when you're concentrating on tricky seams or applique, then all of a sudden BEEP, BEEP, BEEP, BEEP! Fortunately, this T-fal does NOT beep!!!Cons: The only con I noticed is not really a big deal, and one I think I will get used to. The shape & angle of the heel rest makes the iron sit at a more 'slanted back' angle than any other iron I've ever had. Yes, it is very stable, but the angle takes some getting used to when grabbing the handle for picking up or setting down. My wrist isn't flexible enough to maneuver it, I end up having to angle my whole forearm. (I hope that explanation is understandable). I don't have bad wrists or anything, it's just a little awkward.I have a quilting retreat scheduled this Thursday-Sunday, and because of the light weight and long cord, this is the iron I will be taking. I fully expect this to work well during my retreat. If I encounter any negative issues I will update my review.

I recently went on a motion sensor light & motion night light buying spree, which is maybe why I was given the opportunity to receive these particular lights in exchange for my honest review.First of all, I'll say that all of the motion sensor lights I own would probably get a least a four star rating. I'm pretty happy with all of them. With these, I don't even have to decide between 4 or 5 stars, I give 5 without hesitation. I often review things by listing pros and cons. I will do half of that procedure (the pros) with these lights. I won't do cons, because there aren't any in my opinion.Pros:1. Nice and bright, without being blinding.2. Great sensitivity. These turn on exactly when you need them to.3. Great mounting system. There is a hole in the back (adjustable) bracket to use for mounting. It's very easy to slip the hold over your screw or 'larger' nailhead, and then push it down into place. When you need to change batteries (3 size C), you just move the bracket so you can slip it off the screw or nail.I have not used these outside, but I do have another model of Mr Beams light on my outside deck. The batteries in that one have been able to withstand the wicked winter temps we had this past winter, and they are still going strong. So I can only assume that the batteries in this product will fare just as well.Bottom line, I am very happy with these lights. I'm pretty night blind, so I love having lights come on just when I need them to!

This is my third tens unit, and although it's my least favorite of the three I now have, I feel that for the price it's a pretty decent deal. I do like the fact that it is the smallest one I have, so the control unit can very easily fit into pretty much any sized pocket. There is a variety of modes, yet some of them feel so similar to each other that I can barely feel a difference. That is not necessarily a negative though, just an observation. It's still easy to find a mode that feels fairly massage-like.I also prefer a two channel unit, one that has two cords with two pads coming from each cord. It's more clinically effective to have two pads per sore area, so if both trapezius' are sore for example, it's better to have two pads on the right, and two pads on the left. With this unit, you have to go with only one pad on each side, or only do one side with the preferred 'double' pads. Again, this did not affect my star rating, because the price for a good two channel unit is of course, higher.The main reason I gave four stars instead of five, is that from the first time I used this, I felt a sort of hot needle/pinching sensation right beneath the 'snap' part of the pads. If you've used tens before, you'll recognize this as the feeling you get when the pads start to wear. These particular pads were brand new, and seemed to be very moist and plump, just like new pads should look. So I don't know what the issue is. But as I turned up the strength of the signal, only the massage/kneading got stronger, not the pinching feeling.All in all if you want a decent, convenient little tens unit that is easy to use, and is a good price, it'd be worth giving this a try. Keep in mind though, that these are the snap type pads, and not all snap pads are interchangeable. One of my other tens units has the snap pads, but those snap are bigger and won't fit these. Just sayin', be aware of that when you go to buy new pads.One final note, the booklet that came with this is the best and most informative one I have, even considering both of the other units I own were more expensive. It's easy to understand, yet thorough at the same time. Great for a first time tens user!

I was excited to try this but it did not meet my expectations. I'll break it down into simple pros and cons, and follow with a summary.Pros:1. It does put out some decent steam for 'short' periods of time.2. There are a many attachments that will allow you to use this just about anywhere and on anything.Cons:1.The steam doesn't last long. The light turns green when it's ready to release full pressure steam. This mode does loosen dirt and stains effectively, but the full pressure mode does not last long At ALL. So you have two choices... keep running it with a tiny amount of ineffective steam (way less than you would get from water boiling in a tea kettle), or you can release the trigger and wait for it to gain full steam power again.2. My second con describes the cumbersome part; It is difficult to hold onto the steamer by the handle, hold down the trigger, and then try and figure out where the third hand is going to come from to push in the button that keeps the trigger engaged (so you don't have to keep holding in in). All this while making sure the cord stays out of the way of the steam. Maybe my hands are too small, but I could not use one of my already engaged hands to activate the button that keeps the trigger pressed, without setting the steamer down on something so that I could free up the hand that was holding onto the handle. I soon figured out that this was all pointless to do anyway. As the full pressure steam runs out quickly, you have to wait & let it build back up, then go through the whole process again. It finally got to where I just kept the trigger engaged until the steam subsided, then released the trigger and set the machine down until the pressure built back up again. Usually the steam pressure lifted before significant hand cramping set in.3. Effectiveness; Given the use/wait/use/wait procedure to run this, it took me 20 minutes to clean just a small portion of my shower walls, and the result was not great. Minor stains and dirt was dissolved, but I still felt mineral build-up. So then I got out some soft scrub and cleaned an equal sized portion of my shower on another area. The soft scrub method did a better job and took about 5 minutes.I'm sorry to be negative.  I am generally pleased with most items and tend to give favorable reviews. Honestly, this item seems more like a 1 or 2 star product for my particular use. The reason I gave 3 stars is because based on other reviews, my issues with the product may not reflect how the majority of users feel. So I did not want to drag down the rating of this product unfairly.I am a woman with periodic neck and shoulder issues and was eager to try something that may make cleaning easier, as prolonged scrubbing can get to me. Maybe a man may find this easier to use. Bottom line, I found this to be no quicker, no more effective, and no easier to use than a cleaning product and elbow grease.

Great tshirt for Big Bang Theory/Star Trek lovers. Looks awesome in person, and there's no doubt that this picture looks exactly like Sheldon.I always put new clothes through the wash before wear them, and this had no fading or degrading of the design whatsoever. (I always turn printed tshirts inside out to wash).As far as sizing goes, this fit just right. I am a 5'7" female, 125 lbs. I sometimes order a small in tshirts, but since this one said slim fit I ordered a medium. It's slightly looser than the smalls I usually get, but it's a great fit. It is loose enough to be comfortable, but slim enough so that it doesn't look like a sack! I plan to get lots of wear from this one!

I always put loads of greens in my morning smoothie, but saw this at my local health food store and was curious enough to try it.I was pleased to see that it is made from Organic kale. It mixes well, and yes, it does taste like kale. The cruciferous taste is even stronger in this powder than it is when using fresh kale, but it doesn't bother me too much. If the taste is off-putting to you, I highly recommend mixing some mint flavored liquid chlorophyll with it. It actually makes this a pleasure to drink that way. (Look for chlorophyll without the parabens....a couple of clean brands include the Sunny Green, as well as Now Foods brand). Just mix the powder with a glass of water, and add a tablespoon of the chlorophyll. Yummy!Basically, if you are a person who does not like to eat your cruciferous vegees, this is a good way to get all those great nutrients. And if you are one of the rare folks who suffer from an Over-active thyroid (most people with thyroid issues are under active), then this is a great alternative to all the popular iodine laden sea vegetables like spirulina, etc. Just remember....over-active, use cruciferous. Under-active, use sea vegetables.Bottom line, I won't use this a lot because I get tons and tons of greens every day. But I was curious, and this will be nice to have in my cupboard just in case. Or it can be a nice refreshing between-meal drink when mixed with the minty liquid chlorophyll.  Another great use will be for camping and road trips....we travel in the boonies where it can be harder to find healthy meals.

I've read a lot of books that were channeled, and a lot of books on reincarnation, karma, etc. This one is refreshingly different, with lots of new insights. No matter what I read, there are usually questions left when I'm done. The information in this book answers many of those questions.Some parts of the book, were kindof ho-hum, and I would think ok, the good parts are over now. Then it would get fascinating again and I would have a hard time tearing myself away. It was back and forth like that throughout the book. I think that's due to the questions that were being asked during the dialog. Some of the questions I guess were just questions that weren't important to me. But boy, when a question came up that sparked my interest I was glued to the pages. Some of the book seemed very basic, and some seemed more advanced. All in all, a great mix. It doesn't tax the brain for too long at a time that way, haha!This is a pretty obscure book that I found by chance, but I'm glad I did. This is definitely one I will re-read again at some point.

This was pretty darn funny, but not up to the standards of "Best in Show". If I hadn't seen Best in Show, I probably would've given A Mighty Wind five stars. Many of the same actors, playing totally different parts than they did in other Christopher Guest movies. Some funnier, some not quite as funny. All in all it was an hour and a half very well spent.
Relaxing and exhilarating at the same time. Just beautiful scenery and music! I live in the mountains and I never get tired of it.
Very relaxing to watch before bed. Just beautiful scenery and music! I live in the mountains and I never get tired of it.

I love this product.I have received this product for free so that I could provide a review.I didn't know what to think of using bone conductance rather than my eardrum but I have to say it works wonderfully.This product is easy to use and I love that I can jog or do chores outside and still hear everything that is going on around me. It's great.

This is a great item.The wood is thick and looks beautiful. We like it so much we might even hang it up and display this. It's great we can't get enough of it. This item was given to us for review and we couldn't be happier with it.The wood itself has a nerdy saying on it and it fits our home perfectly.

This game is easy and fun to play.The best thing I can say about this game is that I have played this with four different groups of people and each time I do somebody asks me where I got it and says they are buying s copy for themselves.I have been shocked by how much fun a group of three or more can have with this game. The more creative the group of people the better. If you are considering buying this for for it, but beware, you will then end up buying many expansion packs.
Easy to  install. Great product.No problems yet instructions were very easy to follow.

I have no idea what went wrong with this product.The blad simply wouldn't cut for me. The handle.is cumbersome and I couldn't get the angle I wanted in order to make my vegetables clean.I received this product for review but I ended up tossing it as I couldn't get it to work properly.

This is a nice product for your hair, my only issue is that I'm not entirely sure that it does what it is expected.This product was received for review. I was asked to see if this product would make hair look and feel thicker. I have to say that so far I don't see a difference. U am giving it three stars because I can't prove that it hasn't made my hair thicker yet, I just don't feel that it made an impressive difference.I will say the item smelled nice and worked and felt like a luxury shampoo.

This item is compact and it does everything you want it to do. It comes with a mosquito net you can place over yourself. This offers a lot of protection. The item is made of some nice material and is water resistant. I received this product for review and I loved if during my test run.
The product quality is great and so is the fit.I was pleased with this no frills hat.
Love this bag.Took this bag on a trip and used it to hold water and small snacks. Perfect unisex bag of high quality to help us get around.This is now our go to travel bag.
Product was of very poor quality and the board was damaged. The only reason this is getting two stars is because the peices appear to be quality.

This table is decent for the price paid. In particular, I like the slight ridge around the top that helps keep things from getting bumped off. It's light enough we can easily move it, but stable enough to be functional. I saw another offer on Amazon for this exact table for $69 + $8.95 shipping, so this offer, at $42.50 (currently), is a better deal.This is not precision manufacturing, but the bolts screw in nicely and tighten up to provide a solid table.  It's a happy medium between being light enough to easily move or being so sturdy that it's heavy and hard to move.

I purchased two Smart Solar Solar Stainless Step Light - White LED 3081WRM1 a few years ago and was happy with them.  They eventually failed (as all battery products do) and I ordered replacements.  They didn't work, so I ordered another set. They were also DOA, so I ordered the Kootek® Outdoor Waterproof Solar Lights and they fired right up. Some people have commented about the lack of light provided, but even on a good day, the Smart Solar version produced at best 10% of the light the Kootek®'s do. So, I'm happy with them at this point. I'll update if there are any problems.

I purchased 7 of these in late 2014 and by March of 2015 two of them have failed. Cree has come out with a different style called 4Flow™ Filament design.  That may solve some of the quality issues.  I have started keeping all the packaging and receipts handy for Cree bulbs.  The company warranty requires you to send them the bulb, with proof of purchase (which is part of the packaging) and the receipt.  I purchased several via Amazon and have also used a local big box hardware store.  Both have been good about replacing them.

I've owned TiVo's since 2000 (early adopter). I recently purchased a refurbished TiVo Roamio unit and started it up. One thing I really liked was the ability to transfer season pass info and old programs from the prior TiVo to the new Roamio.  Very slick.  My problem is the remote.  It didn't work like my prior TiVo remotes.  Kept skipping channels, responding incorrectly, etc. I contacted TiVo online and was told the new Roamio remotes were that way. Either that or I was using it incorrectly, or it was programmed incorrectly.  I reprogrammed (connected) it and it still didn't work.  I purchased another new Roamio TiVo remote and it worked fine.  So, I called TiVo and asked how they would handle this.  I was told by Christopher that since I had purchased another TiVo remote they would not do anything for me. I said I could send the new one back for a refund, but he said they wouldn't do that.  So, after 15 years I'll be looking for a new DVR system the next time I need to upgrade.  TiVo has been outstanding for the last 15 years, until this incident.  Amazing.

We purchased one of the pre-made Bamboo bee houses from Amazon a year ago.  It deteriorated over that time, so we wanted something that would work over a longer period of time.  I purchased a section of white 3 inch PVC pipe at a local hardware store and cut it to length to fit these nest tubes.  A couple of eye hooks were screwed into the PVC so it could be hung from a tree.  We'll have to replace the tubes at some point, but at least the basic structure will stay intact.  This order of 100 tubes filled the 3 inch PVC once, but there was not enough left over to fill it again (or make another one).  We'll need to reorder to do that.

I've been reinsulating my attic and have purchased several tools to use on the batts of insulation. At first I was disappointed with this knife because the reviews were so great and I thought was different than the others.  Then I flipped it over to the serrated edge and it really started doing the job.  Normally you would compress an insulation batt as much as possible to make it easier to cut.  With the serrated edge on this knife I've been able to cut R-30 without compressing it. Also, the serrated edge has been great for cutting out areas for electrical boxes, etc. So far, out of all the insulation cutters I've tried, this is the best.

Regular history books are more complete, but not as entertaining for me. I have several of the What A Year It Was series of books and the format generally includes highpoints of the year in politics, sports, inventions, business and entertainment as well as a nice collection of advertisements, news of famous people of the era and the prices of various items at the time (we've had a little inflation since then...).  It's an easy and fun historical read.

A company I worked for had their own printing department and I used to go there to get some items cut. Two things about this HFS printer remind me of how the printing department cut thick items. First, the clamp on the material you are cutting. Keeping a number of pages, or a book, locked tightly in place is a key part of the process.  Second, this cutter doesn't just drop down, it moves forward creating a slice type of cut, as opposed to just chopping. The printing department cutter also "sliced" this way. The cheap paper cutters use the chop method and it's ok for a limited number of pages, but after about 10 or so pages the effectiveness decreases substantially.

We have a gang of 12 or 13 bluebirds who rotate on this feeder, since they can't all be on it at one time (though they try). I've uploaded a picture of the 8 who can congregate together.  We're glad we got the large version!It was a little difficult to install on a really cold day (10 degrees), but I warmed the suction cups in hot water and it stuck on nicely.Supplemental: We took this feeder down and replaced it with another kind and our bluebird activity dropped off.  We put the Red Earth Naturals back up and our bluebirds came right back. This may be an anomaly and may not work everywhere, but it was striking to see the birds respond to the variation in feeders.

Allows parents to shoot children (and vice versa) without causing any pain...  I paid $17.99 here on Amazon and as I'm writing this review it's listed for $47.97.  At the price I paid, it's a decent deal.  At $47.99 I would definitely pass.

Ice Moon is a fantastic addition to the already great Moon series. Ever wonder why Jared dropped out of Med school?
