Because, they used to be.  100 years ago, every schoolchild had to learn Latin, Greek, Hebrew and the history of Rome.  You couldn't be graduated from high school, else.  Today, all that is gone, and so now the names so long known by children, are mysteries.  Again, enter this book to help you bridge the huge obstruction of names and places seldom explained in any of the writeups.So the larger question is, why study Roman history, if not a Christian?  Everything you do and think today, is sourced in the 1st century AD, that's why.  All countries today have constitutions and political structures which are sourced in the Roman style.  Most all the world's customs, are romanized.  And everyone has romantic notions of that time.  Which notions, are quite far from the truth, but quite close to the values the Romans themselves had:  'Romans' who were anywhere in the world, never having set foot in Rome itself.  So how can such a culture become so universal?  Well, study Roman history and you'll know.  But you'll never profitably study Roman history, without this book to save you time.  Wish I had found it, 30 years ago.The book contains many maps in great detail which frankly I've never found anywhere else.  So when you are reading Gibbon or Mommsen, two of the most respected and comprehensive historians of Rome, you can look up the places mentioned in this Atlas, and follow along.  Else, you will zone out.  Same, when reading the more modern scholars' reworking of the same data.  For the data is fragmented, has been rehashed and recollated and is constantly changing, much as for Egyptian history.  So without a grounding in the names and places, you will just give up study.  If you give up, you will not understand 'today'.  For today, is really just a tech-advanced version of that same first century AD.  Don't believe it?  Study the history, use this book alongside whatever you're reading, and then you'll know.  For past is prologue, and if you hope to make sense of 'today', you must know those 'yesterdays'.  All our wars of last century were attempts to recreate Rome, and that desire continues, unabated (but we are so tired, we're not fighting again yet).  So in the future, it will happen again.  Trend of history, to recreate 'Rome' will continue.  So if you want to get on top of that future, you need to know, this past.  This book will be vital to saving time, in learning it.

This review concerns the 5 lbs., which I got outside Amazon because I didn't know it was in Amazon.  Was looking to replenish, and found it here.  But I won't buy the 5 lbs. again, as the barrel (as pictured, exactly) is a royal pain to use.  Took me 20 minutes to repackage in other containers.  VERY FRUSTRATING, Now Foods!!!Wish these came in pouches or at least in those rectangle containers for food storage (but NOT the MADware kind with the popup lid which makes stacking an accident waiting to happen).  There ARE options to buy this product in other packaging, but the prices are not good;  as usual, someone's not paying attention to the prices, for it shouldn't be more expensive per pound to buy 10 pounds, versus buying 5 (as I write).  And, the 15 lb option hangs, so I can't see its price.  Will come back later and see if the prices/product page are fixed.  Alas, suddenly there's no way to report a dysfunctional product page, to Amazon (they removed the link for reporting problems, in the 'new' and worse version of Amazon navigational programming).Now for the product itself.  FAST MIXING is indeed what you get, yay!  Yay!  Yay!  Powder is tasteless, as it's supposed to be.  I use it to make Twinlab Yeast (here in Amazon), mix better (key to mixing that yeast is to combine it with some granular powder, milk powder, or other powder, mix dry and then add liquid slowly so it won't clump).The amount of protein per scoop is also standard, though the scoop is weird, more like detergent scoops than typical whey protein scoops.  Per scoop, this brand is a bit more pricey than Body Fortress (my usual brand, but they refuse to make unflavored), BUT.. this brand mixes far better.I've mixed it with many things to mimic solid food: kale powder (Hoosier Hill, here in Amazon), cheddar or bleu cheese powder (same brand), tomato powder (Harmony House, here in Amazon), but my favorite use of it, is with McCormick's (wet) Beef Base (also here in Amazon).  Mixed, it imparts a Cremora-type taste.  It's even good if you mix with water but merely add some Rajun Cajun or Louisiana hot sauce or Sabrozita (all available here in Amazon).So this is a five-star whey protein, except for the packaging and prices, but I'm hoping someone will correct both.

Ahhh, per my other review on this time period, I had wanted Morgan's book (  http://www.amazon.com/69-D-Year-Four-Emperors/dp/0195315898/ref=tmm_pap_swatch_0?_encoding=UTF8&sr=1-1&qid=1421743073  ) turned into a movie on the Year of the Four Emperors.  If you're a Hollywood producer, DO IT PLEASE -- but use THIS book instead, for developing your screenplay.  Not sure I'd start it on Jan 1 69 as Wellesley (and Tacitus), but rather on the last few months of Nero.  Unless, you can make the flashbacks work as Wellesley tries to do in this succinct but riveting reconstruction.  Even so, read Morgan first for backstory, and to get familiar with the names, timelines, battles, etc.  Then read this, then maybe read Morgan again.For Wellesley understands the need for a 'live' story.  Morgan, provides much needed underpinning of the events.  One big flaw in all Roman history writings is that each writer takes a commentary approach, from 1st century Roman writers onward; so you're always scrambling to a dictionary or encyclopedia to just get the basic timeline and geography.  Oh well.  Next best thing, is to TURN THE STORY INTO A MOVIE.Here in Wellesley, we have a kindred drama, yet without sacrificing scholarship.  A TON OF MONEY CAN BE MADE BY DOING A MOVIE FROM THIS YEAR IN ROMAN HISTORY, NOT TO MENTION THE BILLIONS ON GAME OFFSHOOTS, SO PLEASE MAKE A MOVIE ON THIS.  If done right, it will be bigger than Game of Thrones, bigger than Gladiator.  Okay, enough caps and yelling.If you are a Christian, you desperately need to understand this year in history, because per Bible it's triggered by Paul's death maybe only days or months before Nero's, in June 68 AD.  Paul is maybe predicting his own death for that year, back in 56 AD when writing Ephesians 1:3-14 (I did videos to prove when and what Paul meant in mapping future Church history, see my 'ggs11' channel in vimeo).  For it's a vital Bible principle that as goes the believer, so goes history, and all of Roman history to Odovacer was future-traced by Paul to show that principle (again, see my videos, it's all documented live in Bible text, hundreds of videos and many Word docs you can download and vet yourself in the Greek).Of course, most of the world only wants to be entertained after coming home, plunked in front of the TV, eating dinner. Fine.  This book will entertain you, too.  At least, until someone wisens up and makes a movie out of it, hiring both Wellesley and Morgan as consultants.Will shut up now.

EDIT, 1/21/15:  I just used a pinch of this in my coffee pot to fix the burnt taste coffee gets when left 'on' for too long.  It worked right away on the mostly-full (say 8 cups) pot.  That makes this a worthy purchase even at the price listed, as plain citric acid won't correct burnt coffee flavor as well.Be very careful when you sprinkle it in.  Original (grammar-corrected) review, follows below.===========This has true lime taste only when used atop food like you'd use salt at a meal.  But it pours quickly, so be careful when shaking.  You do NOT need added salt, so if you're going to use it in or after cooking, don't salt the food while it cooks.  I love salty things yet I find this too salty; it has no sodium in it, per the ingredients' list. For me, there's no detectable lime flavor if used in cooking.  But yes, quite a nice smell.Citric acid (what makes lemons or oranges sour) is a lot cheaper, but doesn't taste the same.  This has citric acid in it.

I use oatmeal the way other people use rice or pasta.  I mix it with grapenuts (or knockoff), about half and half.  Prefer the old-fashioned, but couldn't find it on Amazon, so got this.Try this idea when you're pressed for time, esp since this thing is 1-minute:1.  Put a frozen chicken leg on a deep-dish microwave-safe stoneware plate or (i.e., Corelle Frost White serving) bowl.2.  'Surround' it with as much of the grapenuts-and-oatmeal RAW mix as you want for your serving.3.  'Surround' it with maybe dollops of canned spinach or Progresso lentil soup, atop #2.4.  Then, season your chicken leg to taste (yes, while frozen).  If you want an idea, I like mixing ketchup and Woeber's Mustard with a few drops up to 1/4 tsp of Wright's Hickory Seasoning (sold here at a good price, in Amazon).  Then I spread it on the frozen chicken.  Or, I cover the chicken in Rajun Cajun (maybe you won't want that much spice).5.  Cover and nuke for 10 minutes.Great fast dinner.  The juices from the chicken soften both grapenuts and oatmeal just a bit, so they are like pilaf.  Faster, less mess than the 'normal' cooking prescribed, huh.

I bought 10 lbs of this coffee back last May.  It looks and tastes like your medium-roast commercial brands, but less bitter.  However, I think it's overpriced.  Back in May, they had too much left over, so it was priced comparably to the commercial brands.  However, if you can mix it half-and-half with the Italian Roast (which is a marvelous true dark roast), then you have a treat.  1/4 cup of coffee measure produces a strong brew of six 6oz cups, in a standard (i.e., Proctor-Silex or Black 'n' Decker) coffeemaker.  The Italian Roast would reduce the amount of coffee you need to get the same results, depending on how strong you like your coffee.  If instead you use Hisspresso, then you can reduce the measure even more.Have been drinking this coffee every day since May, at least a pot a day.  Flavor remains consistent, maybe because I keep the coffee sealed tight in plastic containers within the freezer (you know, the plastic containers which house Folgers or Maxwell House coffees).  It doesn't burn or taste burnt after a long time standing.Again, the claim that the coffee is Divine is either humorous marketing or chutzpah, but at the right price it really is worthwhile.  The bags are a pain, but sturdy, and the coffee always comes well-packed in boxes, so even the bags can be tolerated.  I put the five-pound (80 ounce) Vienna Roast in two 30-oz Folger's red cannisters, or Maxwell House blue ones, plus there is enough left over to fill up a 2-lb. Body Fortress Whey Protein plastic jar.  Could mix the Italian Roast in there (at least one pound per five) when transferring.

These socks fit skinny legs and small feet well.  In a man's shoe, I wear a 7 or 8, and these socks were the largest size I could get.  Yet they are too small;  for they are too cramped in the ankle region, because they are tube socks.  But they did stretch enough at the calves (say 16" or so).  Feel great, nice material, well made but because so cramped in the ankle (because they are TUBE design), you might find them uncomfortable.Pity.  The problem could be solved if they would make the 'one size' either more stretchy, or wider by maybe 1/8th inch?  Or, make a second size for men/women of shoe size greater than 7?

EDIT: this EDIT concerns the special features on the Ultimate Edition, which I just got.  (The original review is about the movie itself, below.)  The casing for the DVD set is very annoying, worse than normal DVDs when you try to remove each DVD without scratching it.  DVD quality is just like the movie shown publicly, or a tad crisper.  Nice to watch it, uncut.  Nice to be able to select scenes and rewatch, versus VHS.The Ultimate DVD edition (not blu-ray) has the following 'Bonus features' on Disc 1:  Production Notes -- which is merely one screen -- Cast and Filmmakers, DVD Newsletter, Recommendations, DVD-ROM Features.  These are extensive, designed to explain the backdrop of the movie.  The 'Cast and Filmmakers' section is not live, but rather little screen explanations about the cast, stuff you can learn better in imdb.  The DVD newsletter is a waste of time, as is Recommendations, other DVDs  you might want to purchase (Scent of a Woman and 12 Monkeys) as a result of liking Meet Joe Black.  The DVD-ROM features supposedly only play in your computer, but I've never had any luck activating those features in Win7, so if you have XP, maybe they will work, maybe not.  The screen says you need Win95 or higher.  I didn't try it on my Win98 machines.  So the Disc 1 features are pretty much useless on a DVD player.Disc 2, by contrast, has the original movie which Meet Joe Black updates:  'Death Takes a Holiday', starring (a very young) Frederick March.  It's in black and white, very 1930's, Alberto Casella's play put to film.  You don't get any choice of scenes, it just plays when you click on it.  Rather silly movie start, so Meet Joe Black is much more interesting.  Even so, the only way you can get the Death Takes a Holiday, is to buy this DVD pair.  But the older movie is well-made, technically.  Plot is quite different, of course.  Charming, in its own way.  In that older film, Death assumes the body of a living person, having made the deal with the Duke of the household, the night of the Prince's arrival.  Very theatrical, kinda hokey really.But the 'Spotlight on Location' is a live interview with Mr. Brest, the Director.  Very interesting.  So Disc 2 has these two 'features' which are worth the purchase.OH, for all you Greek drama addicts, you'll notice the 'yes' refrain that runs pan-movie, much like John's Gospel (in Greek) uses oude, ouden, outhen to signify 'no other' (thus proving inter alia, that YES the pericope adulterae is valid, right it sits in John 8 that begins and ends with a stoning) -- so this movie, uses 'Yes'.  Cute.  So nice, when real literary talent is incorporated into a movie script!Original review, follows below.  First paragraph was updated, to tie to the above text.=============The myth of Hades and Persephone is the underlying premise for Meet Joe Black, apparently keying off a line in the original film where the bride-to-be isn't quite ready to become a bride.  The wistfulness of Persephone, see.I can't watch it often enough.  Originally got it on VHS years ago, gonna get it on DVD, trying to decide which version.  Looks like I'll get the Ultimate US DVD set?  Of all the 20 formats you can buy here on Amazon, that one seems to have the most features, plus the original 'Death Takes a Holiday' on which this movie is peripherally based.  But the real origin, is in Greek mythology, Hades and Persephone.  Go read that first, and you'll get much more out of this A+++++ movie.Perfectly done in every respect, best film editing and camera work I can recall seeing in a film (okay, maybe Pearl Harbor and uncut Das Boot are as good).  Seriously.  If you pay really close attention upon repeated viewing, you'll notice the full-circle development of the characters, too (even the bit parts).  Death and Parrish reverse roles, by the end.  You got the puns, right (perish=Parrish=parish=par ish, given that 'ish' is Hebrew for 'man', and 'par' means 'by' in most languages)?Truly a work of art, this film.  Nice touch, that they don't take sides about which afterlife definition you should believe, but only that there is one.  Yeah, because that's the question of your life: what comes 'next'?  Gotta know that, to orient to 'now'.  Best of all, you realize that a superior being wouldn't necessarily despise you, and you wouldn't necessarily be intimidated by it/him/her.  So the 'sting' of regarding an afterlife (which people tend to religify, as if 'god' had to be a religious person) -- is removed.  Whew.For this, is a film you LIVE.

I got two of these cut onion packages.  They open like milk cartons, obviously for restaurant service.  Taste is like real onions, which they obviously are.  Longer strands and thick.  If you like French's Fried Onions, these taste just the same but without the added calories.  Not salty.  Good for snacking.  Am dying to make onion soup, now.  Instant can be had if you take beef base and add boiling water with these onions, let sit for maybe five minutes (or not, if you don't need them to soften).These will become a staple in my home.

A reviewer complained that she only received one pack of five, and since I've had a similar experience with other things, I ordered these with some wariness.  But I received 10, just as advertised.  The bands will be re-rated later for durability, after testing.

Some reviewers complained that they only got one pack of 8, and so I ordered to see if that would be true here, as well.  I got the same 16 as advertised.  How well they will last, I can't say.  Will rerate for durability.  Pending that, they are cute and colorful.

These 'flats' are just like ballet slippers, but wholly vinyl.  The sole is vinyl.  It's a good vinyl, so if your shoes broke and you had to go the rest of a trip or a day in these flats, you could and still they would be in good shape.  However, for size 9-10 the flats don't fit in the pouch.  Pouch is cute, good for a lot of small things, but the shoes won't fit well in it, at the larger size.  Maybe the pouch I got was meant for smaller shoes.In all, a good purchase, something to keep in your luggage or car or purse, easy to wipe clean.
Exactly as pictured.  I was surprised that they hold the hair so well.  Not particularly attractive, but functional.  Will add a star later if they prove to be durable.

Okay, since even Christian and Jewish Bible scholars NEVER get the facts straight, the movie's many inaccuracies can be forgiven.  Of course, when God tells a story (or if you don't believe in God, consider it just a fairy tale) -- you are expected to draw conclusions about what is not said, from what IS said.  All good literature requires the reader's mind interact with the text, and Bible is no exception.So what's great about this movie, besides the acting, is that the makers are trying to fill in what's not said in 1Kings Chapter 1-5, where the first part of the movie is told.  Yes, Adonijah (="My Lord is God") rebels.  It's a seven-year hiatus, with 1Chronicles 22-end explaining why:  David was not exactly gung ho to appoint Solomon, arguing the latter was 'young and inexperienced', during David's seven years of retirement when he designed all the Temple stuff and the priestly courses, service, etc. at God's bidding.  David is between age 70-77 when this happens, dying at age 77.  This latter fact, the scholars never get right, because they don't READ 1 Kings 1-5 to understand the clear chronology.  They read Josephus instead, who was seemingly unable to get even one date right!  So of course the 'contradiction' isn't blamed on the errant Josephus, but on Bible. What is a movie producer, to do?So the movie doesn't cover David's age, nor does it resolve the scholar errors in the Temple building chronology (for they misread Bible there, too).  Yet in Bible's timeline, David's age is critical to the whole: for the DEADLINE OF THE WORLD'S TIME, established in Moses' Psalm 90 chronology meter (in Hebrew, can't see it in English), was for Messiah to die 1000 years after David dies, and the outer limit of that time is traced by EVERY Bible book writer ANNUALLY.  Every Bible date 'hubs' to it;  because, the 'Jubilee' of the Millennium (Psalm 90:4) was SCHEDULED to begin 57 years after Messiah's death (sum of Passover and Pentecost in the Mosaic law was the reminder of that).  So once you know that, ALL the Bible's dates not only become clear, but you can prove them historically.  Since scholars make this 7 year mistake on David, therefore, all Bible dates 'seem' problemmatic, and have been debated, for centuries.  But it's the scholars who are wrong.  So it took me 10 whopping years to plot Genesis through Revelation dates to show what BIBLE says;  so anyone can vet Bible accuracy WITHIN Bible.  The numbers all balance perfectly, much as your bank balance must when you properly account all your transactions.  Thus you know you've got a right BIBLE interpretation.  (You can find that demonstration of Bible material balancing the dates, under 'brainout' in vimeo, or 'brainouty' in Youtube.)  For Israel was ordered to COUNTDOWN TO MESSIAH beginning in Genesis 5, which is why Bible seems so boring.  Why, people make movies, to work out what they don't understand.  As, here.Seems the movie tries to rectify the 1Kings scholar error, in the long speech repeated from 1Kings 1 between Max Von Sydow (playing David) and Ben Cross (playing Solomon), about 40 minutes into the movie (which is playing on my TV while I write this review).  That's laudable.  It tries to flesh out the hot political story of Solomon and his rivals.So a major flaw in the movie, is that SOLOMON HAD ALREADY BEEN CROWNED KING THE FIRST TIME but then David's support waned, so he got sick (as God commanded Solomon be enthroned, but David's bucking God); and thus Adonijah, started to gain support.  The crowning at Gihon is the SECOND crowning of Solomon, per Bible (ibid).  Else, the movie valiantly tries to interpret 1Kings 1-5, with great acting by all.However, after Solomon's second crowning, the movie increasingly departs from Scripture (i.e., alleging Nathan didn't marry, when BIBLE clearly states that Joseph and Mary descended from Nathan, for God promised they would NOT descend from Jeconiah son of Solomon), and (beginning two hours into the movie), goes instead to the many gossip books written about Solomon's alleged relationship with Sheba. Bible proves those gossips wrong, in the books Solomon wrote.  He wrote Song of Solomon about a common Shulamite woman, who he loved and lost; that book parallels world history, hence is a parallel spiritual lesson (i.e., God is your true love, don't 'marry' so many others and miss Him).Duh: no Queen would ever have a son out of wedlock and then go home.  In fact, scholars for the longest time couldn't even prove there WAS a Land of Sheba.  I forget when, but I think it was during the 19th or early 20th century that they finally found archeological evidence of that kingdom?Point is, from the Sheba story onward, the movie's all gossip.  Hence 3 stars, not five, because when someone claims to tell a BIBLE story, then the BIBLE ought to be consulted, not gossip.  Whether you believe the Bible is good or right or not, if you claim to talk ABOUT it, then READ it, k?  If I was making claims about YOU, whether you were good or not, shouldn't I consult YOU?  See: basic common sense and morality is violated if I go to gossips but NOT to you, and then claim what THEY say true, but what YOU say is ignored...Of course, no movie or documentary of the Bible ever made, but consults gossip, contradicting Bible with no compunction or morality, whether made by Christians, Jews, or anyone else.  Oh well.  Better to try and fail, than not to try?And yeah, the acting is wonderful, which is not normal for Bible movies.

Review covers Macademia and the Chocolate Peanut Butter flavor.  You get the box you see, which has 10 bars in it, wrapped in pairs.  The bars are small.  Pros are the portability, but the con is major: the bar crumbles as you eat it.  So you need to stand over a plate or sink to eat.The Macademia white chocolate is extremely sweet, so if you prefer that much sweetness, you'll like it.  Also, the Choco Peanut, which rather resembles Cocoa Krispies.  Not very chocolate-y, and I couldn't taste the peanut butter at all.  I put them in the freezer, hoping that they will become chewy and less crumbly.So the upshot is this: if you're into VERY sweet, you'll like these.  If not, crumble them up in non-sweetened cereal, for they taste just like heavily sweetened cereal.

These are comfortable, thick, stretchy yoga pants that are really cute.  The top of them has a large fold down flap that makes your stomach look slimmer.  Based on others comments, I got a medium even though I normally wear small.  These fit me like a medium.  The didn't run small for me, so mine are too big.  But, they still fit snug enough to be able to wear.  They are, however, extremely long.  I am going to see if I can shorten mine, otherwise, I am stepping on 6 inches of fabric.  Yes, they are 6 inches too long for me.They are high quality, nice, and comfortable.  If you are looking for a nice quality yoga pant, then give these a try.  They are worth the price!

The taste of this is good.  I hate fish oil, so I was very leery about trying this.  I can't taste any fishy taste, which is great.  It has a smooth, berry taste.  This is good in smoothies that you are already adding fruit to.  It is also good by itself.  I haven't noticed a difference, after a week of using it, so it may not work for you. The only way to know is to try it and see if it works.

This toaster is made of really cheap plastic. So cheap, in fact, there is a piece of plastic that is hanging next to the cheap plastic defrost button. I can't get it to come loose, as it is still attached. There is a scratch on the front of it. The plastic is warped around the metal portion of the toaster so it doesn't run straight along the toaster, which makes it look even cheaper. The buttons and knob are so incredibly cheap looking. This toaster isn't worth 45.00 dollars. It works, it toasts, but it doesn't toast well. It is cool looking on the counter, but that's about it. I wish it was better made because it is really cool looking.

This says refurbished, but mine looked like a brand new, never been used, humidifier.  It is large, but that also means that it holds a lot of water.  Mine didn't come with instructions, at all, not even a little sheet.  That is incredibly frustrating.  I was able to figure it out without them.  You pull the large gallon tank off of the unit, and there is a large cap that screws on.  Remove the cap, and fill the tank with water.  I didn't fill it completely, because I really don't need to run it today.  I only filled it to less then 1/4 full.  It works, even with that amount of water in it.You have low, medium and high.  Low barely does anything, high emits a substantial amount, and so does medium.  You can choose warm mist, however, I didn't notice any temperature difference at all when I switched this on.  So, that being said, the mist isn't hot, it is actually cool, which is good if you have children or pets.The entire thing lights up when you turn on the light, and it is a really pretty, relaxing blue.  You can put it on a timer to turn itself off after 4, 8 or 12 hours.  The dial on top allows you to point the mist wherever you want, and you can split it so you can point it into 2 different directions.I really like it!  I wish the warm mist was warm, but I still like it.  I love that the mist is a fine mist, and the humidifier is incredibly quiet.  I can't even tell that it is on.

This large sized freezer bag is perfect for slices of pizza that you might want to store in the fridge.  That is what I use them for the most.  Pizza always gets hard when kept in the pizza box, so I always put the slices in large, freezer bags.  The zipper, zips snug and doesn't come unzipped easily.  They have put the word "closed" on the bag so you can easily see if the bag is closed.  The plastic is strong, and doesn't tear.  Hefty is a high quality brand that I have always loved for their superb products!

I have been taking Vitamin D3 for years.  My doctor recommended it to me, because I was always tired in the afternoon.  This works!  I take it with Vitamin C, and that combination works really well.  This is a good quality Vitamin D3.  The softgels are small and easy to swallow.  I like it!

So far, this little water bowl works well.  My cat prefers the circulating type over the fountain type, because she doesn't like the water splashing on her face.  Because this bowl circulates the water, your water stays fresher longer.  There is a charcoal filter that the water runs through.Cats tend to drink less water then they need, and it is hard on their kidneys.  Kidney disease is the number one killer of cats.  My previous cat passed away from it at 15 years old.  Cats are able to concentrate their urine and store it in their kidneys for long periods of time.  This is what damages the kidneys.  When they drink more water, it keeps their kidneys flushed out.  It is best if you can get a cat to drink more water.  I let my current cat drink water out of the sink, or wherever she wants, as long as she is drinking.  It is also best to feed them wet food, because they get the water from the food.  I give her a mix of wet and dry, so she gets the best of both worlds.Fountains and drinking bowls like this tend to entice cats and make them curious.  They will drink out of bowls like this more often then they will out of a standing water bowl. If you are looking for a good bowl, this one is working really well so far. Mine hums, but not horribly loud.  I have it in the kitchen, so I can't hear it very well in the rest of the house.  The purple is a pretty color!

Bubbles!  I used these for a bubble bath, and they worked great.  A little goes a long way, and my bubbles stayed in tact, just like they do with other bubble baths.  You can also use these as shower gels.  I thought they all smelled great.  The scent doesn't linger long, after you use them.  They lather well, and a little goes a long way.  These are smaller bottles, but they will last awhile because you are able to use a small amount.  Give them a try if you are looking for some nice bubble bath!

My cat lingered a bit over the bowl, and then she dug in.  She likes this food, and the ingredients are really good ingredients.  I always look for grain free, because it is much better for their system.  My previous cat was fed Purina cat food all of her life, and she ended up with some really bad IBD issues in the last couple years of her life.  After researching, I discovered that her low quality food could have contributed to it.  I feed my current cat, and higher quality food now.  I also feed her wet and dry.  Feeding dry only is also bad for the cats system.This food is processed in Pennsylvania, but it doesn't say it is made in the US.  If it was, it would proudly display that.  They get their ingredients from somewhere else, and it doesn't say where.  That being said, it is up to you to decide if that matters.This is good food, and my cat seems to really enjoy it.  Nice job Rachael!  You have a winner here!

These are very nice, stylish cups.  I have been using them for years, and they work really well.  They peel off your muffin or cupcake with ease.  Our favorite team in Washington state is the Seattle Seahawks, and these blue cups match those colors really well.  I used the blue ones, several years ago, for a Super Bowl party.  They were a big hit!

I was looking for a lamp that I can use for cutting out iron-on appliques that I sell.  I need one with great lighting.  This one is perfect!  It has a very bright setting, and I love that I can change the light intensity from white to a more yellow, natural light.  I also LOVE that I can extend the arm of this light towards me, while I am sitting on the couch.  With my old desk lamp that sits on the coffee table, I had to lean way over and underneath it in order to see what I was cutting.  That makes for some sore neck issues most of the time.  This lamp will remedy that!The USB port in the back is great for charging my phone, and having it nearby in case I need to use it.  I also love how I can fold this lamp flat when I am done using it.  Since I have it on my coffee table, it takes up less space when I am not using it.  The top of the arm that holds the light gets warm, and so does the plug, while it is in use.  Not hot, but warm.  This isn't a big deal, as you can still easily grab it.I love this light!  I absolutely love that you can move it around to where you need it.  I also love the brightness and adjust-ability of the color. If you are looking for a light for craft use, this is perfect!

This microdermabrasion scrub smells fantastic!  It smells like Chai tea, which I love.  It scrubs my skin clean and leaves it smooth.  I wet my face, then apply it, while scrubbing gently with my fingers.  Then, I rinse my face with water.  It is hard to get all of them sandy particles off of my face, so I use a washcloth to follow up and remove what is left.  A little goes a long way, and you only have to use this once or twice a week.  Make sure that all of your makeup is washed off first, as it doesn't remove makeup well at all.  Give this a try if you are looking for a high quality scrub!

I am 42, and I have fine lines on my face.  I don't currently have any age spots.  I didn't notice a dramatic difference with this cream.  Perhaps, it is something that you have to use every night, for an extended period of time.  I have used it for a couple weeks now, and I haven't noticed a difference.  It is a thick cream, and a little goes a long way.  This jar will last you a very long time as there is a lot in here.  I see that others have seen positive results, so give this a try if you think it might work for you!

These earrings are very stunning, and they catch your eye as they dangle from your ears.  The blue's are pretty, and the silver shines.  They look high quality, but they don't look as expensive as they are listed on here. They are kind of hard to get in your ear, because of the angle that you have to have them at.  I think they are a great size!  I have a small head, and small ears, yet, these aren't too big.  They are also very lightweight, so they don't pull on my ears.  They are very pretty, and will go with multiple things that I own, including gray.  The way the clasp is made, they will stay in your ears, without worrying about them falling out.  They look exactly like the picture!  I just think they are priced too high for what they are.  I would, however, recommend them based on quality and beauty.
This pad added some shine to my apartment's stainless steel sink, but no more then when I just clean it with Dawn soap, and a green scrubber.  It is okay, it works, but it isn't anything special.

The bandage itself is really nice, and large, which is perfect for a leg, however, the clasp doesn't work.  I put the clasp on, tried to adhere it, and the clasp came off.  I tried folding the bandage over, several times, in an attempt to create a thicker piece of material for the clasp to clasp onto, and it still didn't work.  Every time I tried to stick it closed, the clasp came off.If Ace provides the traditional clasp with this, it would be perfect, but it's kind of useless without a clasping mechanism that works.

When I first saw this product, I snickered, as I'm sure most people did.  What a cute play on words!  Deja Poo!  Well, so now I am intrigued, and the positive reviews just intrigue me more.  I ordered some, and I waited for my opportunity to try it out.  Sure enough, the day finally came.  I shook the bottle, per the instructions, sprayed 3 to 5 sprays onto the toilet water, and did my business.  Wow!  This stuff works!  There was NO unwanted ODOR in my bathroom.  None.  All I could smell was the citrus scent that this variation puts out.  My bathroom smelled like a mix of oranges and lemon.If you are looking for a much better alternative to the typical bathroom spray, seriously give this a try!  I will be ordering this from now on, instead of the other stuff.  This really works, and it works well.  The only thing you will need to do, is educate your guests on how to use it.  You could attach a sticky note with instructions, in order to avoid that awkward conversation.

I have always liked the comfort and look of boyshorts, and these fit the bill!  They are extremely comfortable, and they fit perfectly.  They aren't too tight and are a tad loose, but not too loose where they show through slacks.  It almost feels like you aren't wearing underwear, they are that comfortable.  They are stretchy, and they don't cut into my skin, anywhere.  I have ordered 3 different sets of this brand, and I love every one of them.  If you are looking for some incredibly comfortable underwear, you need to try these!

This surge protector looks sharp with its metal construction.  The metal construction makes it look expensive, since we rarely see things made of metal anymore.  It is sturdy, and heavy, but not heavy enough not to be able to mount on a wall or flat surface.  The back of it is constructed so you can mount it, if you need to.  I ordered mine to use as an extra strip next to my couch, so I can plug a lamp and electronics into it.  I like that you can slide the plates over the unused plugs. There is a switch that lights up when it is turned on.  So far it works great!  I may be ordering a few more!

These towels are thick, yet easy to work with.  They are high quality, nice sized dish towels.  I was worried about the white, but then remembered that I can bleach them, so that made me really excited.  They clean really well, and wash up well too.  These towels absorb liquid really well, and wipe your counter clean, without leaving excess liquid behind.  I really like them!  I am going to order some in blue, which is the color of my kitchen.  If you are looking for a high quality, larger sized dish towel, then buy these!

My cat devours this food, like it is the best thing ever placed in her bowl.  The larger pieces are great, because it makes her stop and chew them, instead of swallowing them whole.  Science Diet is highly recommended by Vets, and even though I don't think that they are the best food on the market, they rank up in the top 10.  I trust this brand, due to the fact that they care for animals and they have very little, if any, recalls.  My cat doesn't care for the wet food by this brand, but she LOVES this dry food!

These are super comfortable!!!  I wear a size 5/6 and these fit perfectly.  They hug my body, but they aren't tight, so they don't cut into my skin.  The material is really nice.  They are kind of like workout material.  They do ride a little high in the back, but not much.  These are seriously so incredibly comfortable.  The price is great!  I am going to order some more.

This mascara coats evenly, without leaving that spider eye look.  It is a soft mascara that blends really well.  I didn't notice that it made my lashes look any longer then my usual mascara, but I really like the quality of this mascara.  It is easy to apply, and it stays in place all day long.  I didn't have any issues with it smearing or not drying quickly.  I usually use Rimmel Scandaleyes Retroglam Mascara, Extreme Black, 0.41 Fluid Ounce, but I like the Maybelline better, so when I run out of the Rimmel, I am going to switch.

This is a light conditioner that doesn't weigh my fine, thin hair down.  It isn't heavy so it doesn't leave your hair super moisturized.  Because of that, it can leave dry hair a little dry.  However, if you are looking for a light conditioner, then this is perfect.  It provides enough moisture to allow you to brush easily through your hair after you have washed it.  It also helps with the frizzies.  The scent is nice, and it rinses out well.  I like it!

If you have a day, where you just aren't going to have time to wash your hair, then this is the product for you.  It revitalizes your hair, as long as you don't have a lot of hairspray in it, or it is curly.  If I straighten my hair, then this product works well on it, the next day.  But, if I go with my natural curly, wavy look, using lots of hairspray, the next day, my hair doesn't respond to this as well.  The hairspray really needs to be washed out as it makes my hair unmanageable.

This product didn't do much to my hair.  Perhaps my hair isn't as dry as I thought.  I used it as directed, and I didn't notice a difference.  I am 42 and I don't have gray hair.  I do find that my hair is dry, but not horribly dry.  It seems that this works well for gray and dry hair.  If you are looking for something for that, then give this a try.  The price is nice, and others say that it works well.

This product helps eliminate frizz, but it weighs my fine, thin, curly hair down and make it hard to style.  I have a hard time getting the curl to stay in as it is, so I have to be selective about the product I use.  If you have thin hair, you might want to pass this one up.

I noticed a difference while using this product.  It helped remove the tangles, in hair that was moderately tangled after washing.  I sprayed it on, and brushed it through.  The scent is fantastic!This isn't a strong detangler, in that it really doesn't feel as conditioning as most that I have used.  If you have a problem with tangles that aren't very tangled, then give this a try.

I didn't notice any difference in my hair when I used this product.  It is supposed to make your hair shiny, and my hair wasn't any shinier then usual.  I have fine, thin, naturally curly hair.  This actually weighed it down slightly, and made it harder to style.If you are using this on straight hair, you might notice more of a difference, but I didn't notice anything on my curly hair.

I didn't notice any difference in my hair when I used this.  I have very fine, thin, naturally curly hair that gets weighed down easily if I am not careful about what product I use on it.  This weighed my hair down a little bit and actually made it harder to style.  I didn't notice any additional shine.It is supposed to protect your hair from heat damage, so if you blow dry daily, and are worried about that, then give this a try.  I see that it has gotten some really good reviews.  It doesn't work for everyone, but it might work for you.

I have always been a fan of Charmin, and this toilet paper is no exception.  It is a strong one-ply, basic toilet paper.  It lets off very little lint, in fact, it may not let off any.  It is easy to roll and it doesn't tear upon pulling.  I like this because people use less toilet paper when they come visit.  I have to use about 3 more squares than I do with a thicker TP, but, it is still less because these rolls are loaded, and those 3 squares equal about 1 of the Quilted Northern Ultra Strong that I compared it to.  As a habit, people tend to roll out a certain length of toilet paper regardless of the brand, kind or thickness.  There is less waste with this paper.I really like it.  If you are looking for an excellent one-ply, then give this a try!

I received this for free, in exchange for an honest review.  I always write honest reviews because I appreciate it when others do the same.This little gadget is great if you have a power outage, or you need some light while camping.  You can charge it by plugging it into a charger in the wall, or you can hand crank it.  It lets off a lot of light.  You can either expand it, or leave it closed.  By expanding it, you create the lantern which radiates more light.  If you leave it closed, it can be used as a quick flashlight.I wish it had something to hang it with.  The crank doesn't work, and there isn't anything that you can use to hook it onto something.  It has to set on a surface.  That isn't a big deal, but it would be nice, if you were camping, to hang this from something in your tent.It's really bright, and it has 2 settings where one is brighter then the other.  I really like it.  I have had 2 power outages this year, and both times I had wished to have something like this to take into the bathroom.  Now, I do!

I received this item for free, in exchange for an honest review.  I always give honest reviews, because I appreciate it when others do the same.This lantern doesn't just work for camping, it is really handy to have around the house.  You can use it for when the power goes out, or for some extra light if you need it.  It is rechargeable, so you don't need batteries.  Mine took about an hour to reach a full charge.  One side is magnetic.  I put mine on the fridge, towards the wall, which makes it convenient if I ever need it.There are 4 modes that get brighter as you press the button.  The last mode is a strob, which is helpful if you are stranded somewhere and you want someone to find you.  The button on the end changes the modes.This little gadget is handy, and the price is great.  I really like it!

The recipes in this book are written well and easy to follow.  They are normal recipes, that you can make with normal ingredients.  All you need is a Spiralizer, which you can get right here on good ol Amazon!  I think this book is great in terms of the assortment of recipes provided.  I obviously haven't made all of them, but the 2 that I have made, were easy to make.2 things I don't like, and 1 of them is a big one for me, is the fact that there is no nutritional information on any of the recipes.  Most books now tell you how many calories, fat, protein, etc, are in each recipe.  This book is completely missing that.  Because of that, I am giving it 4 stars.  I almost gave it 3, but the recipes look really great. I just wish they would have put the nutritional information in here.  That was a huge disappointment when I opened this book.  Not all recipes in this book are low calorie, in fact, many of them are made with butter and high calorie ingredients.I also don't like that there aren't photos of the finished product.  They wouldn't have to be color photos, even a black and white can show a person what the meal is going to look like.If the above things don't bug you, then get this book!  Get it anyway, the recipes look great, as long as you don't mind not knowing how many calories are in them.

This didn't really cover the redness in my cheeks, sufficiently.  I just have a slight redness. I don't have a skin condition, it seems to just be the natural coloring.  My cheeks are very smooth, but they have a redness to them.  I usually use Almay Smart Shade Concealer, Light/Medium, 0.37 Ounce Tube, and it works well.  I thought I would give this crayon a try, and see if perhaps this works better.  It didn't.  Even though it helped, the Almay concealer works better, and it's cheaper.  Perhaps this isn't the correct shade for me, I don't know.  But, based on effectiveness for what this makeup is supposed to do, I have to give it 3 stars which stands for "it's okay" because it was just okay for me.

This conditioner moisturizes without weighing my thin, fine hair down.  It coats my hair evenly, and rinses clean.  My hair feels conditioned, but not heavily.  The scent is wonderful, and it doesn't linger in your hair, which is great when you work in an office where you aren't supposed to where fragrances.  I really like this line.  I have tried several of the products, and have liked all of them.  Tresemme is a good brand.  Give this a try if you are looking for a conditioner that doesn't weigh your hair down.

Oh wow, I love this speaker!!!!  Seriously, this thing is awesome.  The sound is fantastic, and I love the fact that I can save presets.  The app is super easy to use and navigate.  I didn't need instructions to set this up.  It was so easy, I had to wonder if I missed something.There is a quick start instruction sheet that comes with it. That is all I needed.  I plugged it in, downloaded the app, it recognized it, and I was ready to go.  I LOVE that this version has Bluetooth.  I can play my Sirius radio on here, and it sounds awesome!  Not only that, but it tells me what it playing, on the screen, even for Sirius radio.  It tells me the station and the song.  The older versions weren't Bluetooth compatible, so if you are debating on which version to purchase, that might be your deciding factor.The volume range is huge.  I only have it turned up half way, and it is loud.  I live in an apartment, so I can't turn it up any louder than that.The remote has everything you need for the station you are listening to.  It is a basic remote with volume buttons, the skip buttons, off and on, the presets and the thumbs up or down button.  You can use Pandora and IHeart radio, as they are built into the app.  I was hoping it had TuneIn, but it doesn't.  It has local radio stations, but it doesn't have all of them in my area.  It is missing one that I frequently listen to.In order to set up the stations, you have to use the app on your phone.  If you want to listen to stations that you don't have saved, you will need to use the app.I was able to easily download the software onto my computer, to access my ITunes music.  I have Windows Vista, and it downloaded within a few minutes.  I couldn't believe it, but all of my songs and playlists were there in seconds.  It is perhaps the easiest and fastest software I have ever downloaded for a device like this.This speaker is awesome!  I love it!  I am beyond impressed.

I seriously love this device!  My cat loves the laser and she responds easily to my voice.  The picture is very clear, if there is light in the room.  I placed mine on an end table, so I can get a closer view of her.  I turn it on, turn on the sound, start calling her name, and she comes running.I have been playing with my cat, every hour or so, since I hooked it up yesterday.  I have showed my co-workers, and we have all gotten some good laughs at her chasing the laser and staring intently at the camera.  She knows my voice, but she can't figure out why it is coming out of this box.The laser has a lag on it, and it doesn't run smoothly.  That is a bit annoying, but it doesn't bother my cat, so I don't care.  I do wish that it moved better and that it actually stopped where you touched.  The dot on the screen is actually not where the dot is on the camera.  Again, my cat could care less so it truly isn't a big deal.The sound is really sensitive.  If you are in a room of people, and anyone is talking, it picks up everything.  The sound is loud, and there is also a lag.  It would be nice if you could adjust it so it wasn't quite so sensitive to everything it picks up.  Not a big deal, because again, my cat could care less.  It is all about the cat, you know!  In this case, with this device, it is.My hook up process was flawless.  I was up and going in about 3 minutes.  The app leads you through how to hook it up.  I have an iPhone 5S.Sometimes the video becomes pixelated and freezes.  One time, the laser didn't work.  I pressed the back button, opened it back up, and everything was fine again.It doesn't come with instructions.  You have the ability to let your family access it and play with your cat, if you want.  You can also set certain friends up.  I personally don't want anyone signing into a camera that I have in my home, without me knowing, so I didn't turn these features on.  You also have a "wall" that when you take a still shot, it gets posted there.  I don't like this feature, because I didn't know what it was.  I posted a still shot to Facebook, but it automatically posted to my Petcube wall, and all of a sudden I had people that I didn't know, liking and commenting on my photos.  Since there aren't any instructions, I didn't know about this.  Also, a couple people started following me.  I didn't authorize this.  I wish that you had the option to either agree or turn off this feature.You can view others cameras (if they are set up as public), and play with the animals.  There are several Humane Society type places that have set their cameras up as public.  Last night, I was playing with a cat that is in a shelter.  The cat was running around chasing the laser that I was moving, and having a great time.  I thought that this was REALLY cool.If I could make changes to this device, I would add the ability to record video, the ability to turn off the public wall and following option, and I would include instructions that covers the app.  The app was somewhat cumbersome to figure out, especially without instructions.Other then that, this camera is awesome!  Seriously, what a great idea!  My cat loves it, and I love playing with her during the day, while I am at work.  My cat is high energy, and sometimes has play aggression towards me when I get home from work. My vet suggested that I find something that she can play with during the day while I am away, so she isn't so aggressive at night.  This is perfect!!!  I can wake her up periodically during the day and engage her.  I am not a fan of long reviews, but there are so many cool things about this camera, that I had to share all of them!

This cream smoothes out those dry lines and cracks in your feet, and leaves them feeling very smooth.  I don't have a problem with the callouses like some do, my problem is the dry skin.  This lotion made my feet look smooth and hydrated.This cream is different.  It actually feels like you have applied a layer of wax on your feet.  That being said, it can also make them slippery, so be careful.  Your feet will slip around on slippery soled sandals.  Say that 10 times fast.Time will tell if this cream does a great job, long term.  For now, I am impressed.  It has a light scent that dissipates quickly, and a little goes a long way.  This container will last you awhile.

My cat loves this food.  She loves 4 of the different flavors of the Nutro dry cat food.  This is a favored brand of hers.  I can't lose when I pick one out.  She dives right into her bowl and devours every morsel.  The pieces are larger, which I like because it makes her chew them which makes her slow down her eating.  Grain free is my preferred feeding method for her.  Grain free is a better choice for cats.  I had a cat that got IBD as she aged, most likely because I fed her cheap Purina dry food.  I did research with my current cat, and I feed her higher quality food, now that I know better.  Give this a try if you are looking for a good, grain free food.

Your local drive-in theater is closing, and you and your 20-ish buddies decide to go to the last show, but one of you has to “sneak in” by riding in the trunk.  It is rather expected, after all.  And what’s the worst that can happen?  You get caught, and maybe have to pay for an extra ticket.  Except that this drive-in is located in Promise Falls, and in that bizarre little town, pretty much anything can happen.  Although nobody could have dreamt that the screen would blow up and fall onto the parked cars.  Was it a tragic mistake, or is there a mysterious serial killer at work?“Far From True” is about Barclay’s fifth book either based in Promise Falls, or featuring characters who found later their way to Promise Falls.  You needn’t have read all of them, but you absolutely *must* read “Broken Promise” first, or you’ll be totally lost.  “Broken Promise” was a pretty complete book, but with a cliff-hanger ending, and this book picks up where that one left off, just days later.  You get a couple of new characters in a milieu that was packed too full already, but the herd thins out quickly enough.  And again, there is an awful lot happening all at once, far more than you’d expect for the size of the place.  Some things are related, some aren’t … or are they?If you can keep all the players sorted out, you’re in for a fast-moving, suspenseful adventure.  Just about the time you think you know what’s going on, there’s a new (and probably disturbing) wrinkle that forces you to re-think everything.  Characters are all well-fleshed out, each being more, or sometimes less, than they seem.  Absolutely nothing is predictable, but while some things seem a bit far-fetched, nothing is unbelievable.  Barclay has a very light and wry sense of humour, that sneaks in when you least expect it.  It’s a “sticky book” because once it’s in your hand, it’s awfully hard to put down.Aside from being overly complex, my main complaint is this book ends in yet another cliff-hanger.  Is this the second in a trilogy, or will there be an endless series of cliff-hangers to come?  I really don’t want to wait a year for the next installment, only to find that I’m being strung along yet again.If you read and enjoyed “Broken Promise”, you’ll almost certainly want to read this also.  If you’ve never read Barclay, start there, and then decide whether to try this book next.

Before giving my impressions of this filter, I’d first like to decode the product description.  First, “XS-Pro” means this is a very slim filter, though it still has threads so you can screw another filter onto it.  “Kaesemann” is a filter manufactured by the Kaesemann company, now owned by B+W.  They are designed to be more resistant to damage from humidity.  “Circular” is a special type of polarizer, distinguished from “linear”; circular is the type you need to use on DSLRs.  “Multi-Resistant Nano Coating” provides a layer of protection against dust and water.I installed this filter on my Nikon 50mm lens and headed outside.  Note the standard lens cap fits over the filter just fine.  For landscape photography, it’s easy to use – on a clear, sunny day, just frame up your shot, then turn the outer ring until the blue of the sky darkens.  Turn another 90 degrees, and the effect disappears.  This doesn’t mean you should just leave it on all the time, because a polarizing filter costs you 1-2 stops.  The filter is also useful for removing light reflections, either through windows or water.  Just remember to *always* turn the outer ring as if you were screwing the filter onto your lens, otherwise you may accidentally unscrew the filter and drop it.Overall, this worked exactly as I would expect.  In my landscape shots, the blue sky darkened appreciably, and fall foliage colours became more distinct.  I’ve included sample photos to show the difference.  Because it was so bright out, I didn’t miss the stop of light at all.  This is a very high quality optic, and I would recommend it to anyone who wants a polarizing filter.

I was not immediately familiar with the name William E Butterworth III, but with some digging, I found that is the nom de plume of WEB Griffin.  I’ve read many of Griffin’s war novels, and on the whole, they are tightly crafted, well-written stories.  I was eager to see how he would handle a humorous romance novel.  After I got this book though, the writing style seemed awfully familiar, and not at all like Griffin.  After some digging, I discovered that Butterworth co-authored the MASH novels with Richard Hooker.  Well, not the original novel, rightly lauded as a satirical masterpiece, but he ghost-wrote the follow-on books like “M*A*S*H Goes to New Orleans”.  (Note this series is conspicuously *NOT* listed with the author’s other works inside the front cover.)  Unlike the original MASH, these are less tight, less focused, less satirical, less sophisticated, less mature, and track more along the lines of fraternity pranks and bathroom humour.  “Hunting Trip” reads like a continuation of that series.Butterworth makes it clear in an Author’s Note that this is not an autobiography, but a romance novel.  Perhaps not, but it parallels his wiki biography fairly closely, though blown up larger than life.  As for romance, there’s precious little to be found.  Lots of damaged adults rutting, musing on past rutting, or planning fiendishly to rut, but light on any romance.It’s also very dialogue-bound.  There is an awful lot of talking, but very little happening.  A lot of the talking is very repetitive and grows quickly annoying.  Most conversations are liberally sprinkled with “EXPLETIVE DELETED!!”  I’m not euphemizing here, he repeats those two capitalized words ad nauseum.  Character names are used for laughs in a juvenile fashion, with appearances from such illuminaries as Chauncey S. “Steel” Hymen, Bobby “Fender” Bender (auto mechanic), … it’s too tiresome to continue.  How many times do you suppose you would read the full title of “Lieutenant Colonel William ‘Don’t Call Me Bill’ O’Reilly” before the appellation got cut down to LtCol O’Reilly?  Well, at least 20, and it never does get shortened.Then there is a jarring disconnect with reality.  People and things appear decades before the actually did.  For example, our protagonist is flown from Germany to the U.S. in a C-130 in 1947; this aircraft didn’t enter service until the 1950s.  Poetic license is one thing, particularly with humour, but downright ridiculous is quite another.The book does have its moments, and gets funny in spots.  Overall though, unless you really miss those “M*A*S*H Goes To …” books, you may not like this one.

Thomas and Ciaran Devine have been released from juvenile prison.  Ciaran, the younger and seemingly more innocent of the two, confessed to the savage killing of his foster father, David Rolston.  He insisted that he had to, claiming that Rolston was sexually abusing his brother.  Thomas, the more visibly hard-edged of the two, had been jailed as an accomplice, and has kept clean since his release.  The two, as close as brothers possibly can be, are back together again, and really bad things are starting to happen.Feeling a bit melancholy yet?  The book is just warming up.  The entire cast has serious “issues”, whether physical, emotional, relationship-wise, or all of the above.  The detective who worked the case has a strange attraction to Ciaran.  The probation officer, newly and bitterly estranged, wants absolutely no part of the mess.  Rolston’s son has never gotten over the killings, and the shame he feels it has brought to his family, and would like nothing better than a measure of vengeance.  Here, Belfast is presented as a cheerless, dismal place, where hope has long since departed and happiness would be an unwelcome stranger.Make no mistake, this is a superbly crafted, well-paced crime drama.  Characters are intricately drawn, motives may be conflicted but are logical, and the suspense is nearly stifling.  I’ve read and loved all Neville’s other books, but this one is simply too dark and despairing for my taste.

After a 9-year hiatus, Du Brul’s iconic hero Philip Mercer returns for his 8th novel.  A mining engineer by trade, Mercer would seem to be an unlikely action figure, but he has a knack for being in the wrong place, at the wrong time, and then getting out of a jam using his wits and fists in equal portion.  Here, Mercer’s mentor and virtual stepfather is killed deep in a mine where Mercer has been working, and he arrives in time to watch the killers escape.  Can he jet across the globe, find them, and get the vengeance he needs?Even before he started writing together, Du Brul’s writing style was eerily similar to Clive Cussler’s.  Mercer and Dirk Pitt are not only cut from the same cloth, they are basically twins separated at birth.  This book reinforces the similarity of their styles, where the first chapter starts by fictionalizing Amelia Earhart’s fatal flight, then weaving that in with Mercer’s adventure.  This is the precise mechanism used in every Pitt story.  On the plus side, he avoids Cussler’s deus ex machina system of solving intractable situations by using variations of the word “miraculously”, or having Mercer drag himself across hostile landscapes with near-fatal injuries.Mercer’s comic foil, Harry White, was conspicuously absent in the first 7 chapters, and I was hoping this meant he had passed quietly away.  Sadly not; he figures less prominently than before, but he’s still an unnecessary distraction.  There’s funny, and then there’s obnoxious, and Harry falls out on the wrong side of that comparison.Call it a guilty pleasure, but it’s a fun read, even if it is a variation on the theme of the other books in the series.  If you haven’t read the rest of the series, no worries, you can pick this up as a stand-alone novel and not feel lost.

The wife and I occasionally like to sit out on the front porch and watch the world go by.  Unfortunately, the local mosquitos also like it when we do, and descend to grab a quick meal.  Rather than dousing ourselves with fly dope, we simply pull a fan from the garage and aim at the bench we’re using, which does a pretty good job of keeping the little buggers away.  This is an assessment of the Lakewood fan in that role.Turn it on “high”, and it’s *loud* -- like listening to a Cessna doing an engine run-up.  From 4’ away, normal conversation is simply not possible.  Curiously, turning it down to medium doesn’t change the airflow very much, but drops the decibels considerably, and makes the fan tolerable.  Also in terms of noise, the unit produces a very loud, annoying vibration sound.  If you push in on both grills, it goes away.  I tightened all the screws – some were pretty loose – but the noise stayed.  Then I stuffed some packing foam in between the grills and the body, and the noise disappeared.  It’s an easy fix, but one I shouldn’t have had to perform.The fan includes a set of wheels, which come in handy since the unit is a bit hefty.  There are two handles on top which you can use to carry it, or pull it along.  It’s a nice design feature, particularly if you’re moving this frequently.We had been using a Lasko 2265QM 20-Inch floor fan, which works pretty well and delivers a nice, soothing sound.  The Lakewood is noticeably noisier, and is less soothing to the ears, but moves a lot more air.  While the Lasko keeps most of the mosquitos away, the Lakewood is even more effective, at least until dusk.Overall this is a very good fan, and if it weren’t for the vibration problem, would have gotten 5-stars.

These wallets are a cheap way to keep your registration and insurance cards in an easily located spot.  If you have multiple cars, you now will be able to find those cards quickly (if the off-chance you would need to) regardless of which car you’re driving.  I would prefer a bright colour, rather than black, so they would be easier to see, but that’s a minor quibble.  Well worth the money.

Pro: This spreader works as advertised.  It puts down a nice even layer of whatever you load into the hopper.  Contrary to what another reviewer mentioned, when you set the control lever to “OFF”, nothing leaks out.Cons: The unit ships in two pieces, the handle and the hopper.  However, the instructions say: “This unit is completely assembled.”  That wouldn’t be a problem, since the only assembly involves attaching the handle to the hopper with two carriage bolts and wing nuts.  There was a bag containing the carriage bolts, a steel fitting, 3 phillips-head screws, and a very bent Allen screw.  But no wing nuts.  Hmmm.  I called customer service, and after a long wait, told the representative my problem.  She asked for the model number, which she insisted would be on the body or front page of the instructions.  It isn’t.  She asked me to e-mail her a picture of the unit, and said she would call me right back.  That was 2 weeks ago, and I haven’t gotten a call, e-mail, or the wing nuts.  I went to the local hardware store and bought some that fit, but I shouldn’t have had to.  I still don’t know what the extra pieces are for.There is another problem.  You can see from the picture at the top of the Amazon page that this unit sits back at a steep angle.  Well, it sits back so steeply that it will topple over at the lightest touch.  You have to brace this against a wall or chair while you fill the hopper, or it will tilt back and spill everything.  (Yes, I found this out the hard way.)Overall, with some care, this will work.  But the extra/missing/damaged parts, flaky instructions, nonexistent customer service, and poor balance convinced me to avoid ever buying anything else from this company.

Pro: Well constructed.  These socks feature a nice thick cotton which should last a long time.Con: Very small.  They are advertised as fitting size 6-12 feet.  I wear size 12, and these are tough to get on and very tight.  Unless you want compression socks, I wouldn’t recommend these to anyone with feet larger than size 10.

You’ll never meet Peter Caswell.  Not just because he’s fictional, but because he lives in the not-terribly-distant future.  Consider yourself lucky on that, because he tends to kill most people he meets.  He doesn’t remember any of that though, since he has an implant that erases his memory after every mission.  This allows him to be a very effective spy, able to kill with a clear conscience and no baggage afterwards.  He’s a pretty happy fellow, at least until his latest mission, which takes him to a near-clone of earth, where he has to kill a fellow Earther who’s trying to introduce modern – and lethal – technology to that world’s mid-20th century society.  But he picks up an unexpected ally in Melni, citizen in one of the world’s two factions, and then a very unexpected change in his mission.There are some old and new sci-fi concepts to be found here, but the central idea is well thought-out.  There are lots of novels about parallel worlds, but this puts an original and clever spin on the concept.  We get lots of detail about some nifty gadgets, as well as the locations, and the characters are very deftly handled and realistically fleshed-out.  The editor compares this to a James Bond novel, but that doesn’t quite hold up.  When things are moving here, the action is indeed fast and entertaining.  But a good part of the middle of the book just bogs down.  There are pages upon pages of Melni being conflicted about what to do, whom to help, and what ultimate ideal to support.  Of the 570+ pages, at least 150 should have been cut.  Yes, it’s important to understand the characters’ motivations, but a sci-fi/action book shouldn’t drag this much.So, this won’t be the best sci-fi novel of the year, but it’s still awfully good, and we’ve clearly not heard the last of Mr. Caswell.  Hopefully, the follow-on novel(s) will get some tighter editing and better pacing.

When you’re cutting plywood, you need a good way to guide the saw for straight cuts.  If you’re working in a shop, you can buy a table that’s purpose built for the job.  For DIYers, you’ll most often see a circular saw riding along a straight-edge guide.  People with deep pockets and a passion for precision can get a Festool track saw.  Bora offers another choice, the WTX saw plate.  You mount your circular saw to the plate, and then place the plate on top of a straight-edge guide.  You can use a Bora guide (not included) or virtually any other guide, because the plate is adjustable.  I thought this would be handy to use with my cordless saw on smaller outdoor projects, so I tried it out.First, you adjust the rail mount so it fits your guide precisely.  You secure it with two large Phillips head screws.  The downside of being so adaptable is, you’ll have it either too tight or too loose.  You want it snug, so the blade doesn’t drift while cutting, but too tight and it won’t move, or you’ll have to force the saw.  Next, you mount your saw to the plate.  There are two plastic clamps in front with slotted screws.  One of my slots was extremely narrow, making it almost impossible to tighten with the tiny screwdriver I had to use.  I found that you *must* align these clamps very carefully or they will pop out when you tighten them.  At this point, consider just how you’re going to ensure the blade is parallel to the edge of the jig.  You could cinch the blade up against the jig, but then you’re going to chew up the jig as soon as you turn the saw on.  You can set a thin, flat spacer in there if you have one, but it must be uniform thickness or the blade won’t be parallel.  Remember to remove the spacer before using the saw.  Now attach the back clamp.  Notice that the plastic front clamps bend upwards when tightened, and the back metal clamp bends down.  The plate is plastic and flexible, so when the back clamp was tight, it had distorted the plate and pulled the saw off of vertical.  This is where I started worrying about just how safe or useful this tool would be.Next, I clamped my straight-edge guide to a piece of plywood.  Here comes a slight problem – take a look at the product photo, and note where the straight-edge fits in.  The blade sits 5” from the left side of your straight edge.  That means you’re not going to be cutting down any small pieces with this jig.  I went for a tight fit and found the saw hard to push, but still found the cut to be imprecise.  I’ve cut down hundreds of pieces of plywood over the years using various guides, and I’ve never felt as uncomfortable or unsafe as I did using this product.  Not recommended.

If you own a drill press, you have probably built a jig to hold things down while you’re drilling them.  This vise is intended to replace your jig with a sturdier, more precise, and easy to use system.  Let’s head to the shop and try it out.First, note that this includes only the jig, but no instructions or mounting hardware.  You will need at least two t-bolts and knobs (star or t-knob) to hold this to your drill press – it’s inexcusable that they weren’t included.  If you don’t some laying around, figure another $5-10 for those parts, or buy an assortment pack since you’ll end up using them for other jigs eventually.Since there are no instructions, I went to the Bora web site for some mounting inspiration.  They show the jig mounted so the handle points away from the press (towards your torso as you operate the press).  I wanted to mount this on my Delta 12” tabletop drill press.  Unfortunately, the slots on this jig are 5 ” long, and 4 7/8” OC apart.  The slots on the Delta are 6 3/8” OC apart – uh oh.  I was able to rotate the jig 90º and use two t-knobs to hold it down.  Next I grabbed a dowel, which is the hardest thing to hold properly with most home-built jigs.  You can manually unscrew the vise to open it, or there is a button on top (not explained – no directions, remember?) that you can push to pull the vise apart.  It doesn’t work smoothly, and you usually have to “finesse” it to pull it out or push it in.  Also, the plastic handle pulls out and rotates down, so you can get extra leverage to tighten your work piece.  That doesn’t help when you’re trying to push the button and pull the vise apart.Having passed those hurdles, this jig now comes into its own.  You can tighten the dowel very securely without marring it, and move the jig until it’s centered precisely where you want it.  Once the jig is tightened down, it’s rock-solid, and you can leave it in place for repetitive drilling.Overall, this is well built, very solid and sturdy once mounted, very precise, and pretty easy to use.  If you own a drill press, this is well worth having.

It’s 1950, and America is still healing from WWII.  Despite the horrors of that war, there are still plenty of young men willing to serve in the military, even as the Cold War gains momentum.  One of them, Jesse Brown, coming up from the very humblest of circumstances, gets a commission and becomes the first black Naval aviator.  Assigned to the carrier U.S.S. Leyte, he soon finds himself in the middle of the Korean War, supporting the Marines by flying Corsairs left over from the ‘40s.  His tour is nearly over, and he’s preparing to return home to his family, when he’s shot down over enemy territory.  His wingman, Tom Hudner, can do nothing but circle overhead and watch Jesse struggle to escape from the cockpit as smoke pours out of the engine.  Unless he breaks the rules and takes an incredible risk.Don’t for one second think this is some dry history book, or stale war story.  This is a very carefully researched, and exquisitely crafted tale, which reads like a blockbuster novel.  Jesse and his squadron mates have to struggle with a dangerous new war, as well as cope with race relations in completely uncharted waters.  Events, places, and even conversations are laid out in lavish detail, but the pace never drags.  There are photos so you can get better acquainted with the players and aircraft, and plenty of maps so you can stay oriented.  Korea may have been the forgotten war, but you’ll never forget this story.If you can reach the end of this book without a tear in your eye and fierce sense of pride for the stars you’ll meet inside, well, you are one very cold customer.  In the introduction, the author puzzles over how to categorize this book, and decides to simply call it, “… an American Story.”  I think he got that right.

So, you’re David Harwood, and life hasn’t been treating you kindly of late.  Your wife is dead, and you quit your job with a major Boston newspaper to return home to sleepy little Promise Falls.  But on your first day back at the local newspaper, they go out of business and you’re stuck living at home with your aging parents and young son.  You have a cousin in town who recently lost her baby, and decided to head to the hospital to grab a handy replacement.  Fortunately, her mother runs the hospital, and quietly managed to sweep that little incident under the rug.  One day you head over to your cousin’s place to drop off some food, and find her there with a baby in hand, which she says was dropped off by an angel; and, there appears to be blood on the door.  What a day to be an out-of-work journalist!I have read three of Barclay’s other books and loved them.  They all have the right mix of edginess and suspense, an eclectic group of characters, and a compelling premise.  Here though, he tries to incorporate too much craziness into one small town.  Besides the murder and kidnap central to the story, we have a group of dead squirrels, a group of mannequins riding a mothballed Ferris Wheel, a rapist on the loose at the local college, and an assortment of other minor oddities, any or all of which may or may not be related.  Some things are never explained, such as what happened to David’s wife, though it’s left sounding like something bizarre and tragic.  And although many things are cleared up at the end, some are left dangling, in a fashion that suggests a follow-on novel.This isn’t a bad book, there are just too many pounds of “stuff” in the 5-pound bag, and things bog down amidst all the distractions.  If you’re already a Barclay fan, you’ll probably want to buy it.  But don’t let this be your introduction to the author, try some of his other books first and see for yourself how talented he really is.

Ben Sawyer is a cop with some problems.  His anger management issues got him fired from the Oakland (California) PD, and left him to retreat to his native Newburg (Wisconsin) to work for his father-in-law, who is the Chief of Police there.  Being a “keep it all bottled inside” kind of guy is causing increasingly serious issues with his wife, Alex, who has taken to hanging out in Newburg’s new coffee & book shop.  Which shop is coincidentally run by an attractive single guy who has rather caught her fancy.  One night, Ben and Alex get rousted out of bed, and Alex is arrested for murdering her supposed lover at the shop.  Will Ben give his wife the benefit of the doubt, and gamble his own freedom and the future of their son to find the truth?Like Ben, this book does have a few problems.  The premise is a bit far-fetched, which can ruin a book even in the hands of a competent author.  Fortunately, Griffin is a very gifted author, who can balance a lot of places and characters and cross-purpose motivations while spinning a compelling and addictive tale.  In fact, the characters are the real highlight here, exquisitely drawn and full of both freckles and warts.
